title: JH Platform Go To Market Product Manager Apprenticeship
description: We’re transforming how people engage with their finances and we’d love for you to be part of it. A Jack Henry apprenticeship gives you the opportunity to tackle meaningful challenges, contribute to innovative solutions, and make your voice heard. We encourage curiosity, thoughtful questioning, and bold ideas. As an Apprentice on our Product Go‑to‑Market team , you will help shape, build, and execute go‑to‑market strategies and product‑led growth initiatives for our Digital Banking Platform. Your work will empower financial institutions to fully leverage Jack Henry’s digital products, improving operational efficiency, elevating user experience, and expanding access for consumers. You’ll collaborate closely with product, design, and operations teams to ensure our release cadence aligns seamlessly with our Product Development Life Cycle (PDLC). Ultimately, your contributions will accelerate customer adoption and strengthen the ability of community banks and credit unions to compete in a rapidly evolving fintech landscape. We value creativity, thoughtful execution, and an open, collaborative culture. While our environment reflects the energy of a modern tech start‑up, we offer the stability, benefits, and long‑term opportunities of a large, publicly traded company. We also champion continuous learning and actively support open‑source engagement. This role may be performed remotely or from any Jack Henry office. Compensation is $25.00/hour for a full‑time schedule of 40 hours per week . What You’ll Be Responsible For Conduct research across Digital teams to understand business goals, system models, and customer needs, translating insights into compelling messaging that supports revenue‑generating product offerings. Contribute to naming, pricing, and positioning for new products and feature enhancements to ensure alignment with Jack Henry’s broader portfolio. Advance our product narrative by clearly communicating feature value and the benefits of new releases to customers. Build strong relationships with internal and customer‑facing teams to support a seamless customer experience. Develop trusted advisory partnerships with strategically selected customers and coordinate cross‑functional support to drive customer success. Assist sales teams by providing timely answers and resources for product‑related inquiries. Support documentation efforts, including platform performance updates, product insights and comparisons, and strategic storytelling materials. What You’ll Need to Have Background in product marketing, go‑to‑market strategy, or product‑led growth, with the ability to think creatively and strategically. Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to consult, present, and collaborate effectively. Experience working across teams and contributing to shared goals in a fast‑paced environment. Ability to self‑start, self‑serve, and work independently in a remote setting. title: iPay Call Center Representative CCC
description: At Jack Henry, we deliver technology solutions that are digitally transforming and empowering community banks and credit unions to provide enhanced and streamlined user experiences to their customers and members. Our best-in-class products are just the start as we lay the groundwork for the future of digital banking and payments. We hope you'll join us. We can't do it without you. The iPay Solutions Contact Center Product Support Representatives are responsible for providing unparalleled customer service with inbound phone and chat support to bill pay website/mobile application subscribers for all of our financial institutions. You will support customer education, site navigation, problem resolution, basic technical support, and ticketing requests. The calls or chats will primarily be from individual subscribers but could also be from financial institution representatives as well. This is a first call/chat resolution position that requires an individual to define the subscriber’s issue while using available resources to efficiently troubleshoot and resolve. The pay range for this position is $34,320-$37,500 per year. This is a remote position and candidates must live within approximately a 70-mile radius of our office locations in: Allen, TX; Louisville, KY; Springfield, MO; or Monett, MO. All positions, regardless of location, may require an onsite interview or in-person onboarding requirement to verify your identity. What you'll be responsible for: Providing timely product support by assessing, researching and/or resolving the issue in a single resolution. Maintaining a strong level of professionalism working to establish a positive rapport with every customer via call, chat, or case and using required security protocol to verify customer information. Documenting product issues and enhancements escalating information to leadership and complex customer inquiries or system issues for resolution to the appropriate recipient. Assisting customer with new account set up and performing maintenance for existing accounts. Actively participating in various group meetings including but not limited to team meetings, one-on-one discussions, and quality review sessions. Maintaining expected call center metrics. May perform other job duties as assigned. What you'll need to have: Minimum 1 year of customer service experience. (customer facing OR phone customer support) Must have the ability to communicate clearly and understandably. Must be able to work an assigned shift. Please note there is no flexibility or changes to this shift after it is accepted. Shift would be between the hours of 9am-10pm ET, Monday – Friday. An 8-hour shift will be confirmed if a job offer is extended. Must be able to work a training schedule for first 6 weeks from 8:00am – 5:00pm ET, Monday - Friday. Candidates will need to acquire (at their own cost) the following speeds to maintain a work from home status (Hybrid or full time remote). 20 mbps download speed 10 mbps upload speed* What would be nice for you to have: Call Center experience. description: At Jack Henry, we’re more than a technology company, we’re a force for good in financial services. We’re redefining how community banks and credit unions connect with the people they serve. Our mission is rooted in people inspired innovation, empowering financial institutions to deliver seamless, secure, and human centered experiences. We deliver cutting-edge solutions that are paving the way for the next generation of digital banking and payments, but our true impact begins with our associates.  If you're ready to help transform an industry and grow with a company that values purpose, collaboration, and excellence then we’d love to meet you. Acting independently, Sales Analytics and Insights Senior Advisor performs the analysis of key questions, sales performance scenarios, hypothesis development and testing, and modeling of recommended solutions, as well as interact with and communicate findings/recommendations/results to senior business leaders on behalf of the team. This position may be worked remotely within the United States, with the exception of California. All positions, regardless of location, may require an onsite interview or in-person onboarding requirement to verify your identity. What you’ll be responsible for: Design and automate Power BI dashboards and executive scorecards, transforming complex data models into actionable KPIs and compelling visual stories for senior leadership. Orchestrate monthly sales forecasting, annual budgeting, and quota-setting processes, while developing statistical models to support C-Suite presentations and quarterly Board reporting. Extract and interpret Salesforce CRM data to assess pipeline health, account activity, and sales productivity, utilizing scenario modeling to inform strategic decision-making. Analyze internal and external datasets to identify whitespace and market opportunities, collaborating with Sales and Marketing directors to drive go-to-market insights. Manage and optimize data pipelines to ensure reliable, scalable data flow across systems, integrating additional datasets beyond standard CRM/ERP sources. Enforce data governance standards to guarantee the accuracy, consistency, and reliability of all sales reporting and analytical models. Collaborate with Finance, IT, and Product teams to align on operational data, standardize forecasting methodologies, and deliver timely business solutions. May perform other job duties as assigned. Experience supporting large sales organizations (100+ reps) with complex, multi-product portfolios. Proficiency with SQL or similar query languages for handling multi-source datasets, plus working knowledge of Tableau to support legacy dashboard transitions. Deep understanding of advanced sales operations functions, including quota setting, territory planning, and complex forecasting methodologies. A proven track record of translating complex data into clear, actionable insights and presentations specifically for C-Suite and Board-level audiences. We are seeking strong organizational and planning skills and proven ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment. Assists in the creation and maintenance of the product vision/roadmap. May perform other job duties as assigned. title: Print Production Specialist III
description: At Jack Henry, we deliver technology solutions that are digitally transforming and empowering community banks and credit unions to provide enhanced and streamlined user experiences to their customers and members. Our best-in-class products are just the start as we lay the groundwork for the future of digital banking and payments. We hope you'll join us. We can't do it without you. Our Totowa, NJ Print Production team is thrilled to welcome a new Print Production Operator to our growing operation! This vital onsite role combines hands-on print work with technology-driven workflows, ensuring the timely production of premium notices and loan files under a strict one-day SLA. This position is based in a production environment , where you’ll be on your feet and moving throughout the day. We’re looking for someone who is detail-oriented, tech-savvy, and thrives in a fast-paced setting. You’ll work with large-scale printers and proprietary software to render statements, prepare documents for outbound mail, and maintain accuracy and efficiency in every print cycle. Flexibility during peak periods is essential, along with a strong understanding of print software and computer systems. If you enjoy working in a deadline-driven environment and value precision and teamwork, this is the perfect opportunity for you! This is an onsite position at our Totowa, NJ print facility and offers a competitive salary range of $33,571–$48,328 , based on experience. What you’ll be responsible for: Prints statements, high volume, or time sensitive statements, and resolves "cripple" statements following established procedures. Prints statements and images according to established procedures, and reviews print file match inventory. Troubleshoots equipment errors, and arranges for outside maintenance services calls if necessary. Sends and receives file transmissions if necessary. Prepares and distributes outgoing mail. Sends and receives courier parcels, and distributes incoming items. Records inbound and outbound items. Compiles postage tracking reports for accounting purposes. Maintains an appropriate inventory of supplies used to perform duties. Will be in a production-based environment where there is extended periods of standing and moving around from machine to machine. Performs other duties as assigned. What you’ll need to have: Minimum of 2 years of experience in document composition software and print production workflows, with a solid understanding of print center operations. Exceptionally organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. Proven experience working in print centers or similar production environments. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams. Strong technical proficiency, including the ability to quickly learn and adapt to new software and proprietary systems. Demonstrated ability to prioritize, coordinate, and oversee multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, ensuring deadlines are consistently met. Must have the ability to work in a production based environment with extended periods of standing and moving between equipment. This team provides high-level analysis and operational support to the leaders of our customer institutions, which necessitates a high level of attention to detail and customer service. title: Scala Software Engineer III
description: The Jack Henry Digital Team is redefining the relationship between forward-thinking financial institutions and their customers. Jack Henry Digital leverages modern technology and an industry-leading product vision to make user-friendly mobile and web apps. We have a first-class API; the same API our web and mobile apps use is the same API that is open to the community to build on top of and extend. This role participates and works with our team to build Jack Henry's next generation of services that power a set of critical domains.  These services ultimately power Jack Henry's Open API and our online and mobile banking products. Jack Henry's APIs are first-class citizens and are consumed by both internal teams and organizations outside of Jack Henry Digital. About Jack Henry Digital This team is constantly keeping your services up to date with the newest development, deployment, and release practices to offer exciting user experiences with highly secured data. Your team also collaborates with other Jack Henry Digital teams to build tools and processes that help scale our rapidly growing platform. We are committed to creativity, thoughtfulness, culture, and openness—the perfect place to make phenomenal products that have a big impact. Our work environment echoes a modern tech startup, but we have the security and benefits of a large, publicly traded company. With an engineering team of talented individuals, we place a high value on continued education and contribute to and use open-source projects. Our team is highly distributed, meaning you will work with kind, talented individuals from across the United States. You’ll get the chance to choose your own tools, work with bleeding-edge web technologies across the stack and contribute to products that are used by thousands of people. We are looking for a mid-level Scala Software Engineer to join our Jack Henry Digital Team that is redefining the relationship between forward-thinking financial institutions and their customers. JH Digital leverages modern technology and the industry leading product vision to make user-friendly mobile and web apps. We have a first-class API; the same API our web and mobile apps use is the same API that is open to the community to build on top of and extend. Our team is highly distributed, meaning you will work with kind, talented teams from across the United States. As a mid-level Scala Software Engineer, you will get the chance to choose your own tools, work with bleeding edge web technologies across the stack, and contribute to products that are used by thousands of people. You will participate and work with our team to build JH Digital's next generation of services that power a set of critical domains. These services ultimately power JH Digital's Open API and our online and mobile banking products. JH Digital's APIs are first-class-citizens and are consumed by both internal teams and organizations outside of JH Digital. The successful candidate is infinitely curious and thrives in an environment that promotes constantly learning and growing. You want to be somewhere that surrounds you with other great engineers that drive you to be better every day. Although you work in a team you are self-motivated and able to work with independence. You want to own the deliverable from working with the product manager to define the scope all the way through supporting your work in production. You care deeply about your work, your team, and the end user. This position may be worked remotely within the United States, with the exception of California. All positions, regardless of location, may require an onsite interview or in-person onboarding requirement to verify your identity . Must be able to travel up to 5% to attend onsite meetings or trainings . What you’ll be responsible for: Complete product technical design and prototyping, software development, bug verification, and resolution. Perform system analysis and programming activities that require research. Provide technical/engineering support for new and existing applications from code delivery until the retirement of the application. Provide reasonable task and project cost/effort estimates. Collaboratively work with QA, TBA, and Product team to ensure timely delivery of high-quality products. Collaboratively work with the customer support team to resolve or diagnose defects. Building, testing, deploying, maintaining, and scaling backend services using Scala, relational databases (Postgres), event streaming (Kafka), and more. Working with your engineering teams to identify needs, prioritize and plan work, and develop solutions that keep pace with product development. Gaining a deep and comprehensive understanding of specific banking-related domains your team owns and working with and understanding how changes in those domains impact products. A sense of ownership of your deliverables, from working with the product manager to define the scope, all the way through supporting your work in. May perform other job duties as assigned. What you’ll need to have: Minimum 4 years of professional experience in software engineering. Minimum of 2 years of back-end programming/development experience. A minimum of 1 years of experience with Scala programming. Experience in maintaining and supporting production systems. Self-motivation and ability to work with independence. What would be nice for you to have: Bachelor’s degree in computer science. Experience with functional programming. Experience using the Typelevel Stack (http4s, doobie, cats, cats-effect). Experience working with Microservices Architecture. Experience with Continuous Integration Pipelines. Experience with observability and monitoring. Experience with PostgreSQL or other relational databases. Experience with Kafka and event-based systems. Experience with Docker and Kubernetes (PaaS/Container orchestration platform). description: At Jack Henry, we’re more than a technology company; we’re a force for good in financial services. Our mission is rooted in people-inspired innovation, empowering financial institutions to deliver seamless, secure, and human-centered experiences. We deliver cutting-edge solutions that are paving the way for the next generation of digital banking and payments, but our true impact begins with our associates. If you're ready to help transform an industry and grow with a company that values purpose, collaboration, and excellence, then we’d love to meet you. We are seeking a Salesforce Delivery Manager to join the Salesforce team that supports the transition to the Salesforce platform. In this role, you will be responsible for building and leading the technical team responsible for our Salesforce Service and Experience Clouds. The successful candidate has extensive experience with the Salesforce platform and is able to establish documented processes and standards for their team.  They have outstanding leadership skills and ready to guide their team through the transition. This position can be based to work remotely within the US with the exception of California. All positions, regardless of location, may require an onsite interview or in-person onboarding requirement to verify your identity. Salary range for this position is position is $123-180k, depending on candidate experience and geographic location, What you'll be responsible for: Provide guidance, mentor, train, and delegate responsibilities to direct reports enabling their professional growth and development. Direct, design, and implement a comprehensive product management strategy for Salesforce Service and Experience Clouds from product definition and planning through production and release. Ensure that products meet specifications and quality goals. Manage accurate tracking of statistics of product adoption by customer base and translates feedback into enhancement recommendations. Serve as a SME within the user community (e.g., focus groups, ESP, customer fact finding, etc.) Review alpha and beta program definitions and oversee execution. Oversee a smooth turnover to implementation or support organizations. Provide resources for standard demonstrations, occasional participation in customer demonstrations, and to internal sales. May perform other job duties as assigned. What you'll need to have: Minimum of 7 years of professional experience in technical leadership. Minimum of 5 years of experience implementing and enhancing Salesforce Service Cloud. Minimum of 3 years of experience implementing and enhancing Experience Cloud. Experience leading support teams through migration to Salesforce. Minimum of 3 years’ hands-on experience with CI/CD, DevOps, and/or pipelining in a Salesforce environment. Minimum of 3 years of experience leading and delivering using Agile Methodologies. Ability to work collaboratively with stakeholders across the organization. Must have at least 1 current Salesforce certification. Ability to travel up to 15% to attend JH meetings, trainings, and/or professional conferences. What would be nice for you to have: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, IT, Management, or Business. Current SAFe Certification. title: Sales Executive
description: At Jack Henry, we’re more than a technology company, we’re a force for good in financial services. We’re redefining how community banks and credit unions connect with the people they serve. Our mission is rooted in people inspired innovation, empowering financial institutions to deliver seamless, secure, and human centered experiences. We deliver cutting-edge solutions that are paving the way for the next generation of digital banking and payments, but our true impact begins with our associates.  If you're ready to help transform an industry and grow with a company that values purpose, collaboration, and excellence then we’d love to meet you. As a Sales Executive for Jack Henry, positioning Gladiator solutions, you will work remotely from a home office, and develop relationships and close sales opportunities with both new and existing commercial banks, credit unions and non-bank finance companies by leveraging relationships, utilizing face-to-face calls, Microsoft Teams - phone presentations and other creative approaches.   In addition to your own prospecting efforts, leads are provided through internal marketing, joint calling with other company divisions, strategic partnerships and trade show opportunities. With over 10,000 Banks & Credit Unions in the United States that are potential targets for our product suite, the opportunity for sales to Financial Institutions (FI’s) throughout the US is significant. In the present banking environment, there is tremendous demand for innovative IT network, security and compliance solutions that help FI’s improve their efficiencies and technology strategies.  Our products meet these needs with the top selling solutions in the country. This is an individual contributor sales position with Jack Henry that can be based remotely throughout the United States, with the exception of California.  Due to growth, we are hiring for the Central United States territory. The ideal Sales Executive candidate will live in the Central region of the United States; however greater consideration will be given to qualification rather than home base. All positions, regardless of location, may require an onsite interview or in-person onboarding requirement to verify your identity. What you’ll be responsible for: Self-motivated, responsible over-achiever with a robust contact list. Actively prospect to C-Level members of banks, credit unions and non-bank finance companies to gain interest in our suite of products. Maintain accurate contact management records of all activity in CRM system. Meet quota levels. Strong proficiency with Word, PowerPoint, Excel and a robust CRM system such as Salesforce.com. May perform other job duties as assigned. What you’ll need to have: Minimum of 10 years’ experience of technology solution sales. Bachelor’s degree or 8 years of additional experience in technology solution sales. Minimum of 5 years quota driven sales experience. Experience selling to C-Level prospects and clients. Required travel – 40%. What would be nice for you to have: Experience working with community banks or credit unions. Deep understanding of networks, security and compliance solutions. General understanding of FI regulations and their governing bodies. A demonstrated proficiency in marketing and cold call lead and sales generation. Experience working within a deadline driven environment and a demonstrated sense of urgency. Ability to develop and maintain strong client relationships within all levels of the organization. Ability to network and team with both internal and outside sales organization for the benefit of meeting sales quota. Professional demeanor, outstanding written and verbal communication skills. description: At Jack Henry, we’re more than a technology company, we’re a force for good in financial services. The Jack Henry Banking Senior Account Executive position is a highly strategic and performance-driven position. Unlike a traditional sales role, this position carries elevated responsibilities and expectations. Personal leadership is paramount.  How you conduct yourself daily will directly impact sales productivity and long-term success. You will be evaluated across three key categories: Skills, Traits, and Results . This role requires sustainable leadership qualities as you navigate complex sales campaigns involving multiple stakeholders.   The Senior Account Executive is focused on overseeing our banking core processing customers and is directly responsible for the ongoing business relationship with existing Jack Henry Banking clients which includes: Providing account oversight, serving as a primary set of eyes on the assigned customer base, striving to understand the customers’ strategic initiatives, as well as working to align the appropriate Jack Henry resources consistent with identified initiatives. This is a remote position that will be responsible for accounts located across Northeastern Pennsylvania, New Jersey, New York, Massachusetts, Connecticut, Rhode Island, and Washington DC.  Candidates must reside within this geographic area. All positions, regardless of location, may require an onsite interview or in-person onboarding requirement to verify your identity. What you’ll be responsible for: 50% - On-site sales calls to existing JHA clients promoting assigned JHA Products and Services as well as new business development prospecting to non-JHA Core Institutions below $2.75 Billion in assets. 30% - Territory and account plan development to ensure annual sales plan objectives are achieved. 20% - Administrative and Account responsibilities including forecasting, opportunity management, product education as well as client liaison during any problem escalation. May perform other job duties as assigned. What you’ll need to have: A minimum of 3 years’ experience selling in a financial services environment. A thorough understanding of the selling processes acquired through previous work experience (i.e. something to relate to and serve as a basis for tracking success in this role). Detail oriented, solid organizational and analytical skills as well as the ability to formulate strategies to solve complex problems. Up to 50% travel required for this role. Solid communication skills; both verbal and written are critical to success in this role. What would be nice for you to have: Bachelor’s degree. Direct working experience in the financial services industry. A reasonable understanding of the Gartner or Challenger Selling models that includes “getting results through others” by being proactive, consistently showing up, identifying and qualifying sales opportunities, facilitating introductions, and collaborating with Product Sales Executives to expand mutually beneficial business relationships. title: Scala Software Engineer
description: At Jack Henry, we deliver technology solutions that are digitally transforming and empowering community banks and credit unions to provide enhanced and streamlined user experiences to their customers and members. Our best-in-class products are just the start as we lay the groundwork for the future of digital banking and payments. We hope you'll join us. We can't do it without you. The Jack Henry Digital Team is redefining the relationship between forward-thinking financial institutions and their customers. Jack Henry Digital leverages modern technology and an industry-leading product vision to make user-friendly mobile and web apps. We have a first-class API; the same API our web and mobile apps use is the same API that is open to the community to build on top of and extend. The Software Engineer participates and works with our team to build Jack Henry's next generation of services that power a set of critical domains.  These services ultimately power Jack Henry's Open API and our online and mobile banking products.  Jack Henry's APIs are first-class citizens and are consumed by both internal teams and organizations outside of Banno. This position may be worked remotely within the United States, with the exception of California. Ability to travel up to 5% to attend JH meetings, trainings, and/or professional conferences. What you’ll be responsible for: Building, testing, deploying, maintaining, and scaling backend services in a micro-services architecture using a modern high level programming language such as Scala, relational databases (Postgres), event streaming (Kafka), and more. Working with your engineering teams to identify needs, prioritize and plan work, and develop solutions that keep pace with product development. Gaining a deep and comprehensive understanding of specific banking-related domains your team owns and working with and understanding how changes in those domains impact products. Participating with customer support teams to resolve or diagnose defects and issues. May perform other job duties as assigned. What you’ll need to have: Minimum of 4 years of programming experience, including experience in Typelevel Scala. Minimum 1 year of experience in maintaining and supporting production systems. Experience with any or all of the following: continuous integration pipelines, observability and monitoring, PostgreSQL or other relational databases, Kafka and event-based systems, Docker and Kubernetes (PaaS/Container orchestration platform). Self-motivation and ability to work with independence. Will be required to work on call hours of a 1 week rotation every 5 weeks. What would be nice for you to have: Bachelor’s degree in computer science. Experience working in a microservices architecture. title: Senior Financial Analyst Revenue and Financial Systems
description: At Jack Henry, we deliver technology solutions that are digitally transforming and empowering community banks and credit unions to provide enhanced and streamlined user experiences to their customers and members. Our best-in-class products are just the start as we lay the groundwork for the future of digital banking and payments. We hope you'll join us. We can't do it without you. We are seeking a Senior Financial Analyst / Business Partner (Revenue and Financial Systems) to support our Finance Platforms line of support. This role will join the Finance Platforms team and focus on learning and documenting current processes in our PeopleSoft system, including annual budgeting, monthly forecasting, expense analysis, report compilation, and ad‑hoc data analysis. The position will also play a key role in educating others on future‑state best practices and maintaining functional ownership of the ERP FP&A applications once implementation is complete. We are targeting an individual with strong Revenue and full P&L experience. Building effective relationships with business unit leaders is essential for success. If this aligns with your background and interests, we would be excited for you to apply. Thank you for your consideration. This position is a hybrid role requiring you to come into the office as requested by the hiring manager out of one the following office locations: Allen, TX / Lenexa, KS / Monett, MO or Springfield, MO. This position will have a salary range of $72,700 – $120,000 based on experience and location. What you'll be responsible for: Collect, analyze, and interpret complex expense data to identify trends, opportunities, and risks. Develop actionable insights that support strategic decision-making and cost optimization. Build and maintain sophisticated models that forecast expense tracking & analysis within segments, lines of business, and products. Prepares and may present management reporting packages to senior management team and provide recommendations to management based on analysis. Will transform complex financial data into user-friendly, easy-to-understand charts, graphs, and other visualizations. Collaborate closely with FP&A teams to gain a deep understanding of existing processes, gather feedback, and deliver data-driven insights that support monthly, quarterly, and year-end reporting. Maintain and enhance internal reporting tools and systems. Identify opportunities to automate and streamline expense reporting processes, and support implementation of new analytics technologies. May perform other job duties as assigned. What you'll need to have: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or Business Administration. Must have a minimum of 6 years of experience within any of the following finance categories: Corporate Finance, data visualization, process documentation, FP&A. CAPEX management. Advanced level experience with MS Excel (build financial models). Advanced level experience with PowerPoint to develop and execute executive level presentations. Ability to effectively plan, prioritize, and organize a diversified workload to meet aggressive deadlines. Strong business acumen and desire to strengthen knowledge of the business/industry. Must be able to work outside business hours and occasional weekends as needed to support business needs. Ability to make recommendations to improve efficiency of processes and procedures. Able to work with confidential materials and maintain confidentiality at all times. Ability to travel up to 10% to attend team meetings, trainings, and/or professional conferences. What would be nice for you to have: PMP certification. Experience working in a Senior Financial Analyst role specifically focused on revenue and expense analytics. Experience working with OneStream, Zoura, Power BI, and Peoplesoft. Proficient in creating special reporting, interactive dashboards, financial modeling, or executive presentations. Experience in a Financial or Technology Services organization. If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this opportunity. title: Senior Product Manager of Go To Market at Jack Henry
description: At Jack Henry, we’re more than a technology company, we’re a force for good in financial services. We’re redefining how community banks and credit unions connect with the people they serve. Our mission is rooted in people inspired innovation, empowering financial institutions to deliver seamless, secure, and human centered experiences. We deliver cutting-edge solutions that are paving the way for the next generation of digital banking and payments, but our true impact begins with our associates.  If you're ready to help transform an industry and grow with a company that values purpose, collaboration, and excellence then we’d love to meet you. We’re reinventing the way people interact with their finances, and we could use your help. Working at Jack Henry offers you a chance to think about and solve fascinating, important problems. Here, everyone has a voice, a chance to ask tough questions, and an opportunity to innovate. As a Senior Go-To-Market (GTM) Product Manager for the Origination and Financial Crimes teams, you’ll be responsible for developing and executing go-to-market strategies for launching new products or features as part of our complementary services group. You will focus on helping customers harness the power of Jack Henry products, which drive financial institutions’ success by improving personnel productivity and by making their banking solutions more accessible to the consumer. This role involves working cross-functionally with product development, design, marketing, sales, and operation teams to ensure that our products meet market needs and achieve business objectives. In short, your work will directly benefit Jack Henry customers, end users, and internal teams, ultimately accelerating customer adoption and empowering community banks and credit unions to compete with fintech giants. We are committed to creativity, thoughtfulness, culture, and openness—the perfect place to make phenomenal products that have a big impact. Our work environment echoes a modern tech start-up, but we have the security and benefits of a large, publicly traded company. We place high value on continued education and contribute to, and use, open-source projects. This position may be worked remotely within the United States, with the exception of California. All positions, regardless of location, may require an onsite interview or in-person onboarding requirement to verify your identity. Must be able to travel up to 15% to attend onsite meetings or trainings. What you’ll be responsible for: Develop and implement comprehensive GTM strategies for new and existing products or features. Conduct well-rounded research to understand business goals, systems models, and customer models to create messaging that speaks to customers’ goals and promotes revenue-generating product offerings. Drive our ever-evolving product story forward through communication of our features and the benefits of new products to customers. Build and maintain close relationships with all customer-facing and internal teams to ensure a seamless customer experience. title: Senior Financial Analyst
description: At Jack Henry, we deliver technology solutions that are digitally transforming and empowering community banks and credit unions to provide enhanced and streamlined user experiences to their customers and members. Our best-in-class products are just the start as we lay the groundwork for the future of digital banking and payments. We hope you'll join us. We can't do it without you. We have an immediate need for a talented, data-driven Senior Financial Analyst to become an integral part of our Decision Support team. This role works closely with Jack Henry’s finance leadership to dive deep into revenue and cost analysis, build efficient processes to consolidate financial information, and develop insights that summarize current results with an eye toward future impact.  The ideal candidate will have exceptional communication skills, be a team player, and be ready to join a fast-paced, growth mindset environment. Your Impact: Utilize your analytical prowess to dissect and understand the intricacies of revenue and expenses, delivering insights that drive business decisions. Take charge of financial consolidation with a keen eye for detail and a commitment to accuracy. Drives business performance by providing actionable financial insights and supporting operational decisions. Be the go-to expert for process enhancements, streamlining our financial operations with your innovative solutions. Bring your creative spirit while developing unforgettable executive presentations that tell the story of our business. Lead special projects, showcasing your ability to manage complex tasks. This position is hybrid and may be located in any of the following locations: Allen, TX / Lenexa, KS / Monett, MO or Springfield, MO.  You will be required to come onsite at least 1 time per week for corporate events, team meetings or collaboration sessions. The remainder of the time, you are able to work remotely from home. This position will have a salary range of $72,700 – $105,000 based on experience and location. What you'll be responsible for: Collect, analyze, and interpret revenue & expense data to identify trends, opportunities, and risks. Develop actionable insights that support strategic decision-making and optimization. Build and maintain sophisticated models and templates that forecast financial performance within segments, lines of business, and products. Prepares and presents reporting packages to senior management team and provide recommendations to management based on analysis. Will transform complex financial data into user-friendly, easy-to-understand charts, graphs, and other visualizations. Collaborate closely with FP&A teams to gain a deep understanding of existing processes, gather feedback, and deliver data-driven insights that support monthly, quarterly, and year-end reporting. Maintain and enhance internal reporting tools and systems. Identify opportunities to automate and streamline revenue reporting processes, and support implementation of new analytics technologies. May perform other job duties as assigned. What you'll need to have: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or Business Administration. Must have a minimum of 6 years of experience within any of the following finance categories: Corporate Finance, FP&A, or Finance Operations.  Experience within a consolidated reporting environment is a plus. Advanced level experience with MS Excel (build financial models). Advanced level experience with PowerPoint to develop and execute executive level presentations. Ability to effectively plan, prioritize, and organize a diversified workload to meet aggressive deadlines. Strong business acumen and desire to strengthen knowledge of the business/industry. Must be able to work outside business hours and occasional weekends as needed to support business needs. Ability to travel up to 10% to attend team meetings, trainings, and/or professional conferences. What would be nice for you to have: Experience working in a Senior Financial Analyst role specifically focused on revenue and expense analytics. Ability to collaborate with non-financial stakeholders (e.g., Sales, Operations, HR) to align financial objectives with business unit priorities. Experience working with OneStream, Tableau, Power BI, and Peoplesoft. Proficient in creating special reporting, interactive dashboards, financial modeling, or executive presentations. Experience in a Financial or Technology Services organization. Ability to make recommendations to improve efficiency of processes and procedures. Able to work with confidential materials and maintain confidentiality at all times. If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this opportunity. description: At Jack Henry, we’re more than a technology company, we’re a force for good in financial services. This role ensures that multi-cloud, multi-org, and multi-integration implementations are architected for scale, compliance, and longevity. The Architect leads end-to-end program architecture, enterprise alignment, risk governance, technical leadership, and cross-team orchestration for transformational Salesforce initiatives. This position may be worked remotely within the United States, with the exception of California. This position is ineligible for immigration sponsorship and support. What you’ll be responsible for: Program-Level Architecture Leadership Define and own the architectural blueprint for Salesforce programs spanning multiple initiatives Set solution guardrails, standards, and patterns across project tracks Lead end-to-end solution architecture decisions, ensuring consistency across systems Provide oversight for technical designs—Flows, Apex, APIs, Integrations, Experience Cloud, Data Models Author and maintain Architecture Decision Records (ADRs), RACI, and governance playbooks Cross-Org & Multi-Cloud Strategy Architect across Sales, Service, Experience, CPQ, MuleSoft, and integrated ERP/QMS systems Align Salesforce with Enterprise Architecture, Security, and Data Governance frameworks Lead solutioning for identity, authorization, sharing, and zero-trust patterns Integration & Data Architecture Define high-complexity integration patterns (event-driven, async, middleware, orchestration, streaming) Responsible for data strategy: canonical models, deduplication, MDM alignment, regulatory compliance (HIPAA, PCI, SOX, GDPR) Oversee migration of large datasets Program Governance & Delivery Provide architectural approvals during PI planning, estimations, and release cycles Partner with (C)PMO, Program Managers, and Release/DevOps teams to ensure alignment to timelines & scope Establish non-functional requirements (NFRs) for performance, availability, scalability, and extensibility Identify architectural risks early and drive mitigation plans Technical Leadership & Mentorship Lead technical architects, solution architects, senior admins, and developers Provide coaching on architectural best practices, integration frameworks, and secure coding / Flow design Drive continuous improvement across DevOps, CI/CD, testing standards, and deployment pipelines Executive & Stakeholder Communication Present architecture direction, risks, and decisions to senior leadership Translate architectural decisions into business outcomes and program impacts Drive consensus across business units and technology teams Performs other duties as assigned. What you’ll need to have: 10+ years Salesforce ecosystem experience with deep multi-cloud expertise Demonstrated experience architecting large-scale (10,000+ users), mission-critical programs Strong command of security models, zero trust patterns, OAuth/OIDC, API gateways Deep integration experience with MuleSoft, Kafka/event busses, Chronicle SIEM Integrations, External (non-Salesforce) IdP Integrations, ERP systems (Oracle), CLM, CPQ Experience leading multi-org consolidation, modernization, and digital transformation Strong executive presence and ability to influence without authority Skilled in managing conflict, navigating ambiguity, and driving alignment in complex ecosystems What would be nice for you to have: Salesforce certifications strongly preferred: Salesforce Application Architect Salesforce System Architect Certified Technical Architect Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, IT, Management, or Business. description: At Jack Henry, we’re more than a technology company, we’re a force for good in financial services. This role involves collecting and analyzing workforce data, forecasting staffing needs, and contributing to the development of strategies to ensure the organization has the right number of employees with the right skills. The Senior Workforce Planning Analyst will work closely with the Workforce Planning Supervisor and other People & Culture team members to align workforce planning with business goals. Builds and refines workforce forecasts and modeling tools aligned with business priorities and industry trends. description: At Jack Henry, we’re more than a technology company; we’re a force for good in financial services. All positions, regardless of location, may require an onsite interview or in-person onboarding requirement to verify your identity. Oversees the preparation of design specifications, analysis, and recommendations. Experience in AWS, Azure, and/or GCP. Experience with containerization and/or continuous integration/deployment. Experience as a manager, supervisor, or team lead. Ability to travel up to 10% for meetings and conferences. What would be nice for you to have: Bachelor’s degree. Experience with cloud-native infrastructure and globally distributed systems. Experience streaming data for real-time analytics and predictive monitoring. Experience building high-performance microservices in Go. title: Formworkers Locals and FIFO 3 1
description: We’re looking for experienced Formworkers for upcoming civil construction projects located in Western Australia on a Local Short-Term project or a 3:1 FIFO roster. Melchor, part of the Monadelphous Group, is one of WA’s fastest growing civil construction contracting businesses, bringing a unique service offering to large resource-sector projects. For people joining us, that means the possibilities are endless. The ability to establish yourself in a rapidly expanding business, to be part of the team that sets the direction of the company, or on the ground as part of the team that solidifies our reputation for delivery. And perhaps best of all, the ability to contribute ideas in a company that is small enough for you to be heard, but big enough to be working on major resources projects. Why join us? Working with Melchor comes with a range of benefits, including: * Competitive remuneration (attractive EBA base rates + penalties + allowances) * Continual training and development opportunities * An employee perks scheme offering discounts on goods and services * The opportunity to join a growing business with industry leaders and make an impact What you’ll bring: * Perth point of hire only * Previous experience in the Civil Construction industry * Valid White Card * Tickets and/or Qualifications relevant to your trade * Commitment to safety in everything you do * Unlimited working rights in Australia About Us Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice. Our Engineering Construction division is an increasingly diverse business, focusing on managing and delivering large-scale project management and construction services. Our expertise includes civil construction, structural steel fabrication, modularisation and delivery, as well as structural, mechanical, piping and tank construction. We also specialise in heavy lift and haulage services, electrical and instrumentation work and renewable energy infrastructure. Within this division, Melchor is one of WA’s fastest-growing civil construction contractors, delivering a broad range of capabilities tailored to major resource-sector projects. Known for our focus on safety, quality and performance, we deliver complex works across the resources, infrastructure and industrial sectors. Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Repartidor a para supermercado
Qué te ofrecemos: Formación remunerada Proyección laboral dentro de la empresa Horario conocido el día 20 del mes anterior
Cómo será tu día a día: Como repartidor/a de Mercadona, tus tareas serán preparar, revisar y cargar los pedidos en la furgoneta de reparto, conducir hasta el destino, descargar y entregar la compra en la casa o lugar de recepción indicado. En las horas que no haya repartos, también realizarás otras tareas de tienda. No te preocupes por la experiencia, la formación corre de nuestra cuenta.

title: Data AI Communications Manager
description: Is this your next challenge in corporate communication in data & AI? Data & AI Communications Manager is responsible for developing and driving the internal and external communications strategy for DFI’s data & AI business unit, in close partnership with the Group Communications team and data & AI leadership. The role ensures clear, consistent and engaging storytelling about data & AI priorities, use cases and innovations across colleagues, customers, partners and media. This role may be based in Hong Kong or fully remote, with working hours that allow regular collaboration with stakeholders in Hong Kong and the wider region. The challenge is to: Strategy, planning & execution Develop a cohesive, multi‑channel communications plan for the Data & AI business unit aligned with DFI’s corporate narrative, brand and business strategy. Define clear messaging pillars for Data & AI (vision, ethics/safety, innovation, productivity, customer impact) and ensure they are consistently reflected across all content and channels. Partner with Group Communications to integrate Data & AI storytelling into corporate, ESG, transformation and leadership communications calendars. Internal communications Work with Data & AI BU leadership and Group Internal Communications to design and deliver internal comms that explain Data & AI strategy, roadmap and key initiatives to DFI colleagues (e.g. town halls, Yammer/Workplace/Teams posts, newsletters, intranet, leader toolkits). Work with People & Culture team to make sure that all Data & AI related trainings merge into the wider communication plan and get maximum awareness. Translate technical Data & AI topics into simple, relevant narratives for frontline, office and leadership audiences, highlighting business value, risk management and change‑impact. Support change communications for Data & AI‑enabled projects (e.g. new tools, workflows, automation) including stakeholder mapping, key messages, FAQs and training comms. Track sentiment and feedback from colleagues to refine messaging and engagement tactics. External communications and positioning In partnership with Group External Communications, develop an external narrative that positions DFI’s Data & AI efforts as responsible, customer‑centric and innovation‑led. Draft and support delivery of external assets: press releases, Q&As, media briefing materials, website and social content, Data & AI case studies, speeches, talking points and presentation materials for executives. Coordinate Data & AI‑related announcements, campaigns and events with Group Comms (e.g. product launches, partnerships, pilots, industry forums). Support development of executive thought leadership for Data & AI (e.g. LinkedIn, bylined articles, panel appearances) for key leaders in the Data & AI BU and C‑suite. Stakeholder engagement and partnership. Act as the primary communications point‑of‑contact between the Data & AI business unit and Group Communications, ensuring strong alignment on strategy, risk and approvals. Build effective working relationships with Data & AI product/engineering leads, Data/Technology, HR, Legal, Risk and Business Unit leaders to surface stories and manage issues. Provide counsel to Data & AI leaders on how and when to communicate, including message framing, channel selection and timing. Content creation and channel management Develop high‑quality content tailored to different audiences, including narrative documents, FAQs, newsletters, video scripts, decks, talking points, infographics and internal social posts. Maintain a Data & AI comms editorial calendar across internal and external channels, ensuring cadence, sequencing and integration with broader DFI campaigns. Partner with design, video and digital teams (or external vendors) to bring Data & AI stories to life through engaging multimedia formats. Ensure all content is on‑brand, accessible, consistent with Data & AI governance principles and approved through appropriate sign‑off processes. Governance, risk and measurement. Work closely with Legal, Risk, InfoSec and HR to ensure Data & AI communications reflect DFI policies, regulatory requirements and ethical guidelines. Prepare holding statements, Q&As and escalation paths for potential Data & AI‑related issues or incidents, in collaboration with the Group issues/crisis team. Define KPIs for Data & AI communications (reach, engagement, sentiment, understanding) and provide regular reporting and insights to Data & AI and Group Comms leadership. Use insights to refine the comms strategy and share best practices with the wider communications community. Coordinate, Prepare and review key presentation material for townhall, management committees or other internal forums. Do you have experience in corporate communications / transformation communications? Minimum 7 years of experience in corporate communications and transformation communications, or related fields. Experience in working with technology, AI, data or digital transformation topics in a large matrixed organisation is strongly preferred. Proven track record of partnering with senior leaders and cross‑functional teams to shape and execute communication strategies. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English; additional Asian language(s) a plus but not required. Demonstrated ability to translate complex or technical topics into clear, compelling and audience‑appropriate messages. Strong writing and editing skills across formats (narratives, speeches, FAQs, newsletters, social content, decks). Experience in managing both internal and external communications, including some exposure to media or public‑facing campaigns. Familiarity with change management or transformation communications is an advantage. Proficiency in cross-cultural collaboration and adept at managing diverse time zones; Prior experience in Asia or global organizations is a plus. Strategic thinker who can connect Data & AI initiatives to business and corporate narrative. Strong stakeholder management and influencing skills, with confidence working with senior executives and technical experts. High level of comfort with ambiguity and fast‑moving projects; ability to operate independently and “roll up sleeves”. Strong planning, organization and project‑management skills, with attention to detail and follow‑through. Curiosity about Data & AI and its applications in retail and consumer businesses, and a strong commitment to responsible and ethical Data & AI communication. DFI Retail Group is a leading Asian retailer, driven by its purpose to “Sustainably Serve Asia for Generations with Everyday Moments”. At 30 Jun 2025, the Group and its associates operated over 7,500 outlets and employed over 83,000 people. The Group had total annual revenue in 2024 exceeding US$24.9 billion. The Group is dedicated to delivering quality, value and service to Asian consumers through a compelling retail experience, supported by an extensive store network and highly efficient supply chains. The Group, including its associates, operates a portfolio of well-known brands across five key divisions: health and beauty, convenience, food, home furnishings, and restaurants. The Group’s parent company, DFI Retail Group Holdings Limited, is incorporated in Bermuda and has a primary listing in the equity shares (transition) category of the London Stock Exchange, with secondary listings in Bermuda and Singapore. Develop and implement merchandise, buying, and pricing strategies for assigned categories to boost penetration, drive sales and margin growth, strengthen competitive positioning, and seize market opportunities. Execute and assess merchandising initiatives and category plans aligned with customer interests and preferences. Maintain optimal stock levels through effective promotion planning and inventory management. Source products locally and internationally with a strong understanding of market trends and consumer demand. Preparing and communicating the promotion schedules to the Commercial team and internal stakeholders. Utilize analytics tools to provide a timely review of all promotional effectiveness, provide recommendations and action plans for improvement. Establish and nurture long-term strategic partnerships with vendors to support sustainable business growth. Connect to new suppliers for new partnership opportunities, shape decisions about products, pricing, and promotional strategies. Do you have experience in Buying and Merchandising? University graduate or tertiary education 5-7 years retail merchandising experience Analytical, creative, customer-focused, open to change, well planned and self-motivated Strong negotiation, project management and relationship-building skills Good communication skills and good command of English and Chinese Knowledge of category management 7-Eleven possesses the largest retail store network with over 1000 convenience stores in Hong Kong and Macau. Apart from providing quality fresh, fast food and convenient products, the chain provides a wide range of value-added services such as bill payments, mobile cards, ticketing, and pick-up services to meet customers' convenience needs. To cope with our rapid business development, we are inviting energetic and high-caliber individuals to join our team. title: Internal Audit Officer
description: Is this your next challenge in internal audit? The challenge is to: Establish and maintain close partnerships with Store Support Center functions (“SSC”) for Health & Beauty formats. Ensure audits are conducted in adherence to globally accepted Internal Audit standards promulgated by the IIA. Appropriate planning and risk assessments are conducted, identifies controls in place to mitigate identified risks and opportunities for improvements. Performs audit reviews to verify that controls are operating through testing and interviewing techniques and documents the results of audit reviews in accordance with Group Internal Audit standards. Identify internal control deficiencies and opportunities to improve business effectiveness and efficiency, and to document the results in accordance with the DFI Group Audit Manual. Assist in monitoring and reviewing the close out of prior audit findings by management, and to timely report on overdue items to senior management for remediations. Assist in performing any ad hoc reviews, advisories and investigations as assigned, and provide practical and effective recommendations to management in enhancing the control environment within the Company. Responsible for stakeholder’s engagement to ensure smooth execution of audits. Any other ad-hoc assignments as assigned by the Format Lead. Do you have experience in internal audit? Minimum 3 years of experience in internal/external audit Degree or Diploma in Accounting/Finance/Marketing or equivalent Have fundamental knowledge in principles of governance, risks and controls Proficient in MS Office Possess high energy level and strong work ethic with a commitment to continuous improvement in a dynamic and changing environment that strive to exceed expectations Good communication, analytical and presentation skills (written and verbal) Ability to work independently and operate as a team Prior experience working in retail, operations/ supply chain or a matrix organization is a plus Willing and able to travel within and outside home country (20%) DFI Retail Group is a leading Asian retailer, driven by its purpose to “Sustainably Serve Asia for Generations with Everyday Moments”. At 30 Jun 2025, the Group and its associates operated over 7,500 outlets and employed over 83,000 people. The Group had total annual revenue in 2024 exceeding US$24.9 billion. The Group is dedicated to delivering quality, value and service to Asian consumers through a compelling retail experience, supported by an extensive store network and highly efficient supply chains. The Group, including its associates, operates a portfolio of well-known brands across five key divisions: health and beauty, convenience, food, home furnishings, and restaurants. The Group’s parent company, DFI Retail Group Holdings Limited, is incorporated in Bermuda and has a primary listing in the equity shares (transition) category of the London Stock Exchange, with secondary listings in Bermuda and Singapore. The Group’s businesses are managed from Hong Kong. DFI Retail Group is a member of the Jardine Matheson Group. DFI Retail Group is responsible for ensuring that all personal information collected from each Candidate presented to DFI Retail Group is used for recruitment purposes only and the data collection process is in accordance with all applicable laws and compliant with the Code of Practice on Human Resource Management. To find out more about Our Businesses and Our People, please visit our website https://www.dfiretailgroup.com

title: Member Experience Design Assistant Manager yuu Rewards
description: Is this your next challenge in member experience design? The challenge is to: Conduct yuu Member research: Gather actionable insights through member research to understand member needs, pain points, and behaviors, which inform design decisions, both in Hong Kong and Greater Bay Area. Create a single view of member voice: Consolidate various sources of member feedback and data, including but not limited to qualitative research, qualitative research, internal data insight analysis, social listening analysis, customer experience measurements, customer service complaint/ queries, etc. to truly represent yuu members’ voice with evidence. Develop program experience design strategies: Create comprehensive design strategies considering member’s end-to-end lifecycle, starting from enrolment, earning through different means and with different partners, redeeming in yuu app, and points expiry to ensure the experience designed is addressing specific business goals with clear intention to drive brand and member engagement. Facilitate ideation and alignment sessions: Lead and support brainstorming and ideation sessions to generate innovative solutions to revitalise the program, collaborating with cross-functional teams within yuu and outside of yuu within DFI Group. Prototype and Test new concepts: Create prototypes to test new concepts, gather feedback, and iterate on designs for continuous improvement and ensuring that solutions are effective and member centred. Collaborate with Stakeholders: Work closely with yuu Commercial, Product, Insight, Operation teams, and other DFI stakeholders to ensure alignment and effective communication throughout the design process. Measure Success: Track and analyze key metrics to assess the impact of new initiatives on business and member outcomes, making data-driven decisions. Promote Design Thinking: Champion design thinking methodologies across teams to foster a culture of innovation and human-centered design. Do you have experience in member experience design? A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Design, Business/ Innovation Strategy, Industrial / Product / Interactive Design, or a related field. 5+ years of working experience as a Design Strategist or in a similar role, with a strong understanding of design thinking principles and strategic problem-solving. Prior experience in retail, loyalty program and/ or GBA market is a plus. Technical Proficiency: Proficient in design software and tools, such as Adobe Creative Suite, and experience conducting qualitative and quantitative research. Experience in using design and research GenAI tools e.g. Copilot, Deepseek, Perplexity, Midjourney, Nano banana, Perplexity is a must. Communication Skills: Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate design concepts and strategies effectively. Team Collaboration: Ability to work collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams, facilitating cooperation and alignment towards common goals. Excellent English, Cantonese and Mandarin oral and written communication skills yuu Rewards club and online shopping platform yuu was launched in Hong Kong in 2020 and now serves 4.2 million members. It allows members to earn points at more than 2,500 outlets, from partners including Wellcome , Market Place , Mannings, 7-Eleven, IKEA, KFC, Pizza Hut, PHD, Maxim’s Groups, Shell, Livi Bank and more. Originally a rewards club, it expanded in 2022 to include shopping by launching yuu to me, and has quickly become one of Hong Kong major online shopping platforms. It also exclusively partners with Hang Seng Bank’s enJoy card to enable customers to earn additional rewards. yuu encourages its members to donate points to good causes ; more than 760 million yuu points have been donated to Food Link Foundation and The Conservancy Association since 2020. title: Operations Support Executive
description: The Operations Support Executive provides comprehensive administrative and operational support to ensure smooth execution of retail and promotional activities. This role involves managing documentation, coordinating stock allocations, supporting financial processes, and ensuring compliance with operational standards. Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and effective communication are essential. Key Responsibilities: 1. Administrative & Documentation Support Process administrative tasks related to sales and operations. Prepare and ensure stock allocations are completed before deadlines. Arrange, coordinate, and distribute stock allocation to relevant stakeholders. Raise invoices and ensure timely submission for payment processing. Collate monthly files and maintain GSM tactical and P-cycle records. Manage and submit application requests to external vendors and follow up to completion. Compile Ops meeting agendas and handle ad-hoc administrative duties. 2. Finance & Billing Support Assist with billing submissions and payment follow-ups. Process overcharge and refund requests. 3. Coordination & Communication Coordinate with stores to obtain required information and responses. Communicate atrium and site activation details to store teams and vendors. Serve as a point of contact for administrative queries from vendors and internal teams. Support coordination with store teams on GRN and stock movements. Ensure clear communication and proper documentation of issue resolution. 4. Stock & Voucher Management Track and manage OP vouchers. Distribute and record Rx pads, drowsy labels, lanyards, card cases, generic TM cards, and markdown stickers. Coordinate issuance of orange badges. 5. Compliance & Data Accuracy Verify supporting documents and data accuracy before submission. Track discrepancies and follow through until resolution. Maintain organized records for audits and internal reference. Established in 1972, Guardian Health & Beauty is Singapore’s Number 1 Health and Beauty retailer. With more than 126 stores nation-wide, it retails a comprehensive range of health & beauty products. Guardian has evolved from its pharmacy roots to a holistic one-stop solution for customers’ health and beauty needs. It continues to expand its products and service range to meet the redefinition of beauty by today’s customers – where health meets beauty. With a strong health heritage, it has the largest network of award-winning pharmacists and a wide selection of health products. Professional services such as patient-care counselling, dispensary services, beauty and personal care solutions are offered at stores as a convenient one-stop for health and beauty. Guardian also operates its online store with more than 9,000 products available and offers the “Click & Collect” services. Guardian Health & Beauty is a Progressive Wage (PW) mark accredited company. title: People Culture Business Partner Manager
description: Is this your next challenge in People Business Partnering? The challenge is to: Serve as a trusted business partner, aligning our people strategy with the overall business strategy, proactively addressing any people-related matters, and ensuring fair treatment of team members in accordance with our Values. Partner with Functional Leaders on organizational design, talent pipelines, and succession planning. Design and implement initiatives that enhance team motivation and recognition, drive productivity and engagement while embodying our Caring Passionately value in every interaction. Collaborate with other People & Culture teams to establish effective processes and practices for talent acquisition, development, rewards, engagement, and retention. Deliver core People & Culture processes and routines right first time to support operational excellence and employee experience. Drive the annual performance and salary review process and support individual performance improvement cases. Ensure all people related issues are being addressed in compliance with internal policies and legally compliant with HK law. Provide support for ad hoc projects and perform additional duties as required. Do you have experience in People Business Partnering? Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management or a related field. Minimum 6 years of solid business partnering experience from multinational company. Less experienced candidate will be considered to be Assistant Manager. Background in FMCG, retail & matrix environment preferred. Understanding of the HK Employment Ordinance and proficiency in HR best practices. Demonstrated expertise in problem-solving, influencing, and stakeholder management. Exceptional articulation, independence, agility, flexibility, and adaptability – adept at understanding the dynamics of individuals, balancing HR perspectives with business needs. Strong sense of responsibility with excellent analytical skills and attention to detail. Proficiency in using Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint & AI tools for effective data analysis and presentation. Knowledge in using SAP SuccessFactors is highly preferred. Wellcome is the largest and longest established supermarket brand in Hong Kong with an extensive network of over 300 stores. Wellcome is committed to providing one-stop shopping convenience to customers through quality products at competitive prices and friendly service to serve the needs of different customers. description: 你將會愛上宜家家居 我們是一群務實坦誠、熱愛家居布置的人，來自世界各地，背景各有不同，但卻有同一個目標：為大眾締造更美好的生活。我們以共同的價值觀實踐目標。這些價值觀是我們工作的基礎，也是共融關愛、開明坦誠文化的基石。我們提倡團隊文化，熱誠樂觀，歡迎與我們態度及價值觀相同的人才加入。 這會是你嗎? 你成熟主動及擁有良好顧客服務態度，以客為先 你喜歡與人溝通及重視團隊合作 你對家飾家品業充滿熱誠 你能操流利粵語及普通英語 你熟悉一般電腦運作 你擁有中五或以上學歷 歡迎對零售業充滿熱誠的你加入我們 你的日常工作 了解宜家家居產品的功能、本地市場以及顧客需求，為顧客介紹及建議合適產品及解決方案，從而提高負責部門的銷售量 提供最佳顧客購物體驗，為顧客提供滿意的服務 確保貨場內貨品展示整潔、存貨充足及標價正確 使用系統分析銷售空間容量，以確保庫存充足 主動了解有關宜家家居的產品，解決方案，政策及操作程序的更新 與配送中心協調及安排送貨和收貨等事宜 接收、盤點及處理所有進出分店之貨物及其文件 以唧車將貨物分類及上架 我們團隊的使命 我們團隊致力於創造愉快、方便、成功的購物體驗並提升產品銷量，實現長期可持續盈利 全職員工福利 每月銷售獎金 、 年終雙糧、每月6至7天休息日、17天公眾假期、有薪假期 (如：12-18天年假、14星期產假、5天侍產假、1星期婚假)、員工醫療保險、免供款退休計劃、集團購物優惠、生日禮券、介紹人及新員工推薦獎金、良好晉升機會等 歡迎 WhatsApp 9375 1657 遞交申請 申請者提供之資料絕對保密，申請人之資料只供DFI零售集團附屬機構或授權之代理人作招聘及甄選用途。招聘過程完畢後，申請資料將被保留二十四個月作參考之用。本公司已備有一份「私隱政策聲明」，閣下如有需要可瀏覽公司網頁或以書面形式向人力資源部索取有關資料。申請人如在遞交申請表後六星期內仍未接獲通知約見，其有關申請將被存檔，以作日後同類型職位空缺考慮之用。
