title: Construction Executive
description: ROLE PURPOSE The Senior Administrator Construction & Projects provides comprehensive administrative, coordination, and compliance support for construction projects. The role ensures smooth project execution through effective documentation management, project coordination, office administration, ESG compliance, and adherence to safety and regulatory standards. This position acts as a pivotal point of contact for project stakeholders, facilitating timely communication and accurate reporting, while supporting the project team in achieving operational efficiency and regulatory compliance. PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES Documentation & Record Management: Manage the flow of all project documentation; including purchase orders, invoices, VOs, quotations, tender docs, FFA & Capex compilation, FA write off/transfer form, circulation capex & cost summary for Docusign. Distribute project documents to subcontractors in a timely manner. Maintain and organize both digital and hard copy filing systems for all projects, ensuring they are always audit-ready. Prepare and process routine correspondence, meeting agendas, and minutes. Execute day-to-day tasks for timely and efficient issuance of PO (purchase order) requests using GEP system. Manage Capex Expense tracking and perform reconciliation with Finance team. Provide support for application and termination of utilities account and authority accounts (TOL and BCA) Independently cross-check data entry through daily and periodic checks Project Coordination & Support: Track and log the status of purchase orders, invoices, VOs, quotations, tender docs, FFA & Capex compilation, FA write off/transfer form and Docusign sign off, providing regular updates to the Project Manager. Assist the project team with the preparation of reports, including daily reports, safety reports, and progress updates. Coordinate project meetings, including scheduling, preparing agendas, and distributing minutes. Assist with the close-out process by collecting and organizing warranties, as-built drawings, and O&M manuals. Maintain a proper and accurate digital filing system for reference and audits. Manage the department's procurement processes, including GEP (reno/electricity, if required) approval by Manager Office & Administrative Functions: Serve as a crucial point of contact for project-related phone calls and emails, directing inquiries to the appropriate team member. Order and maintain office and project supplies. Assist with onboarding new project team members and subcontractors, ensuring all required paperwork is completed. Support accounting with processing invoices and GRs. Provide administrative support to the department. Consult with other department stakeholders regarding any requests in a timely manner. Any other ad hoc tasks as necessary Compliance & Safety: Help maintain and track safety compliance documentation, including training records, incident reports, and SDS (Safety Data Sheets). Ensure all subcontractors have provided current certificates of insurance and other required pre-qualification documents. ESG: Environmental (E): Data Collection & Management: Collect, verify, and input site data related to energy consumption, water usage, waste generation (and diversion rates), material sourcing, and air quality. Documentation Support: Maintain records for environmental permits, inspections, and compliance documentation (e.g., stormwater pollution prevention plans, spill prevention). Reporting: Assist in preparing data for sustainability certifications and internal/environmental reporting. Administrative Logistics: Coordinate logistics for waste management, recycling programs, and hazardous material handling. Schedule and document environmental training for site staff. Social (S): Community & Stakeholder Support: Administer documentation related to community engagement activities, grievance logs, and stakeholder communications. Health & Safety Administration: Support the team by maintaining records of safety training, incident reports (with a focus on root cause documentation), and well-being program participation. Diversity & Inclusion: Track and report on metrics related to workforce diversity, local hiring, and supplier diversity programs. Assist with onboarding materials for social responsibility policies. Governance (G): Policy & Compliance: Ensure project documentation aligns with company ESG policies, client requirements, and relevant regulations. Ethics & Supply Chain: Support the administration of supplier pre-qualification questionnaires focused on ESG criteria. Maintain records of supplier code of conduct acknowledgments. Internal Controls: Manage the filing and organization of audit trails, meeting minutes (e.g., site sustainability committee), and corrective action plans related to ESG performance. Risk Management: Assist in maintaining the ESG risk register for the project. REQUIREMENT AND QUALIFICATIONS Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, Project Management, or related field. Minimum 5 years’ experience in construction administration, project coordination, or related role. Exposure to ESG reporting and compliance is advantageous. Proactive, meticulous, and comfortable working in a fast-paced retail environment. Strong organizational, documentation, and record-keeping skills. Ability to multitask, prioritize, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Effective communication and people skills to liaise with stakeholders at all levels. Knowledge of construction processes, procurement procedures, and safety regulations. Proactive problem-solving and coordination skills. Goal-oriented team player Established in 1972, Guardian Health & Beauty is Singapore’s Number 1 Health and Beauty retailer. With more than 126 stores nation-wide, it retails a comprehensive range of health & beauty products. Guardian has evolved from its pharmacy roots to a holistic one-stop solution for customers’ health and beauty needs. It continues to expand its products and service range to meet the redefinition of beauty by today’s customers – where health meets beauty. With a strong health heritage, it has the largest network of award-winning pharmacists and a wide selection of health products. Professional services such as patient-care counselling, dispensary services, beauty and personal care solutions are offered at stores as a convenient one-stop for health and beauty. Guardian also operates its online store with more than 9,000 products available and offers the “Click & Collect” services. Guardian Health & Beauty is a Progressive Wage (PW) mark accredited company. DFI Retail Group is responsible for ensuring that all personal information collected from each Candidate presented to DFI Retail Group is used for recruitment purposes only and the data collection process is in accordance with all applicable laws and compliant with the Code of Practice on Human Resource Management. title: Category Manager
description: Is this your next challenge in Category Management? RTE category; Bakery, national brands Develop and implement merchandise, buying, and pricing strategies for assigned categories to boost penetration, drive sales and margin growth, strengthen competitive positioning, and seize market opportunities. Execute and assess merchandising initiatives and category plans aligned with customer interests and preferences. Maintain optimal stock levels through effective promotion planning and inventory management. Source products locally and internationally with a strong understanding of market trends and consumer demand. Preparing and communicating the promotion schedules to the Commercial team and internal stakeholders. Utilize analytics tools to provide a timely review of all promotional effectiveness, provide recommendations and action plans for improvement. Establish and nurture long-term strategic partnerships with vendors to support sustainable business growth. Connect to new suppliers for new partnership opportunities, shape decisions about products, pricing, and promotional strategies. Do you have experience in Buying and Merchandising? University graduate or tertiary education 3 -5 years retail merchandising experience Analytical, creative, customer-focused, open to change, well planned and self-motivated Strong negotiation, project management and relationship-building skills Good communication skills and good command of English and Chinese Knowledge of category management 7-Eleven possesses the largest retail store network with over 1000 convenience stores in Hong Kong and Macau. Apart from providing quality fresh, fast food and convenient products, the chain provides a wide range of value-added services such as bill payments, mobile cards, ticketing, and pick-up services to meet customers' convenience needs. To cope with our rapid business development, we are inviting energetic and high-caliber individuals to join our team. title: Business Process Transformation Specialist
description: Is this your next challenge in Business Process Transformation? The challenge is to: Requirements gathering, analysis, and documentation Prioritize requirements and obtained buy off from stakeholders Strong Cost/Benefit focus to ensure effort is focused on true business value Translate business requirements into technical requirements. Design high level process and technology solution Verify final technology solutions and obtained signed off from business users Test the solution Support User Acceptance Test Liaise effectively with technical team Do you have experience in POS? Strong experience with POS & Store Operation processes Creative and willing to drive change including being well-organized and able to work independently. Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions Excellent documentation skills Strong business and/or systems analysis experience including business process mapping, defining requirements/user stories, solution design and implementation. Familiar with managing external vendors and able to communicate with users across all levels Experience working in a highly matrixed organisation Demonstrates a strong awareness of the uses of retail technologies within the industry sector and specifically within competitive or associated organisations operating in the same market A minimum of 3 years’ experience working in sizable company with a key role in supply chain. Good command of written and spoken English, Cantonese and Putonghua/Mandarin speaking DFI Retail Group is a leading Asian retailer, driven by its purpose to “Sustainably Serve Asia for Generations with Everyday Moments”. At 30 Jun 2025, the Group and its associates operated over 7,500 outlets and employed over 83,000 people. The Group had total annual revenue in 2024 exceeding US$24.9 billion. The Group is dedicated to delivering quality, value and service to Asian consumers through a compelling retail experience, supported by an extensive store network and highly efficient supply chains. The Group, including its associates, operates a portfolio of well-known brands across five key divisions: health and beauty, convenience, food, home furnishings, and restaurants. The Group’s parent company, DFI Retail Group Holdings Limited, is incorporated in Bermuda and has a primary listing in the equity shares (transition) category of the London Stock Exchange, with secondary listings in Bermuda and Singapore. The Group’s businesses are managed from Hong Kong. DFI Retail Group is a member of the Jardine Matheson Group. title: Operations Support Executive
description: The Operations Support Executive provides comprehensive administrative and operational support to ensure smooth execution of retail and promotional activities. This role involves managing documentation, coordinating stock allocations, supporting financial processes, and ensuring compliance with operational standards. Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and effective communication are essential. 1 . Administrative & Documentation Support Process administrative tasks related to sales and operations. Prepare and ensure stock allocations are completed before deadlines. Arrange, coordinate, and distribute stock allocation to relevant stakeholders. Raise invoices and ensure timely submission for payment processing. Collate monthly files and maintain GSM tactical and P-cycle records. Manage and submit application requests to external vendors and follow up to completion. Compile Ops meeting agendas and handle ad-hoc administrative duties. 2. Finance & Billing Support Assist with billing submissions and payment follow-ups. Process overcharge and refund requests. 3. Coordination & Communication Coordinate with stores to obtain required information and responses. Communicate atrium and site activation details to store teams and vendors. Serve as a point of contact for administrative queries from vendors and internal teams. Support coordination with store teams on GRN and stock movements. Ensure clear communication and proper documentation of issue resolution. 4. Stock & Voucher Management Track and manage OP vouchers. Distribute and record Rx pads, drowsy labels, lanyards, card cases, generic TM cards, and markdown stickers. Coordinate issuance of orange badges. 5. Compliance & Data Accuracy Verify supporting documents and data accuracy before submission. Track discrepancies and follow through until resolution. Maintain organized records for audits and internal reference. Established in 1972, Guardian Health & Beauty is Singapore’s Number 1 Health and Beauty retailer. With more than 126 stores nation-wide, it retails a comprehensive range of health & beauty products. Guardian has evolved from its pharmacy roots to a holistic one-stop solution for customers’ health and beauty needs. It continues to expand its products and service range to meet the redefinition of beauty by today’s customers – where health meets beauty. With a strong health heritage, it has the largest network of award-winning pharmacists and a wide selection of health products. Professional services such as patient-care counselling, dispensary services, beauty and personal care solutions are offered at stores as a convenient one-stop for health and beauty. Guardian also operates its online store with more than 9,000 products available and offers the “Click & Collect” services. Guardian Health & Beauty is a Progressive Wage (PW) mark accredited company. title: Store Compliance Clerk
description: Is this your next challenge in store compliance? As part of the company’s Compliance Team, we are hiring a Store Compliance Clerk. You will be a key member, independently visiting stores across different districts to objectively verify their strict adherence to company Standard Operating Procedures based on provided checklists. Your professionalism, attention to detail, and impartiality are crucial for upholding operational standards and compliance. The challenge is to: Conduct systematic reviews of store operations using standardized checklists provided by the Compliance Team to ensure adherence to SOP. Apply basic Excel functions (e.g., sorting, filtering, PiviotTables) to process data and assist in identifying potential areas of findings. Exercise independent judgment to identify on-site non-compliance issues; accurately and objectively complete daily compliance reports and upload them to the compliance system for documentation & reporting. Clearly communicate inspection findings and explain SOP requirements to store manager. Strictly adhere to team instructions, gather frontline feedback, and assist in refining checklists and SOPs. Travel daily to multiple districts as required by operational needs. Do you have experience in a retail frontline environment / inspection? Secondary school graduation or equivalent. Minimum 3 years in the retail experience. Basic English reading and writing skills to comprehend SOPs and related documents written in English. Basic proficiency in Microsoft Excel for reporting and analysis, and ability to use email and mobile office applications effectively. Integrity, reliability, and attentive to detail with good communication skills. Uphold compliance principles, able to strictly follow checklists and team instructions while exercising independent judgment in the field. DFI Retail Group is a leading Asian retailer, driven by its purpose to “Sustainably Serve Asia for Generations with Everyday Moments”. At 30 Jun 2025, the Group and its associates operated over 7,500 outlets and employed over 83,000 people. The Group had total annual revenue in 2024 exceeding US$24.9 billion. The Group is dedicated to delivering quality, value and service to Asian consumers through a compelling retail experience, supported by an extensive store network and highly efficient supply chains. The Group, including its associates, operates a portfolio of well-known brands across five key divisions: health and beauty, convenience, food, home furnishings, and restaurants. The Group’s parent company, DFI Retail Group Holdings Limited, is incorporated in Bermuda and has a primary listing in the equity shares (transition) category of the London Stock Exchange, with secondary listings in Bermuda and Singapore. The Group’s businesses are managed from Hong Kong. DFI Retail Group is a member of the Jardine Matheson Group. title: Financial Analyst yuu Rewards
description: Is this your next challenge in financial analysis? The challenge is to: Partner directly with project managers and digital leads as the finance representative on key strategic yuu and digital initiatives. Manage the end-to-end project financial lifecycle, from initial budget creation to monthly forecasting and actual spend tracking. Prepare monthly and quarterly financial performance packs for the leadership team, highlighting key trends, risks, and opportunities. Provide financial guidance and support to the yuu and digital teams, helping them understand their financial performance and make data-driven decisions. Support on annual and quarterly forecasting processes. Monitor and support month end closing, propose journal entries, reconciliations and working with shared service providers for the loyalty PL. Perform other ad-hoc analysis and additional related duties as assigned. Do you have experience in financial analysis? Bachelor's degree in one or more of the following degrees: Business, Accounting, Commerce or similar qualifications. A CA/CPA/CIMA professional qualification. Minimum 3 years of relevant finance experience working in both a “Big 4” accounting firm and/or sophisticated and fast paced commercial organizations, preferably within supermarket retail sector or digital sectors. Less experienced candidates will be considered for the position of Financial Analyst. Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel (PivotTables, Power Query, complex formulas) and PowerPoint Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau). Prior experience in tech, digital, or loyalty program finance is a significant advantage. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain financial concepts to non-financial stakeholders. Good business sense, analytical skills and an inquisitive mind. Proficiency in both spoken and written English yuu Rewards club and online shopping platform yuu was launched in Hong Kong in 2020 and now serves 4.2 million members. It allows members to earn points at more than 2,500 outlets, from partners including Wellcome , Market Place , Mannings, 7-Eleven, IKEA, KFC, Pizza Hut, PHD, Maxim’s Groups, Shell, Livi Bank and more. Originally a rewards club, it expanded in 2022 to include shopping by launching yuu to me, and has quickly become one of Hong Kong major online shopping platforms. It also exclusively partners with Hang Seng Bank’s enJoy card to enable customers to earn additional rewards. yuu encourages its members to donate points to good causes ; more than 760 million yuu points have been donated to Food Link Foundation and The Conservancy Association since 2020. title: Category Manager
description: The Category Manager is responsible for managing assigned product categories to achieve sales, gross profit, and income targets. This role involves developing strategic plans, executing promotional and pricing strategies, optimizing assortment and space productivity, and maintaining strong supplier partnerships. The individual must be proactive, data-driven, and adaptable to market trends and business needs. Job Responsibilities Sales & Profitability: Drive and achieve category sales, gross profit, and income goals by monitoring market trends and developing strategies to grow market share and counter competition. Inventory Management: Implement effective inventory management processes to ensure an optimal product mix that meets customer needs while minimizing shrinkage. Promotion Planning: Plan and execute promotional campaigns that create excitement and drive incremental sales in-store. Merchandising & Space Management: Develop and implement planogram and space management strategies to improve shelf productivity, enhance customer experience, and increase category turnover. Range Review & Assortment Optimization: Conduct regular range reviews to ensure the right assortment mix is in place to drive productivity, meet shopper needs, and eliminate underperforming SKUs. Category & Brand Strategy: Oversee the implementation of category strategies, including the development of private label or house brand products. Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with suppliers and internal stakeholders to align on business objectives. Market Insight : Stay updated on consumer behavior, market developments, and competitor activities to inform category strategies. Pricing Strategy: Develop and implement competitive pricing strategies that offer value to customers while supporting profitability. Supplier Collaboration: Establish and manage collaborative partnerships with suppliers to optimize trading terms, income opportunities, and promotional funding. Reporting & Analysis: Prepare weekly/monthly category performance reports with actionable insights and recommendations. Promotion Evaluation: Evaluate the effectiveness of promotional campaigns and provide insights for continuous improvement. Job Requirements Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or related field. 4–6 years of relevant experience in retail or FMCG, preferably in a merchandising or category management role. Strong understanding of customer-centric business models. Excellent written and spoken English. Strong knowledge of market dynamics and consumer trends. Proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint. Excellent presentation, communication, and negotiation skills. Strong analytical capabilities with the ability to translate data into insights. Energetic, creative, collaborative, and highly adaptable. Organized and results-driven with a proactive mindset. Team player with the ability to promote cross-functional collaboration. Effective in decision-making and responsive to a fast-changing environment. Comfortable communicating across all levels of the organization. Established in 1972, Guardian Health & Beauty is Singapore’s Number 1 Health and Beauty retailer. With more than 126 stores nation-wide, it retails a comprehensive range of health & beauty products. Guardian has evolved from its pharmacy roots to a holistic one-stop solution for customers’ health and beauty needs. It continues to expand its products and service range to meet the redefinition of beauty by today’s customers – where health meets beauty. With a strong health heritage, it has the largest network of award-winning pharmacists and a wide selection of health products. Professional services such as patient-care counselling, dispensary services, beauty and personal care solutions are offered at stores as a convenient one-stop for health and beauty. Guardian also operates its online store with more than 9,000 products available and offers the “Click & Collect” services. Guardian Health & Beauty is a Progressive Wage (PW) mark accredited company. title: Macao Sales Co worker Macau Taipa Store
description: 你將會愛上宜家家居 我們是一群務實坦誠、熱愛家居布置的人，來自世界各地，背景各有不同，但卻有同一個目標：為大眾締造更美好的生活。我們以共同的價值觀實踐目標。這些價值觀是我們工作的基礎，也是共融關愛、開明坦誠文化的基石。我們提倡團隊文化，熱誠樂觀，歡迎與我們態度及價值觀相同的人才加入。 這會是你嗎? 你成熟主動及擁有良好顧客服務態度，以客為先 你喜歡與人溝通及重視團隊合作 你對家飾家品業充滿熱誠 你能操流利粵語及普通英語 你熟悉一般電腦運作 你擁有中五或以上學歷 歡迎對零售業充滿熱誠的應屆畢業生加入我們 你的日常工作 了解宜家家居產品的功能、本地市場以及顧客需求，為顧客介紹及建議合適產品及解決方案，從而提高負責部門的銷售量 提供最佳顧客購物體驗，為顧客提供滿意的服務 確保貨場內貨品展示整潔、存貨充足及標價正確 使用系統分析銷售空間容量，以確保庫存充足 主動了解有關宜家家居的產品，解決方案，政策及操作程序的更新 我們團隊的使命 我們團隊致力於創造愉快、方便、成功的購物體驗，並提升產品銷量以實現長期可持續盈利 員工福利 集團購物優惠、生日禮券、介紹人及新員工推薦獎金 申請者提供之資料絕對保密，申請人之資料只供DFI零售集團附屬機構或授權之代理人作招聘及甄選用途。招聘過程完畢後，申請資料將被保留二十四個月作參考之用。本公司已備有一份「私隱政策聲明」，閣下如有需要可瀏覽公司網頁或以書面形式向人力資源部索取有關資料。申請人如在遞交申請表後六星期內仍未接獲通知約見，其有關申請將被存檔，以作日後同類型職位空缺考慮之用。

title: Hong Kong Restaurant Bistro Manager Tsuen Wan Store
description: WHY YOU WILL LOVE US We’re a diverse group of down-to-earth, straightforward people with a passion for home furnishing. We come from all over the world, but we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people". How we realize this vision is based on our shared humanistic values. These values guide our work and build our inclusive, open and honest culture. It’s all based on a spirit of togetherness and enthusiasm. We work hard, but we have fun doing it. We’re always looking for people who share our positive attitude and values. WHY WE WILL LOVE YOU You have experience of using commercial opportunities to attract visitors You have experience of managing/leading and developing a team You have experience of creating and executing action plans You have experience of marketing and activity planning You have business experience and knowledge from either IKEA Food or another part of IKEA retailing You are preferably gained in an IKEA store or similar food service/hospitality environment You have knowledge of the IKEA Concept, including our vision and business idea, IKEA culture and values, and how we create our business advantages You are ability to read and understand written English and good communication in English You are proficient in MS Office You have at least 5 years of experience of management role in high volume restaurant WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING DAY TO DAY Customers are always in focus and strive to make them smile. Meet and serve our customers showing empathy, care, listen and support them with an attitude based on the IKEA values, follow up the customer feedback regularly with action Together with the team contribute actively to the development and implementation of a clear IKEA Food action plan for the store using the store business plan and country business plan. These are supported by input from Growing IKEA together and the IKEA Food Direction & Strategy Work closely with Communication & Interior Design team and the Commercial Activity Leader by actively contributing to and supporting all marketing and in-store activities. Integrating the Swedish celebrations and yearly focus area into the store’s Commercial Calendar To maximize commerciality to grow sales as well as the conversion rate and average check. Use other tools such as the CMP Review, customer flow and the 10 Most Frequent Questions to strengthen quality perception and customer experience Co-operation with the Kitchen Production Manager, ensure following range matrix & PPSI, food displays are always fresh and look appealing with standard quality Monitor, analyse and follow up the sales performance, secure the product availability and minimize the food wastage, ensure the SISAN and merchandising basic in place Share to the team of the top-selling products, and that they are available and clearly communicated and always displayed Co-operate with the SFM team leader to enhance the link between the Swedish restaurant and the Swedish Food Market. Take appropriate actions to promote cross merchandising/communication Be a passionate leader who can bring business and people together. Inspired by the IKEA core leadership capabilities and strive to continuously develop as a leader and committed to the development of the team. Secure their training to ensure all co-workers understand the IKEA Concept and other key guidelines, and how they have an impact on their specific roles Work together with the Kitchen Production Manager in the operation area according to the IKEA Quality and Food Safety requirements and implement the IKEA Hygiene plan to meet and secure the store’s requirements. Also ensure the Hygiene plan routines are known and followed in all daily work TOGETHER AS A TEAM To create an enjoyable, convenient and successful customer shopping and buying experience Ensure that our customers are provided an irresistible food offer, in a welcoming atmosphere and neat environment that gives our customers a good reason to return STAFF BENEFITS Annual Fixed Bonus, Discretionary Bonus, 17 days Public Holiday, Paid Leave (Paid Annual Leave, 14 weeks Maternity Leave, 5 days Paternity Leave, 1 week Marriage Leave), Employee Medical Coverage, Non-Contributory Retirement Plan, Staff Purchase Discount, Birthday Coupon, Referral Bonus, Excellent Career Path Personal data collected will be kept and handled confidentially by authorized personnel for recruitment purposes only. This role will contribute to compensation benchmarking including Long-Term Incentive Plan (LTIP) operations and annual review processes, ensuring alignment with business strategy and market competitiveness. Participate in development, review and implementation of reward related programs and projects such as salary benchmarking and benefit review. Support in the annual salary review and incentive and other reward processes. Partner with the business to prepare compensation package proposals for internal mobility and new hires. Update reward policies to ensure compliance with statutory requirements. Support end-to-end LTIP processes including grant cycles, vesting schedules, participant communications, and system updates. Collaborate with vendors and external partners to ensure maximum value of services is delivered. Provide trusted and practical advice to the business and HR team members on reward programs. Highly organized with strong attention to detail. Strong communication, influencing and collaboration skills. Self-motivated with growth mindset. DFI Retail Group is a leading Asian retailer, driven by its purpose to “Sustainably Serve Asia for Generations with Everyday Moments”. At 30 Jun 2025, the Group and its associates operated over 7,500 outlets and employed over 83,000 people. The Group had total annual revenue in 2024 exceeding US$24.9 billion. The Group, including its associates, operates a portfolio of well-known brands across five key divisions: health and beauty, convenience, food, home furnishings, and restaurants. title: Assistant Demand Supply Planning Manager
description: Is this your next challenge in Demand and Supply Planning ? The challenge is to: Lead a team of Planning officers to manage forecasting, daily replenishment and inventory control at DC based on sales trend, promotion schedule and display requirement. Analyze actual product demand, research demand drivers, seasonality, market situation, refine the forecast to reflect updated sales momentum, and adjust inventory plans for normal, festive, seasonal ranges accordingly. Collaborate with Commercial team to ensure sales forecast accuracy and align on new range and promotion forecast. Prepare purchase plan base on aligned forecast, monitor order fulfillment from vendors and follow thru shipment activities of overseas suppliers. Monitor key supplier performance and liaise on demand and supply requirement. Optimize inventory level at warehouse while maintaining high service level; identify root cause and resolve out-of-stock/excess stock situation. Responsible for inventory optimization at different store profile to drive sales and maintain a healthy level of availability at stores Monitor KPI and execute improvement actions as necessary. Prepare regular reports and analysis for management review. Achieve company target and carry out other duties as required by business. Do you have experience in Supply Chain? description: We seek a data-driven technology leader to serve as the strategic business partner for our Health & Beauty division, combining strategic advisory, solution design, and daily operational stewardship. You’ll bridge technology, digital, and business goals by designing customer-centric solutions, managing high-impact projects, and pioneering innovations that elevate customer propositions. This role demands equal parts strategic advisor, project leader, and internal entrepreneur—all focused-on scaling H&B experiences through technology. Is this your next challenge in IT Strategic Partnering? Strategic Business Partnership · Partner with Health & Beauty business leaders to co-create technology roadmaps tied to outcomes. · Proactively identify gaps in capabilities, data, or processes and design solutions that unlock growth · Translate H&B goals into technical requirements with clear analytics measurement frameworks · Advise executives on tech investments, risks, and opportunities to drive market differentiation. Solution Stewardship · Co-create end-to-end H&B tech solutions with business leaders, digital product managers, and tech COEs · Lead vendor selection/RFP with focus on future-proof capabilities · Develop business cases for new investments, including cost-benefit analysis and adoption strategies Project & Program Leadership · Lead and manage complex tech initiatives from concept to launch using Agile/Scrum leading cross-functional squads · Work with the business format to define success metrics to guide intended outcome and operational efficiency · Govern budgets, timelines, and risk mitigation · Report progress to executives with clear links to business impact Internal Entrepreneurship · Champion innovation: Pilot emerging tech (hyper-personalization), build proofs-of-concept, and scale successes · Drive value extraction of tech assets · Foster a culture of innovation via partnerships with educational institutions, startups, and internal incubators Do you have experience as a Business Solutions Lead? · 10+ years in tech roles with 3+ years in retail, including solution design, project management, business partnership roles · Demonstrated experience on leading 3+ large-scale tech transformations with measurable revenue/efficiency gains · Technical Mastery in delivering Retail Excellence e.g. ERP, POS, Digital Commerce, and Marketing Technology · Track records of launching new tech-driven capabilities Critical Competencies · Business Acumen: Mastery of marketing/sales funnels, P&L levers, and ROI modeling · Domain Fluency: Retail, Health & Beauty, Customer Touchpoints · Influence: Ability to align MDs and format CEO on strategy, trade-offs, and investment decisions. · Technology: Familiarity with platform management, AI, MACH architecture, integration design, and agile experimentation frameworks. If you want flexibility, training to improve your skills and a management team that champions you and backs you up, Ally is the place to be.

Take the wheel on your career and join a team that is dedicated to providing world class support to our customers as they look to purchase and lease vehicles. title: Business Development Specialist
description: Ally and Your Career Ally Financial only succeeds when its people do - and that’s more than some cliché people put on job postings. We live this stuff! We see our people as, well, people - with interests, families, friends, dreams, and causes that are all important to them. Our focus is on the health and safety of our teammates as well as work-life balance and diversity and inclusion. From generous benefits to a variety of employee resource groups, we strive to build paths that encourage employees to stretch themselves professionally. We want to help you grow, develop, and learn new things. You’re constantly evolving, so shouldn’t your opportunities be, too? The Business Development Specialist program is a full-time job opportunity built to help individuals eager to advance their sales careers through immersive training. You will start by shadowing and then collaborating with the Finance & Insurance (F&I) Account Executive team. They focus on selling new business to grow market share, deepen relationships with current customers, and maintain business by delivering high-quality customer happiness. After finishing the BDS program, the expectation is that you’re prepared to interview for open Account Executive positions in the Dealer Product and Services business unit.

title: Principal Engineer Agentic AI for IT Operations
description: At Ally, you get a startup feel, but experience the benefits of a company that has worked out the kinks and is fulfilling its purpose. title: CMA or LPN PKP IM portal
description: Join our dynamic team at Park Place Internal Medicine, located in the heart of downtown Boise—a hub of culture, innovation, and outdoor recreation. We are committed to delivering high-quality, compassionate care to a diverse patient population in a collaborative environment. Certified Medical Assistants (CMAs) and Licensed Practical Nurses (LPNs) are an essential part of our care team at Park Place Internal Medicine. They work closely with providers and other healthcare professionals to ensure every patient receives safe, efficient, and compassionate care. Our CMAs and LPNs are trusted partners in delivering high-quality service and creating a welcoming environment for a diverse patient population. WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM THIS ROLE: Schedule: Schedules will match clinic hours, Monday through Friday from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM, ensuring full coverage during these times. CMAs and LPNs will be scheduled alongside their assigned providers whenever possible to maintain continuity of care. Full time Monday-Friday 9-hour shifts, 4 days per week Part time Monday-Friday 9-hour shifts, 2-3 days per week Responsibilities Prepare patients for provider visits and assist with clinical procedures. Perform vital signs, administer medications, and support diagnostic testing. Coordinate patient flow and maintain accurate documentation in electronic health records. Serve as a key point of contact for patients, answering questions, and providing education. Collaborate with nurses, physicians, and administrative staff to keep the clinic running smoothly. CMA Qualifications Education High School Diploma or equivalent Certifications Current BLS-CPR Certification from the American Safety and Health Institute, American Heart Association or American Red Cross Current recognized National Certification as a Medical Assistant from one of the following: NCCT, NAHP, AMT, AAMA, AMCA, or NHA LPN Qualifications Education Graduation from a Licensed Practical Nursing Program Certifications Current BLS-CPR Certification from the American Safety and Health Institute, American Heart Association or American Red Cross Current Licensed Practical Nuse (LPN) licensure in the State of Practice

description: At St. Luke’s, our team of imaging professionals’ pride ourselves on fostering a workplace culture that values diversity, promotes collaboration, and prioritizes employee well-being. Sign on Bonus eligible for external hires! General Imaging to include cardiac, stroke/neuro, procedures (procedural CT department) Siemens (2 scanners, 1 Dual Source CT). Meridian Imaging prides themselves on their unique, collaborative relationship between providers and technologists, a high culture of safety in alignment with system goal, and cross-campus collaboration and standardization. Busiest Emergency Department in the state of Idaho with focus on new trauma expansion. Minimum Qualifications for this Role: Education : Associate degree or experience in lieu of degree Licenses/Certifications: Current Basic Life Support (BLS) Provider Certified through American Safety and Health Institute, American Heart Association, or American Red Cross. American Registry of Radiologic Technologist (ARRT) certification. Computed Tomographic (CT) certification.

title: Evergreen Pediatric Hospitalist Boise 1 0
description: Make a Difference Where it Matters Most. Seeking BC/BE Pediatric Hospitalist to join our patient-focused Pediatric Hospitalist team at St. Luke’s Medical Center in Boise, ID. This role offers a supportive environment with close collaboration across a multidisciplinary team dedicated to exceptional inpatient pediatric care. Our Pediatric Hospitalists work closely with Pediatrics clinics throughout the Treasure Valley and with the Hospitalist program in Twin Falls. Enjoy state-of-the-art facilities within Idaho’s only Children’s Hospital and be part of an award-winning health system in a thriving community. What to Expect: Caring for inpatient pediatric patients within a dedicated pediatric unit with specialty trained pediatric nurses, consults for the emergency department or other teams as needed, and ongoing medical education of both residents and medical students Idaho’s only Children’s Hospital, serving a vast regional network Part of a 50-bed pediatric facility within a 388-bed tertiary care hospital Access to 18 pediatric specialty practices, Level 4 NICU, PICU, and Level 2 pediatric trauma center Attending deliveries is not required as there is an on-site NICU Pediatric subspecialty care is available through the associated Children’s hospital and includes most pediatric subspecialties Call is from home and the schedule offers excellent work/life balance as well as high degree of predictability There is ample opportunity for involvement in system-level quality improvement projects and leadership activities Qualifications: MD or DO from an accredited medical school Board-certified or board-eligible Eligible for medical licensure in Idaho Benefits Beyond the Basics: Alongside competitive pay and retirement plans, we offer benefits that go beyond the basics — including on-site massages, counseling through our Employee Assistance Program, onsite childcare, and access to Virgin Pulse wellness tools. We’re committed to your overall well-being. Highly competitive guaranteed base salary with potential production and quality incentives Generous recruitment incentives could include sign-on bonus, relocation, student loan repayment, and training stipend Hospital employed with great benefits, retirement, malpractice, vacation and CME allowance Medical education opportunities teaching med students and residents Supportive work culture with wellness programs and employee recognition initiatives Live Well in Idaho: Boise Boise, known as the “City of Trees,” is a vibrant and growing city that blends urban sophistication with outdoor adventure. Discover a lifestyle with mountains, clean air, safe community, quality of life, outdoor recreation, and real community — all while working in a top-tier health system committed to care excellence. Award-winning culinary scene with new restaurants Cultural festivals, such as, the renowned Basque Festival and Treefort Music Fest Outdoor recreation: hiking and biking in the Boise Foothills, kayaking on the Boise River, and skiing/snowboarding nearby Family-friendly amenities: top-rated schools, safe neighborhoods, and a strong sense of community Convenient travel: 27 nonstop flights from major U.S. cities make Boise easily accessible For more information on this opportunity, please contact Julia Nigro via email: nigroj@slhs.org.

title: Supply Chain Tech 1 Evening shift
description: At St. Luke’s, we pride ourselves on fostering a workplace culture that values diversity, promotes collaboration, and prioritizes employee well-being. Our commitment to excellence in patient care extends to creating an environment where our team can thrive both personally and professionally. With opportunities for growth, competitive benefits, and a supportive community of colleagues, St. Luke’s is truly a great place to work. Supply Chain Technician 1 Are you a problem solver with a strong service orientation, great organizational skills, and a passion for working in a fast-paced environment? Join our team as a Supply Chain Technician and become an integral part of our supply chain operations! In this role, you’ll help ensure our patients and teams receive the materials, medical supplies, and equipment they need to thrive. From delivery and inventory to stocking and distribution, you’ll be part of a dynamic team working behind the scenes to keep everything running smoothly. Schedule Wednesday through Saturday Four, 10-hour shifts 2:30 p.m. - 1:00 a.m. Night and weekend shift differentials apply! What You Can Expect You will specialize in the following areas: Courier : Transport materials, medical supplies, and equipment, ensuring timely deliveries and maintaining clean, ready transportation equipment. Distribution : Issue supplies to departments, manage stock requisitions, and perform general distribution tasks. Warehouse : Receive, store, and distribute materials, manage inventory, and ensure efficient sorting and shelving. Additionally, you'll be responsible for picking, packing, and delivering supplies, answering phone inquiries, maintaining inventory levels, assisting with offloading and stocking deliveries, and supporting truck operations. Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent Valid driver's license if required to drive Preferred Qualifications Experience with inventory and lumping : Offloading trucks, distribution, or handling inventory. Customer service skills : Answering phones and assisting team members with product inquiries.

title: Full time Meds to Beds Pharmacist Nampa Nights
description: At St. Luke’s, we pride ourselves on fostering a workplace culture that values diversity, promotes collaboration, and prioritizes employee well-being. Our commitment to excellence in patient care extends to creating an environment where our team can thrive both personally and professionally. With opportunities for growth, competitive benefits, and a supportive community of colleagues, St. Luke’s is truly a great place to work. Day in the Life: We are seeking a full-time Pharmacist for our Meds-to-Beds team in Nampa, Idaho. This is a 7 on 7 off position with a shift time of 1900-0700. In this role the Pharmacist is responsible for the delivery of pharmaceutical care to patients and customers of the medical center. What to Expect: A dynamic, fast‑paced environment with frequent movement between the outpatient pharmacy, ED, inpatient units, and urgent care High levels of direct patient interaction, with opportunities to make a meaningful impact on medication understanding and adherence A blend of clinical decision‑making, operational coordination, and patient education Close collaboration with nurses, physicians, case managers, and pharmacy technicians to support smooth and timely discharges The ability to reduce readmissions, improve patient satisfaction, and enhance continuity of care through proactive medication management A role that requires strong communication skills, adaptability, and a patient‑focused mindset Qualifications: Education: Degree from an accredited pharmacy program Experience: 0 years' experience Licenses/Certifications: Valid Pharmacist License in state of practice AND Current Basic Life Support (BLS) Provider Certified through American Safety and Health Institute, American Heart Association, or American Red Cross.

title: PARENT Part time Lactation Consultant Nampa 0 5 FTE
description: If you’re looking for a place where you can grow in your personal life, in your career, and in your community, St. Luke’s may be just the place for you. We currently have an opening for a part-time Lactation Consultant at our Nampa Medical Center! What You Can Expect: The Lactation Consultant provides professional leadership and advanced knowledge in the practice of lactation management. Lactation Consultants are responsible for educating new mothers and their families about the breast feeding process. The Nampa Mother Baby unit and Level 2 NICU provide compassionate care for infants and their families following birth. As a Level 2 NICU, the Nampa unit supports babies born prematurely or those who require specialized monitoring and intervention. The team is equipped to manage moderate prematurity, feeding challenges, and respiratory support needs, offering advanced care for infants who do not require complex surgical services. Qualifications: Bachelors of Nursing 2 years of RN experience, maternal-child experience preferred Licenses/Certifications: Current RN licensure from the State of Practice IBCLC Specialty Certification A strong, talented staff is at the heart of St. Luke’s Health System. We are the state’s largest employer with more than 13,500 employees and a medical staff of more than 1,800 physicians and advanced practice clinicians. Our employees are dedicated to impacting the lives of those in our community while pursuing a life- changing career at St. Luke’s. Our staff is the reason for our outstanding reputation as both a quality employer and superior healthcare organization. We’re proud of our people who deliver skilled, compassionate care every day, and are looking to add dedicated individuals who will continue in the same tradition of excellence. With multiple locations in the beautiful southern and central Idaho, our mild, four season climate means you can play outdoors year-round. Whether you prefer leisurely walks along the river or heart-pounding climbs up a sheer cliff- there is always something to do after work. An exciting mix of urban and outdoor life defines Idaho’s culture, you can ski in the morning and watch a college sporting event at night. It is a great state to raise a family and forge lasting relationships. The cost of living is low, and quality of life is high.

title: PAS Program Coordinator
description: At St. Luke’s, we pride ourselves on fostering a workplace culture that values diversity, promotes collaboration, and prioritizes employee well-being. Our commitment to excellence in patient care extends to creating an environment where our team can thrive both personally and professionally. With opportunities for growth, competitive benefits, and a supportive community of colleagues, St. Luke’s is truly a great place to work. What to Expect The Patient Access Services Program Coordinator is responsible for managing one or more programs with a strong focus on operational workflows, technical systems, and build optimization that support frontline diagnostic imaging scheduling. This role serves as a key liaison between operational teams, Medical Imaging, technical partners, and leadership to ensure efficient, standardized, and sustainable access processes. Plans, develops, and implements goals and objectives of assigned program or department in conjunction with appropriate leadership, with accountability for operational scheduling workflows, system build, and technical process improvement. Maintains strong relationships with appropriate stakeholders and a high level of visibility and accessibility for specific areas of support, including close collaboration with IHT, Epic, Medical Imaging, and telephony partners to troubleshoot and resolve issues in real time. Communicates program priorities, policies, and procedures as they relate to strategic growth and various teams within the organization, ensuring technical changes and workflow updates are clearly understood and adopted by frontline staff. Establishes and maintains communication between ancillary departments and key stakeholders regarding program initiatives, including coordination of system changes, workflow standardization, and issue resolution. Plans and conducts meetings to ensure compliance with established practices and to review workflow performance, system issues, and opportunities for optimization, keeping educational teams and leadership informed of current standards and changes. Works in conjunction with compliance, legal, and various regulatory teams within the organization to assist with guideline adherence, contracts, and program development, while translating clinical or regulatory requirements into practical, scalable workflows for non-clinical teams. Responsible for the development, implementation, direction, and coordination of policies and programs consistent with company philosophy and objectives, with an emphasis on reducing unnecessary variation, maintaining guardrails, and simplifying processes where possible. Completes, maintains, and audits records, reports, and documents program and/or department activities, including documentation of system build changes, workflow decisions, testing outcomes, and issue resolution. Technical Focus of the Role Supports and optimizes outpatient imaging scheduling workflows and work queues Troubleshoots Epic and Genesys-related issues impacting operations Partners with IHT to test, validate, and implement system changes Identifies and reduces irrational workflow variation across sites Serves as a subject matter expert and escalation point for complex access issues Minimum Qualifications Bachelors degree + 2 years OR Associates + 4 years OR HS Diploma/GED + 6 years

title: Quick Care Twin Falls
description: St. Luke's is seeking an Advanced Practice Provider to join our highly collegial and patient focused Quick Care team in Twin Falls, Idaho.  The selected individual will be working alongside one physician and five other APPs in the only urgent care clinic in the community. St. Luke's Quick Care is open 7 days a week from 8:00am through 10:00pm providing  services including but not limited to care for minor illnesses such as ear infections, fevers, rashes, coughs, sprains, mild or moderate asthma, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, neck or back pain, pink eye, puncture wounds, cuts, sinus trouble, sore throats, minor burns, ligament tears, painful joints, urinary infections, respiratory illnesses, and sports injuries. The Advanced Practice Provider is responsible for providing high-quality healthcare through the diagnosis and treatment of patients with conditions ranging from mild, to acute and/or chronic. The APP works under the supervision of a designated physician, and in collaboration with a team of other providers and staff. What to Expect: Experience preferred but new grads will be considered Performance Incentives Malpractice insurance as well as malpractice tail coverage $3,500 Professional Development Fund 5 CME days are included to complete education aside from accrued PTO For more information email Christine Gregory @ gregoryc@slhs.org

title: NP PA Hematology Medical Oncology Program Twin Falls
description: St. Luke's Cancer Center is recruiting for the future! Our program is rapidly growing and is seeking an Advanced Practice Provider (APP) to join our Hematology/Medical Oncology program in Twin Falls. You will be joining our well-developed and multidisciplinary team of physicians and advanced practitioners.  This position will primarily support the benign hematology patient population. This candidate will collaborate with attending physicians to provide advanced clinical care. Responsibilities include working in a team-based environment to provide outpatient ambulatory clinic support to patients needing treatment as well as short- and long-term surveillance. A candidate will collect and document data, order diagnostic and therapeutic procedures, order and schedule laboratory studies and consultations, and provide direct patient care services. They will join a growing team of Hematology/Oncology physicians and APPs that pride themselves in working and collaborating equitably. Responsibilities may include all or some of the following: Independently assess and evaluate patients with benign hematology issues including anemia, cytopenias, and simple coagulopathies and hypercoagulable states Provide outpatient cares for benign hematology consultations and patients. Provide Southampton Hospital coverage as needed. Write orders for treatment and renew prescriptions. Review, evaluate, and make recommendations regarding laboratory findings for patients. Manage outpatient phone calls including toxicity assessments and recommendations. Educate patients and family members regarding their diagnoses and therapies. Knowledge of basic software packages and hospital information systems (EMR). In joining St. Luke's Cancer Institute you'll enjoy: Team-based care with well-educated, dedicated support staff A culture in which innovation is highly valued Work/life balance and flexibility Exceptional compensation package, starting bonus, and relocation reimbursement Rich benefits package including malpractice, health and dental insurance, and generous CME allowance For more information email Christine Gregory @ gregoryc@slhs.org

title: Health System Data Engineer Lead
description: Health System Data Engineer Lead Do you like working on things that positively impact the health of your friends, family, neighbors, and community? St. Luke's has been committed to the health and well-being of the people we serve since our founding in 1902. As our communities’ needs have evolved, so have we — expanding how we care for our friends and neighbors. Today, St. Luke’s is more than a hospital. We’re an integrated health system delivering care in our hospitals and clinics, connecting communities to a network of exceptional providers through St. Luke’s Health Partners and funding care through St. Luke’s Health Plan. As an engineering lead of our Data Platform team at St Luke’s, you will be integral in developing and helping others develop innovative data solutions for business-critical data that is shared across the enterprise and collectively represents a “single source of truth.” The ideal candidate for this position would have great communication skills, be a curious self-starter, have great analytical and problem-solving skills, and have a passion for delivering technical solutions that enable time-sensitive, critical decisions. Previous technical or personnel leadership is a plus, but not required. Required Criteria: Education: Bachelor's degree or 4 years of relevant experience in lieu of degree Experience: Minimum of 4yearsrelated experience Responsibilities: Partner and Learn: Partner withother Data and Analytics leaders,Business IntelligenceDevelopers and Analyststo ensure they have the dataneeded to develop solutions and provide self-service data access. Develop a strong partnership with thebusinessandincrease your understanding of St Luke’s business and clinical functions. Co-develop recommendations, understandneedsand leaddata and analytics professionalsto deliver on requestsand projects. Lead, coordinate and mentor: Lead your groupof data engineerstoenhance and developstate-of-the-artdata pipelines, data lake house and support data extracts. Mentor staff to develop skills andfulfillassignments. Ensure the team has clear requirements and the solutions are tested andvalidated. Provide regular status reports and planswithappropriate stakeholders. Responsible for performance appraisals for positions under their direction;providesleadership guidance, counseling, and continuing education to staff. Aligns and develops best practices Alignwith Data andAnalyticsbest practices within other groups. Workwith architects to implement solutions in alignment with standards. Participate in developing and improving standards and best practices acrosstheData&Analytics department. Build cross functional relationships withapplication teamsand business leaders to understandinformation needs, data flows, and data quality. Working Lead Design, implement, andmaintaindata management capabilities including the enterprise data platform; its associated data models, ETL processes, and data architecture requirements. Utilize data profiling and data quality techniques for requirements validation, unit testing, and automated integration testing. Implement frameworks for automated and scripted testing. Contribute to improving solution stability, reliability, efficiency, and quality. Identifytechnical solutions that achieve efficiency and effectiveness and enable data usage as a strategic business asset. Beavailable to support solutions as required by the business need . Experience: Strong SQL experience, writing queries and stored procedures. Experience with database management systems including performance and tuning and security. Experience in developing and communicating data warehouse data modelsand methodologies Development experience withDatabricks andMicrosoft SQL Server Integration Services. Experience with REST and .NET preferred Experience with EpicEHR andEpic experience is a plus ExposurewithData Lake and Lakehouse Methodologies Previoustechnical or personnel leadership is a plus. About St. Luke's: Our employees enjoy many benefits, some of the most popular are tuition reimbursement, hospital retirement contributions, and hospital-supported on-going training and education. If you’re looking for a place where you can grow in your personal life, in your career, and in your community, St. Luke’s may be just the place for you. A strong, talented staff is at the heart of St. Luke’s Health System. We are the state’s largest employer with more than 19,000 employees and a medical staff of more than 1,800 physicians and advanced practice clinicians. Our employees are dedicated to impacting the lives of those in our community while pursuing a life- changing career at St. Luke’s. Our staff is the reason for our outstanding reputation as both a quality employer and superior healthcare organization. We’re proud of our people who deliver skilled, compassionate care every day, and are looking to add dedicated individuals who will continue in the same tradition of excellence. With multiple locations in the beautiful southern and central Idaho, our mild, four season climate means you can play outdoors year-round. Whether you prefer leisurely walks along the river or heart-pounding climbs up a sheer cliff- there is always something to do after work. An exciting mix of urban and outdoor life defines Idaho’s culture, you can ski in the morning and watch a college sporting event at night. It is a great state to raise a family and forge lasting relationships.

title: Security Officer 2 Wood River TEMPORARY Ken Chad
description: At St. Luke’s, we pride ourselves on fostering a workplace culture that values diversity, promotes collaboration, and prioritizes employee well-being. Our commitment to excellence in patient care extends to creating an environment where our team can thrive both personally and professionally. With opportunities for growth, competitive benefits, and a supportive community of colleagues, St. Luke’s is truly a great place to work. What You Can Expect: 0700-1900 Friday 0700-1900 and Saturday 0700-1900 THIS IS A TEMPORARY ROLE (10 month commitment) Ketchum, ID work location Under limited/moderate supervision, the Security Officer 2 is responsible for the safety and well-being of patients, visitors, staff, and hospital property. Makes periodic tours of premises and grounds, examining doors, windows, and gates to ensure that they are properly secured. Guards property against damage, fire, theft, trespassing and illegal entry. Controls access to health system facilities. May apply de-escalation tactics in working with high-risk patients or visitors to limit harm to themselves or others. Retains physically assaultive patients as ordered by clinical staff within established parameters. Responds to alarms including but not limited to baby alarms, elopements, hospital designated codes, fire drills, external and internal disasters lockdown procedures. Investigates incidents, collects data, and reports security, safety, and fire hazards. Assists in maintaining daily incident log. Investigates disturbances/security breaches, may serve as liaison with police, and in the event of an emergency, maintains order and safety of personnel. Writes detailed and complex reports of incident. Collect and properly secure weapons and illicit drugs according to policies and standards. Collaborates with the care team for the Designated Examiner evaluations with patients on involuntary hold to ensure the safety of all personnel. May screen visitors and issue visitor passes when appropriate. May monitor patient, visitor, and employee parking in garages, lots, and zones, enforce parking regulations and issue parking citations when appropriate. Compiles reports to leadership with statistical data related to number of tickets issued, location, number of vehicles towed, and trends. Handles moderately complex issues and problems, and refers more complex issues to higher-level staff Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned. Qualifications: - Education: High School Diploma or equivalent - Experience: 2 years relevant experience - Licenses/Certifications: Drivers license fleet vehicle This role is subject to St. Luke's driving policy, which requires individuals in this role to not have a record of certain driving-related offenses within the past three (3) years, including but not limited to: Suspension of License , Driving Under the Influence, Reckless or Negligent Driving... If hired, St. Luke's will conduct a driving records check upon hire and continuously thereafter for individuals hired into this role. Individuals will be required to maintain a valid, current driver's license.

title: Systems Analyst 2
description: St. Luke's Health System in Boise, ID is seeking a Systems Analyst 2 to join our Finance Information Systems (Finance IS) team. Under limited/moderate supervision, the System Analyst 2 reviews business requirements, analyzes and evaluates existing and/or proposed systems and designs and develops IT system solutions in response. Specific Duties/Responsibilities: Help facilitate and guide on-going CSC and Finance application (Tecsys / Infor) upgrades and improvement activities Translate business requirements into actionable enhancement requests and coordinate testing and deployment. Serve as a liaison between CSC, AP, other Finance, and IHT, improving communication and reducing misalignment. Act as a subject matter expert (SME) to proactively identify and resolve issues before they escalate. Drive business process improvement and redesign efforts to reduce manual work and increase system reliability. General Duties/Responsibilities: Build, configure, and program applications to meet user requirements for new and optimized workflows in designated software applications and systems. Implement new software applications and systems, performs upgrades consistent with project plan(s), technical specifications, and operations requirements of the health system. Provide proactive remediation of potential issues. Tests and validates software applications and systems to ensure proper operation, implementation of software design and end-user acceptance Identify and diagnose issues that arise in the supported application area as well as issues that impact other application teams, and work to resolve them. Assess severity of issues and prioritize responses as appropriate. Communicates impacts, opportunities, and progress to key stakeholders. Coordinates work efforts with vendor(s), other applications teams, and key stakeholders. Maintains awareness of vendor and industry development/plans in area(s) of responsibility. Ensures documentation is provided for support, end user training and testing/validation. May provide implementation support with end users. Follows established protocols in the execution of all activities to ensure the safety and security of information system assets, processes, and data. Possesses working knowledge in impacted areas. Handles moderately complex issues and problems and refers more complex issues to higher-level staff. Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned. Minimum Qualifications: Education: Bachelors degree or experience in lieu of degree Experience: 2 years relevant experience Licenses/Certifications: None Preferred Qualifications: Working knowledge of the Tecsys application Working knowledge of the Infor application General understanding of finance operations General understanding of Supply Chain and Warehousing operations Business Process Improvement ( BPI ) and Re-engineering ( BPR ) – Lean 6 sigma certified Experience with Electronic Data Interchange ( EDI )

title: Telehealth Specialist Transfer Center
description: Make a Meaningful Impact At St. Luke’s, we are committed to building a workplace grounded in collaboration, inclusion, and respect—where every team member feels valued and supported. Our mission to deliver exceptional, patient-centered care begins with investing in our people. With competitive pay and benefits, opportunities for growth, and a strong sense of community, St. Luke’s is a place where you can build a career with purpose. Telehealth Specialist – Transfer Center Full-Time | 12-Hour Shifts Wage: $17.32 – $19+ per hour (based on experience) Shift: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM (three 12-hour shifts) Schedule: Variable, including weekends and holidays What You’ll Do As a Telehealth Specialist in the Transfer Center, you will play a critical role in supporting patient flow and care coordination across all four St. Luke’s locations. This is a non-clinical role with no direct patient contact, but it is essential to ensuring timely, efficient transfers and bed placement. In this fast-paced, high-volume environment, you will collaborate closely with nurses, physicians, and operational teams to manage transfer requests and support seamless transitions of care. Key responsibilities include: Coordinating Patient Transfers: Support the movement of patients across facilities in collaboration with clinical teams. Managing Bed Placement: Assist with timely and accurate bed assignments across the health system. Handling High-Volume Calls: Manage incoming transfer center calls and communicate critical information clearly and efficiently. Operational Support: Maintain accurate documentation and support administrative workflows within the Transfer Center. Interdisciplinary Collaboration: Partner with nurses, physicians, and other care team members to resolve issues and ensure smooth coordination. Ideal Candidate Healthcare Experience Preferred: Background in healthcare, patient access, or care coordination is strongly valued. Strong Communicator: Able to communicate clearly, professionally, and calmly in a high-pressure environment. Problem Solver: Comfortable prioritizing tasks, adapting to change, and troubleshooting in real time. Team-Oriented: Enjoys working collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams toward shared goals. Qualifications Education: High School Diploma or equivalent required Experience: Minimum of six (6) months of customer service or administrative experience required Licenses/Certifications: None required

What you can Expect: The CardioVascular Operating Room (CVOR) at St. Luke’s is our heart and vascular specialty OR, serving cardiothoracic, thoracic, vascular and endovascular service lines. The unit has one surgical hybrid room in addition to three operating rooms. Patient population is primarily adults. RNs on our team also give conscious sedation. title: Senior Employee Relations Representative
description: At St. Luke’s, we pride ourselves on fostering a workplace culture that values diversity, promotes collaboration, and prioritizes employee well-being. Our commitment to excellence in patient care extends to creating an environment where our team can thrive both personally and professionally. With opportunities for growth, competitive benefits, and a supportive community of colleagues, St. Luke’s is truly a great place to work. What to Expect The Senior Employee Relations Representative provides support to St. Luke’s management and employees administering employee relations policies, programs, and practices across the entire system. The successful candidate will be part of a dynamic remote team, supporting HR in the communication of St. Luke’s policies and practices in coaching and corrective action, attendance, non-discrimination, and other policies related to employee behavior. If you are action oriented with a drive for process, can work independently, and have previous Employee Relations experience - this role is for you. Work closely with St. Luke's employees at all levels of the organization to answer questions and convey relevant information related to Human Resources and/or St. Luke's policies and procedures. Communicates with employees, both formally and informally, who are involved in the coaching and corrective action process, to assist employees in understanding the process. Compiles necessary information to review with leadership prior to pursuing investigations or situations with potential legal or third-party risk. Serves as a primary resource to Employee Relations Representatives regarding employee/leadership concerns. Assists with and intervenes in issue resolution and problem-solving for the Employee Relations team. Collaborates with leadership to develop processes and programs to meet strategic goals. Develops and presents management training materials covering HR topics; develops supporting documents. Supports the administration of HR policies, including anti-harassment and non-discrimination, by conducting investigations, including employee interviews, when necessary, compiles information for review by leadership. Partners with the Privacy Officer and leadership to investigate and recommend the appropriate resolution to possible HIPAA, confidentiality and privacy breaches. Assists leadership in achieving SLHS's overall goals of ensuring fair and equitable treatment for all employees, while at the same time supporting management's goal of achieving a high performing workforce. Ensures the enforcement of the rights and responsibilities to employees with disability regarding reasonable accommodation and undue hardship as identified by the American with Disabilities Act (ADAAA). Coordinates with other HR departments and leaders in identification of reasonable accommodations to employees as appropriate. In conjunction with the CNO, determines board-reportable events and prepares notifications to appropriate board. Compiles reports, assembles and interprets data. Remains current on pertinent employment laws and regulations. May lead, develop and mentor HR staff, including responsibility for hiring, training, and conducting performance evaluations, corrective actions, and terminations. Qualifications: Education: Bachelors degree or equivalent Experience: 5 years relevant experience Licenses/Certifications: None

title: Health Record Specialist
description: At St. Luke’s, we pride ourselves on fostering a workplace culture that values diversity, promotes collaboration, and prioritizes employee well-being. Our commitment to excellence in patient care extends to creating an environment where our team can thrive both personally and professionally. With opportunities for growth, competitive benefits, and a supportive community of colleagues, St. Luke’s is truly a great place to work. Under general supervision, the Health Record Specialist is responsible for scanning and indexing documents from ambulatory clinics and hospitals, ensuring accurate and timely processing of health records. Schedule Wednesday through Sunday 6:00 am. to 2:30 p.m. What You Can Expect Responsible for verifying, importing, prepping, scanning and maintaining patient health information in the electronic medical record in an accurate and timely manner. Validates completeness of medical record content through a review of documents and provides notification to provider(s) of incomplete status. Reviews electronic medical records to ensure compliance with rules, regulations, and company policy. Identifies and assigns any deficiency to the appropriate provider to complete minimum documentation requirements. Monitors the status of incomplete medical records and notifies providers of pending and delinquent medical records to support timely record completion. Monitors work queues for indexing documentation into the electronic health record. Documents and transcribes in the patient health record appropriate health information. Creates new encounters and orders to accommodate patient health information as appropriate. Routinely communicates with physicians and their office staff, as well as other health care facilities. Responds to requests for health information and follows established facility standards, state and federal guidelines. Processes the release of health information/medical records for continuity of care purposes. Other duties and responsibilities as assigned. Qualifications Education: High school diploma or equivalent Experience: One (1) year relevant experience
Department: Health Info Mgmt Services System Office

title: PARENT RN Virtual Hospital On Site FT nights
description: At St. Luke’s, our dedicated team of Virtual Hospital RNs are critical in providing exceptional, patient-centered care. We strive to foster an environment that embraces our employees' unique strengths, experiences and perspectives which ultimately drives our exceptional, patient-centered care. St. Luke's Virtual Care Center is in the heart of downtown Boise, surrounded by skiable mountains and raftable rivers. St. Luke's Virtual Hospital exists to optimize acute care outcomes through collaboration and the use of technology. The team-based model of care enables patients in our hospitals to have access to specialty resources, when and where they are needed. Sign on and relocation offered! Check out our video and FIND YOURSELF HERE: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YHzzWg4v5RM What you can expect from this role Virtual Hospital support is available 24/7 Support bedside nurses by virtually monitoring and collaborating on patient care Remain engaged in the hospital floor environment by rounding on patients, collaborating with physicians and bedside staff, and extend your reach to nurture hospital RNs across the St. Luke’s system Virtual Hospital has onsight provider available 24/7 On site position in high tech facility; NOT REMOTE work Full-time (0.9 FTE), night shift openings, 12-hour shifts Certification pay available Additional PTO for night shift offered Qualifications Education: Associate degree required, Bachelor of Nursing Degree preferred Experience: 3+ year RN Experience in acute care; telemetry monitoring highly preferred Licenses/Certifications: Current RN licensure from the State of Practice and Current Basic Life Support (BLS) Provider Certified through American Heart Association or American Red Cross What’s in it for you At St. Luke’s, caring for people in the communities we serve is our mission – and this includes our own SLHS team.  We offer a robust benefits package to support our teams both professionally and personally. St. Luke’s is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any person on the basis of race, religion, color, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status or condition protected by law. * Please note: this posting is not reflective of all job duties and responsibilities and is intended to provide an overview to job seekers.
