title: Senior Product Designer Subscriber Activation
description: Smarter, Faster, and as always - First. That's our philosophy. Bloomberg Media empowers global business leaders with breaking news, expert opinion and proprietary data distributed on every platform, across every time zone. Like our products and solutions- our teams are agile, dynamic, and innovative. We work hard, and we work fast - while keeping up the quality and accuracy for which we're known. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. Our culture is wide open, just like our spaces. We challenge each other. And through our countless volunteer projects, we help bring out the best in our communities as around us, too. You can do amazing work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else. It's up to you to make it happen. Bloomberg LP has built a significant media business spanning television, digital, magazine, radio and live event platforms across the globe. In the midst of a historic time in the media industry, Bloomberg Media is growing its global footprint and reach through new innovations from Quicktake to New Economy to our rapidly growing consumer subscription business. This role is for a Senior Product Designer to help us bring our work to the next level. You will be collaborating with product managers, developers, and editors to create intuitive and compelling experiences that elevate our consumer-facing product suite. You'll design activation touchpoints-like welcome flows, personalized content introductions, and milestone moments-that create early connection with our product and guide new subscribers toward long-term value. Here, you will focus on the digital products that reimagine how our world class editorial can meet users where they are. WE'LL TRUST YOU TO: User-Centric: Be a fierce advocate for our external and internal users. Shape solutions that deliver on their needs backed by research, data, and a deep knowledge of our user base. Socialize learnings with the rest of the community. User Experience: Demonstrate a strong understanding of interaction design, system-thinking, inclusive design, information architecture, multi-step, and cross-platform flows across a holistic user experience. Product-thinking: Lead the vision for your product area alongside product, engineering, editorial, and marketing partners. Shape your team's roadmap and goals with strategic design direction. Speak confidently about how your work relates to broader company objectives and best serves our users. Tools: Expertly employ design and prototyping tools, like Figma, to best solve and communicate user flows, interaction and motion. Have familiarity with HTML and CSS to enable close collaboration with engineering partners. Visual Design: Demonstrate and articulate understanding of layout, typography, visual hierarchy, and brand. Leverage the existing visual frameworks creatively, and introduce new patterns that help strengthen our design system. Feedback: Share work early and often. Encourage peers to seek out constructive feedback from their managers, stakeholders, product teams and design team. Likewise, provide regular, direct and impactful feedback with peers. Communication: Possess strong verbal and written communication skills. Communicate complex ideas, goals and problems, in person and in documentation, in a way that is accessible even to those unfamiliar with the project. Know how to shape narratives and share work across disciplines and levels in the org. Agility: Move fluidly and collaboratively between each stage in a fast-paced, iterative, cross-team environment. Thrive in turning ambiguous concepts into actionable deliverables. Be ready to adapt, and be adept at ensuring stakeholders and team partners are all on the same page. YOU'LL NEED TO HAVE: An undergraduate or graduate degree in design or other design-related field. 5+ years' experience as a digital product designer crafting consumer-facing web or mobile products. High proficiency in design and rapid prototyping tools like Figma, Proto.io, HTML/CSS. A portfolio of multiple shipped products that demonstrate your design leadership and end-to-end product design thinking. Bonus: Experience designing onboarding or activation experiences, especially within subscription-based businesses. WE'D LOVE TO SEE: A portfolio - Our goal is to see if your problem-solving and interaction design skills are a good fit for Bloomberg. We would like to see artifacts such as: delivered product, complete designs, sketches and process work. Please include a link or attachment with two (2) projects when you apply. If you need some other way of showing us your work (either by emailing it, bringing it in person, or through an online real-time screen share), please apply for the role and we'll contact you to make arrangements to view it. Does this sound like you? Apply! If we believe you're a good match we'll get in touch to let you know the next steps. Salary Range = 150000 - 175000 USD Annually + Benefits + Bonus The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. title: Senior Software Engineer SRE Real time Data
description: Our department is responsible for efficiently distributing financial data from its source to interested users all around the world.  This includes (for example) stock prices or foreign exchange rates. Data can either be served in response to a request or streamed in real time. The group owns: the distribution software and infrastructure a range of different sources of data the supporting services to be able to administer and manage the system, including permissioning and metering The team is also responsible for the Enterprise endpoint (“B-PIPE”) which allows end-users to programmatically consume data via our SDK.  Data is also available through the Bloomberg Terminal or Microsoft Excel. The main challenge faced by the group is one of scale - data is sourced from more than 370 global exchanges with a combined volume in excess of 60 billion messages each day.  We deliver this data to hundreds of thousands of terminals and thousands of B-PIPEs.  Handling this volume takes a lot of hardware!  We manage multiple clusters in our main data centres as well a network of many thousands of servers all around the world. Team Overview The SRE group comprises three sub-teams: one in Tokyo, one in London and one in New York.  This allows us to provide on-call coverage following the sun.  This role is in the London team.  The mission of the group as a whole is to ensure our systems are reliable, scalable and observable by using software engineering practices. The group’s responsibilities fall under five main pillars: Latency Monitoring and Management Defining, measuring and viewing service level indicators (SLIs) for latency. Defining service level objectives (SLOs) for latency and alerting on breaches. Building tools to accurately and quickly identify the sources of latency. Capacity Management Ensuring all subsystems can scale horizontally. Maintaining sufficient capacity to withstand a disaster and demonstrating compliance. Building tools to understand the current utilisation and capacity of the system and predict the impact of load increases and new use cases. System Monitoring and Observability Building tools to detect problems proactively, before they are reported by customers. Providing information on the overall health of the system from a single, well-known, entry point. Putting alarms in place, with actionable run-books, for all critical issues. Production Risk Management Ensuring business-as-usual changes are safely released to production. Planning and / or executing the release of more complex changes. Reviewing and re-architecting the infrastructure to improve resiliency and performance. Incident Response Managing live incidents to diagnose and remediate issues, mitigating customer impact as quickly as possible. Building tools to diagnose issues and run manual operational responses safely and correctly. Provide automated responses to standard problems. The London team is currently responsible for two critical parts of the distribution system. First of all, we own the system which serves configuration to the thousands of servers in the distribution network and the B-PIPEs. These servers “call home” when they start up and the system has the responsibility for delivering the proper settings to them. The wide reach of this system means that correctness is extremely important. We also own the mechanism which allows servers to be grouped together in discoverable clusters of peers. This comprises a back-end service to query for peers and also the UI to manage the groupings. Changes to these systems often include developing business functionality, as well as technical enhancements. We have also built a framework to flexibly and regularly monitor our estate of servers to ensure that they are operating properly at all times. Finally, we also own the main tool used to diagnose data quality issues in the distribution network. Finally, in addition, the team also makes changes to other core subsystems (outside of our formal ownership) in order to improve the reliability of the wider system. All of this gives us a very strong focus on software development in addition to our operational responsibilities. You'll need to have: Experience with an object-oriented programming language (preferably Python or C++). A focus on delivering good quality, well-tested, software and safely releasing it to a mission-critical production environment. A proven track record triaging and resolving live production problems. A strength in cooperating in a collaborative and inclusive team environment. The capability to work across departments, building good relationships with both technical and non-technical partners. Discover what makes Bloomberg unique - watch our podcast series for an inside look at our culture, values, and the people behind our success.

title: Senior Software Engineer Data License Monitoring Resiliency
description: At Bloomberg, we deliver billions of data points to hundreds of thousands of customers every day (and growing) enabling them to make informed business decisions. It is paramount that our customers have reliable access to our services to receive market moving data when they need it. As our customers’ needs continue to increase and evolve, our mission is to leverage software engineering, collaboration, and automation to handle the demand and exceed expectations. This is where you come in. Through software engineering and creative problem solving, members of the Data License Monitoring & Resiliency team design solutions, adopt and build software services, and incorporate industry-standard practices to ensure Data License services run reliably for our customers - increasing the observability of Data License services, automating capacity management of production infrastructure, and reducing the time it takes to resolve issues through deployment and incident response automation. Our team owns a customized monitoring system, Synthetic Requests and Notifications (aka SyReN), a full-stack application that monitors Data License services end-to-end, generating service level metrics and triggering alerts when issues are detected. Additionally, our team routinely assesses and tests Data License services overall through automated game days and proactive chaos testing to ensure system resiliency and the highest level of service reliability is delivered to our customers. We’ll trust you to: Take a “solve this with automation” approach to challenges and issues related to service reliability Improve the observability of applications, services, and infrastructure systems to help teams understand system performance Design and propose improvements to software solutions used to measure and monitor the performance of applications and services Collaborate with application development teams to identify gaps that negatively impact service reliability; including improving monitoring, capacity management, and incident response workflows Manage a high-quality and robust production platform and promotion pipeline to ensure available capacity and resources for services Reduce human toil through automation of manual tasks, steps, and workflows Work collaboratively with the team to accomplish goals within an agile software development lifecycle You’ll need to have: 4+ years of experience working with an object-oriented programming language (C/C++, Python, Java, etc.) A Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, similar field of study or equivalent work experience Preference for data-driven approach to decision making Creative problem solving approaches that account for existing services, environment and resource limit constraints Demonstrated understanding or experience working in all levels of the technical stack, from applications to underlying computing infrastructure and machine hardware Willingness to learn new technologies and adapt to changing priorities We’ll love to see experience with: Containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos) Chaos testing or similar experience to validate reliability Infrastructure as code and configuration management tools Defining and measuring service level indicators and service level objectives for applications, services and infrastructure Salary Range = 160000 - 240000 USD Annually + Benefits + Bonus The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level. We offer one of the most comprehensive and generous benefits plans available and offer a range of total rewards that may include merit increases, incentive compensation (exempt roles only), paid holidays, paid time off, medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, life insurance, and various wellness programs, among others. The Company does not provide benefits directly to contingent workers/contractors and interns. title: User Support Bloomberg Technical Support Bahasa Indonesia or Thai Speaker Singapore

Our customers around the globe rely on us for the information and tools they need to make critical investment decisions and remain connected across all sides of the financial community. And, to ensure the best experience for our 26,000+ employees across 150 offices globally, we provide the spaces and systems that allow our teams to work together with agility, productivity and collaboration, no matter where they are. What’s the role? You will provide support for new and existing Bloomberg clients. You will collaborate with Sales to address clients’ connectivity requirements, lead the installation of Bloomberg Terminals, as well as coordinate closely with a variety of internal teams to deliver access to the Bloomberg infrastructure. You will resolve technical issues and proactively maintain Bloomberg performance to the utmost level, which will include circuit usage and network performance. You need to be a confident and well-organized communicator, responsible for handling key accounts while regularly liaising with market data and technology personnel, in addition to telecommunication providers, service vendors and a variety of internal partners to ensure the highest quality of service to our customers. If you wish to be involved in an exciting, fast-paced and challenging role that allows you to fully utilize your communication, technical and project coordination skills while gaining insight into the global financial markets, then this may be the opportunity for you. service issues Coordinate installation and maintain customers’ connectivity to Bloomberg's network Work proactively with clients to implement recommended hardware and network infrastructure strategies to improve their experience with Bloomberg's products and services Lead and coordinate multiple concurrent projects with stakeholders to meet project deadlines within service quality You’ll need to multiple teams to meet deadlines Flexibility to accommodate occasional evening & weekend work (time off in lieu) We'd love to see: CompTIA A+, NET+ or CCNA certification Experience with telecommunications lines, basic network design and security Experience with FIX protocol Exposure to vendor cloud technology e.g. AWS, Azure Experience with setting up & troubleshooting virtual environments (VMware, Citrix, etc.) Ability to communicate effectively and negotiate resolutions to difficult scenarios Ability in picking up new technologies and concepts quickly If this sounds like you: Apply if you think we're a good match. title: New York City Facilities Infrastructure Site Manager
description: The energy of a newsroom, the pace of a trading floor, the buzz of a recent tech breakthrough; we work hard, and we work fast - while keeping up the quality and accuracy we're known for. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. Our culture is wide open, just like our spaces. We bring out the best in each other through collaboration. Through our countless volunteer projects, we also help network with the communities around us, too. You can do amazing work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else. It's up to you to make it happen. WHAT’S THE ROLE? The Facilities Infrastructure Site Manager provides daily oversight and leadership of the New York City office facilities infrastructure. This role is responsible for managing the operations and maintenance of electrical, mechanical, and fire/life safety systems, while ensuring high levels of operational resiliency, safety, and efficiency. The role includes responsibility for managing operational expenditures (OPEX) and supporting capital expenditure (CAPEX) projects. You will work closely with Bloomberg’s Facilities Operations teams as well as with other internal partners including Engineering, Network Operations, Security, News, Broadcast, and more. WE’LL TRUST YOU TO: • Lead day-to-day infrastructure operations with a focus on resiliency and continuous improvement • Manage critical systems including generators, UPS, HVAC, electrical distribution, and fire/life safety • Oversee change management, risk assessments, and operational procedures • Coordinate with internal stakeholders and external vendors • Ensure safety, compliance, and documentation standards • Manage ticketing, reporting, contracts, and on-call incident response REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Facilities Management, or equivalent experience • 5+ years of facilities or critical infrastructure experience FINANCIAL & VENDOR MANAGEMENT • Manage OPEX and CAPEX projects and expenditure • Approve purchase orders, invoices, and vendor contracts • Manage vendors and their performance and compliance TECHNICAL EXPERTISE • Experience with critical infrastructure systems • Knowledge of CMMS, BMS, UPS, generators, HVAC, and fire systems • Strong documentation and change management skills PREFERRED • Multi-site facilities infrastructure experience • AutoCAD / Revit familiarity • IT and network infrastructure exposure WHY JOIN US? You will play a critical role in maintaining resilient, high-performing environments that support Bloomberg’s people and business operations IF THIS SOUNDS LIKE YOU: Apply if you think we're a good match. title: Content Engineer News Automation Team
description: The Engineering News Automation Content group takes the wealth of Bloomberg data and turns it into human-readable stories. With more than 100,000 automated stories generated every month, we are the largest producer of automated news stories in the world. We work closely with journalists and product owners to produce the high-quality content that our unique 200,000 readers are expecting. Do you want to join our team as we continue to lead the industry in automated news generation? If so, keep reading. What’s in it for you You’ll join and contribute to a crucial area of Bloomberg News. The automations you build will generate real-time stories on the Bloomberg News Wires accessible to all of our clients. You will work with a team of experienced journalists who are highly regarded within the financial market and technologists who are at the top of their game. You will gain exposure to the full spectrum of our financial, economic, and environmental data, and help craft standards for a new way of breaking news. In addition, as someone joining our team, your mission will be to participate in the continued definition of our new platform, Content Creation Workflow, as well as a new product that enables editors to securely incorporate GenAI into their daily workflow. We’ll trust you to Write scripts and configure triggers that generate automated stories Collaborate with the product and engineering teams to deliver news effectively Follow and continuously improve our team's design, coding and testing standards Enrich and maintain a set of libraries to be used by our teams and others in Engineering Explore new technologies and methodologies, finding the best tools for the job rather than those with which we are most comfortable Partner with our sister teams, Content Creation Workflow and News Automation Infrastructure, to come up with the next generation of automated news You will need to have 4+ years of software development BA, BS, MS, PhD in Computer Science, Engineering or related technology field An aptitude for analytical problem solving Appreciation of the quality of the codebase and experience in knowledge how to apply unit testing, integration testing and stress testing to produce reliable production software Working knowledge of modern development methodologies and tools (Jenkins / Jira / GitHub / Humio) We would love to see Interest to working with news with a focus on internal customers Experience in journalism or working with LLMs is a plus Experience in working with data pipeline systems or microservices platforms Experience with CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, or system observability Experience in mentoring others Salary Range = 90000 - 160000 USD Annually + Benefits + Bonus The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. title: Enterprise Data Sales Representative EDSR Hong Kong
description: Our team We are Bloomberg Enterprise Data - fast-paced, innovative and fast-growing. We collaborate closely with our clients, taking the time to understand their unique businesses while focusing on specific data and technology needs so that we can help them achieve their business objectives. We have an endless selection of data sets covering all asset types. We have multiple delivery technologies. This allows our clients to get exactly the data they need, when they need it, in the format they prefer. What's the Role? We are looking for a Data Sales Representative to join our Sales team in Hong Kong. The successful candidate will be responsible for end-to-end sales activities from lead generation, new business strategies and marketing, managing the day-to-day relationship of current accounts as well as hunting for growth opportunities and closing business. What's the Team Like? We’re a tight-knit, high-performing team that loves what we do — partnering with clients to unlock the power of Bloomberg’s data and technology. Collaboration drives us, curiosity inspires us, and our energetic, all-in culture keeps us thriving. We celebrate wins together, support each other’s growth, and take pride in making a meaningful impact — for our clients, our colleagues, and for the communities around us. We'll trust you to: Generate leads for the Enterprise Data Sales team Engage in frequent prospecting calls to existing accounts and new businesses to develop sales opportunities Build the sales pipeline and identify new opportunities to grow revenue within existing accounts Stay informed about the evolving Enterprise Sales business and the financial markets to spot trends, look for new opportunities and establish credibility with our clients by understanding their business Establish and maintain efficient processes to assist in the smooth day-to-day operations of sales administration Leverage your knowledge to build and maintain credibility with clients, identify gaps, recommend solutions, and deliver on revenue-generating goals You'll need to have: Minimum 5 years of client facing experience in financial services, financial technology, or data focused technology companies Experience selling financial technology and/or data solutions to financial institutions Experience in managing technical and data content sales deals within an account until close and maintaining ongoing relationships with clients Outstanding client service experience, relationship management skills, and sales aptitude Working knowledge of the financial industry and its data needs Strong presentation and communication skills in English Bachelor’s degree or degree-equivalent qualifications We'd love to see: Technical skills with Cloud solutions such as AWS, Azure, GCP Familiarity with various data ingestion and delivery models such as Cloud, SFTP, API Knowledge of the Bloomberg product suite Knowledge of our customers businesses: their customers, technology stacks and workflows, and an ability to relate this to an Enterprise Sales conversation Professional working proficiency of an additional Asian language If this sounds like you: Apply if you think we're a good match. We’re individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and experiences who take on big challenges and create even bigger impact through our work. We’re interested in what makes you you, and how we can create opportunities for you to channel your unique, personal energy and grow to your fullest potential. title: Security Infrastructure Engineer Corporate Technology
description: ENG Security Architecture operates and evolves enterprise security infrastructure that protects employee - facing services and internal platforms. This role is infrastructure engineering with a Site Reliability Engineering ( SRE ) mindset applied to security: secure operations, observability, operational automation, and disciplined change control through Git workflows and continuous integration gates. You will own services that must be measurable, stable, and audit ready under real production load, and you are expected to operate independently with minimal ramp up while raising the bar on reliability and security operations across the organization. We own these platforms end - to - end from management consoles and backend services through endpoint agents across Windows and macOS, with Linux support expected over time. Scope includes security control planes across endpoint controls, secure web and data controls, vulnerability and exposure telemetry, logging pipelines, and identity and privileged access services spanning SaaS and on - prem ise environments. We'll trust you to Define and operate service level objective ( SLO ) backed reliability for security platforms , including dependency mapping, failure mode analysis, resiliency improvements, and rollback readiness Build and maintain operational automation for provisioning, validation, drift detection, evidence collection, and exception handling using scripting and orchestration Run secure change management for configurations and integrations via Git based review, con tin uous integration ( CI ) gates, environment promotion, ring-based rollout discipline, and rollback readiness Establish observability operators can trust, such as health metrics, data freshness and coverage, structured logs, dashboards, and actionable alerting with noise control Lead incident response and problem management for security service degradation, from triage and containment through root cause a nalysis ( RCA ) and corrective actions Partner with infrastructure, identity, endpoint, and corporate technology teams to standardize operational contracts, access patterns, audit artifacts, and runbooks; drive vendor escalations with evidence packs and regression prevention You'll need to have 4 + years of s trong experience operating enterprise infrastructure in production in a security context across SaaS and on prem dependencies, including on call incident ownership and root cause analysis ( RCA ) 4+ years building and maintaining production automation in an object-oriented language, typically Python, plus PowerShell or Bash for operational execution; experience integrating with REST APIs and enterprise infrastructure services Proven troubleshooting strength across authentication flows, enterprise networking, proxy constrained environments, certificates, and distributed dependencies Hands on experience operating endpoint agents and security services at scale on Windows and macOS; able to extend operational patterns to Linux environments over time Strong familiarity with c ontinuous i ntegration and c ontinuous d elivery ( CI /CD ) pipelines and secure change management for infrastructure and configuration changes using Git workflows, pull request ( PR ) review discipline, c ontinuous i ntegration ( CI ) gates, controlled promotion between environments, and rollback strategy Experience building and operating observability for infrastructure services, including dashboards, alerting, health metrics, and data quality checks with noise control Hands on background supporting identity and privileged access workflows, including least privilege and time bound elevation patterns Hands on operation of enterprise security controls: endpoint, secure web and data, vulnerability telemetry, logging pipelines, privileged access; comfortable with Infrastructure as Code or orchestration frameworks and converting runbooks into automated checks We’d love to see Track record defining service level objectives ( SLO ) and error budgets for security infrastructure services and using them to drive prioritization Experience building self-healing automation with closed loop validation, drift remediation, and audit ready evidence Demonstrated ability to lead cross org anization reliability and security initiatives, setting standards and influencing roadmaps Experience performing threat modeling and architecture reviews for internal platforms and translating findings into concrete control requirements Familiarity with automation hardening and secrets and key management: artifact signing, dependency controls, secrets storage and rotation , and certificate or key lifecycle management at scale Salary Range = 130000 - 225000 USD Annually + Benefits + Bonus The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. title: Senior Software Engineer Bloomberg Government Data Platform
description: Bloomberg Government is changing the government sector by delivering the most sophisticated research platform on the market with a focus on automation, analytics and real-time answers. Our goal is to become an indispensable tool for private and public sector professionals by supporting their day-to-day tasks and providing solutions that help them get real-time answers and better serve their companies. Within Bloomberg Government, the Data Platform team is hiring!  As part of our team, you will help build a visualization layer on top of the Bloomberg Government data platform, as well as develop the internal tools that our data analysts use to curate our products. You will also help in our task to migrate our data to the cloud. Here you will use AWS technologies like Lambda and Step Functions to create robust ingestion workflows as well as implementing Databricks Lakehouses. You will be given the opportunity to display your creativity and deliver continuous end-user value in an Agile environment. We are self-motivated engineers who like to research, learn, and apply current technologies to build new product features that anticipate our customers’ needs. We’ll trust you to: - Work directly with product owners, data experts and other engineering teams to build solutions that our clients use to solve complex problems - Build and support a distributed platform supporting all Bloomberg Government data - Work with data analysts to collect insight on possible data collection efficiencies and identify automation potential for manual workflows - D ev eloping infrastructure as code (IaC) and embraces DevOps principles. - W ork with AWS cloud services to implement micro services using serverless technologies - Work with Databricks to build a Lakehouse You'll need to have: - 4+ years of experience programming in Python - 4+ years of experience with relational databases, SQL and Linux - A passion to learn new technologies - BA, BS, MS, PhD in Computer Science, Engineering or related technology field We'd love to see: - Knowledge of PySpark, Databricks and ETL - Working with AWS and building infrastructure using CloudFormation and Terraform - Experience with applying machine learning algorithms to solve complex data mining problems Salary Range = 160000 - 240000 USD Annually + Benefits + Bonus The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. title: Camera Operator Contract
description: Bloomberg Media is looking for an individual with a proactive attitude who is focused, flexible, and proficient in several aspects of broadcast operations, and who can work collaboratively in a live control room and studio environment in a camera operator capacity. title: BloombergNEF Administrative Data Analyst Contractor 10 Month Contract
description: BloombergNEF is seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented contractor to support our team in a hybrid role that combines administrative coordination with entry-level data analysis. This individual will be responsible for handling a range of manually intensive yet business-critical tasks that require accuracy, consistency, and strong analytical thinking. The ideal candidate is proactive, reliable, and comfortable working with structured processes, repetitive tasks, and content management workflows. A background in law, commodities, data analysis, agile frameworks, and/or the Bloomberg Terminal is highly beneficial, though not required. Key Responsibilities: Content & Data Operations (Primary Duties) Perform manual tasks such as story coding, staff page updates, data audits and data organization, ensuring high precision and adherence to internal guidelines. Audit and compare Terminal content against web content, identifying discrepancies and escalating issues as needed. Update and maintain staff pages with complete accuracy and timely execution. Track, maintain, and analyze BEVO statistics in Excel to support business strategy reporting. Assist with data governance processes, documenting legal assessments and adherence to policies, monitoring data quality issues, and raising concerns promptly. Documentation & Communication Prepare clear, well-structured sprint review slides summarizing team activities and progress. Create and maintain documentation for JIRA tickets, ensuring all workflow steps and requirements are accurately captured, including that all necessary tickets are generated and any product or business decisions have been documented. Produce explainer materials for internal and external stakeholders (e.g., Sales, Analysts, ADSK) to support product understanding and adoption. Draft initial versions of descriptive language for help pages, marketing materials, documentation, and labels. Administrative Support Organize meetings, and coordinate timelines and logistics for team members and cross-functional partners. Support general administrative needs, ensuring processes run smoothly and tasks are completed on schedule (keep track of the to-do list) Required Skills & Qualifications Exceptional attention to detail and commitment to error-free work, especially in repetitive or highly structured tasks. Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple assignments and maintain accurate records. Strong written communication skills and comfort drafting clear, concise content. Proficiency with Excel (sorting/filtering, pivot tables, basic formulas) and PowerPoint Ability to learn new internal tools and workflows quickly. Comfortable working independently, following detailed instructions, and raising questions when clarity is needed. Preferred Qualifications Familiarity with the Bloomberg Terminal Background or coursework in law, commodities, business, or data analysis. Ability to code in SQL and/or Python Experience using JIRA, Miro, or other project management/documentation tools. Prior experience supporting content auditing, data governance, or quality assurance processes. Success Factors Delivers consistent, accurate work with minimal oversight. Approaches repetitive tasks with patience, focus, and discipline. Communicates clearly and escalates potential issues early. Demonstrates curiosity and willingness to learn both administrative and analytical components of the role. Is kind: builds strong working relationships across teams and functions. title: Enterprise Services Technical Implementation Specialist Tokyo
description: About Bloomberg Bloomberg delivers critical information in a world where information matters. We empower decision makers across finance, business, and government by connecting them to a global ecosystem of data, news, analytics, and technology. Our success depends on innovation, collaboration, and a relentless focus on client needs. Our Team Enterprise Technology Solutions helps financial institutions solve the complexity of system integration across their organizations. Clients rely on multiple internal and external platforms to support trading, risk, operations, and reporting workflows. Our team provides the tools, expertise, and services that enable seamless integration between client systems, Bloomberg applications, and third-party platforms. Within our implementation organization, teams focus on both standardized integration solutions and customized client implementations, supporting a wide range of workflows across asset classes and regions. We work closely with clients, product, sales and engineering partners to deliver scalable, secure, and efficient integration outcomes across the APAC region. What’s the Role? In this role, you will deliver client-facing technology solutions within complex financial or enterprise environments. You will work closely with clients to understand their business workflows, technical landscapes, and integration requirements, and contribute to the delivery of scalable, production-ready solutions connecting client systems with Bloomberg platforms and services. You will be involved across the full delivery lifecycle, from scoping and solution design through implementation, testing, and transition to production support, while collaborating closely with internal product, engineering, and support teams. The role spans a broad range of integration use cases, including cloud-based connectivity, data transformation, real-time and batch processing, and interoperability with third-party systems. You will develop a deep understanding of client workflows and apply that knowledge to deliver reusable and scalable solutions that support evolving business needs. We’ll Trust You To: •	Design, configure, test, and implement solutions connecting client systems, Bloomberg platforms, and third-party technologies •	Collaborate with internal teams such as Product, Engineering, Support, and Sales to deliver high-quality client outcomes •	Support multiple concurrent projects across the full implementation lifecycle, from delivery through transition to production support, while balancing priorities in a fast-paced, client-facing environment •	Troubleshoot and resolve project-related implementation and connectivity issues efficiently to minimize client impact •	Develop and maintain a strong understanding of client workflows to support delivery, handover, and ongoing support •	Contribute to process improvement, standardization, and best practices across implementation and onboarding activities •	Demonstrate adaptability and a willingness to learn as technologies, products, and client requirements evolve You’ll Need To Have: •	3+ years of experience in the financial services industry, preferably in a technical role supporting front-office technologies, brokerage platforms, or OMS providers •	Experience supporting or implementing technology solutions involving system connectivity, data integration, or workflow automation •	Working knowledge of financial data transfer or messaging technologies, such as FIX, Web APIs, MQ, SFTP, or SWIFT •	Hands-on experience leveraging automation frameworks or internal/external tooling to standardize connectivity, configuration, and certification workflows •	Proven ability to manage multiple initiatives concurrently and communicate progress, risks, and outcomes to stakeholders •	Strong ability to work independently while building effective relationships with external clients and internal partners •	Demonstrated initiative in identifying process gaps and contributing to continuous improvement •	Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Japanese, with the ability to engage in complex technical discussions with diverse stakeholder groups •	Bachelor’s degree or equivalent professional experience We’d Love to See: •	Experience with FIX onboarding or comparable protocol-based client integrations •	Experience applying data transformation within integration workflows using specific ETL tools (e.g., Informatica, Mulesoft, Tibco, Dell Boomi) or transformation languages (XML/XSLT) •	Foundational certification or basic understanding of cloud technologies like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud •	Experience with IT service management, client relationship management, or operational support frameworks •	3+ years of programming or scripting experience used to support automation, tooling, or integration workflows (e.g., Bash, Perl, Python, C#, Java, C++) •	Experience using Web API testing tools such as Postman •	Proficiency in an additional Asian language If this sounds like you: Apply if you think we're a good match. title: Senior EU Regulatory Affairs Manager
description: About the Team Bloomberg’s External Relations team leads the company’s engagement with governments, regulators, and key stakeholders on public policy and regulatory issues that affect Bloomberg and its clients globally. The team combines strategic advocacy, subject-matter expertise, and thought leadership, working closely with colleagues across Legal & Compliance, Communications, Corporate Philanthropy, and Bloomberg’s business and product teams to ensure policy engagement is aligned with broader corporate objectives. Based in Brussels, the EU team sits at the centre of Bloomberg’s engagement with the European Union’s policymaking and regulatory ecosystem. We maintain active, trusted relationships with the European Commission, European Parliament, Council, ESMA, and national competent authorities, contributing constructively to regulatory initiatives that shape European financial markets and the data, technology, and infrastructure that support them. The Opportunity Bloomberg is seeking an External Relations Manager to play a leading role in shaping and driving Bloomberg’s EU government-relations and regulatory-engagement strategy, with a strong emphasis on building, sustaining, and leveraging trusted senior relationships across EU institutions and Member States. Based in Brussels, this role sits at the centre of Bloomberg’s engagement with the EU policymaking and supervisory ecosystem. As a senior member of the EU Government Relations and Regulatory Affairs team, you will be personally accountable for cultivating long-term, high-trust relationships with senior policymakers and regulators, while providing strategic direction and senior-level advice on complex regulatory issues at the intersection of financial markets, data, and technology. Success in this role requires deep regulatory expertise, excellent political judgement, credibility with senior stakeholders, and the ability to convert strong institutional relationships into effective regulatory outcomes that support transparent and vibrant European capital markets. What You’ll Do: Support the external engagement priorities of the senior team in Brussels, as well as internal partners (Legal, Compliance, Communications, Marketing, Corporate Philanthropy, and business leadership) to ensure a coordinated, consistent, and relationship-focused approach. Drive Bloomberg’s senior-level EU government-relations and regulatory-engagement strategy, with a clear focus on relationship-building, trust, and long-term influence rather than transactional engagement. Build, deepen, and maintain durable, high-trust relationships with senior officials across EU institutions (European Commission, European Parliament, Council), ESAs (including ESMA), national competent authorities, and key Member State stakeholders, positioning Bloomberg as a credible, constructive, and long-term partner. Act as a primary senior point of contact for EU policymakers and regulators, ensuring continuity, institutional memory, and strategic coherence in Bloomberg’s engagement over time. Set strategic priorities and engagement plans across EU financial-services and data regulation, including market structure (MiFID II/MiFIR), transparency regimes, trading venues, capital markets, the Savings and Investments Union (SIU), benchmarks, digital finance, sustainable finance disclosures, and AI-related regulation. Provide trusted, senior-level counsel to Bloomberg’s leadership, business, and product teams on regulatory developments, political dynamics, and supervisory risk, informed by close, ongoing engagement with policymakers and regulators. Lead Bloomberg’s regulatory and policy positioning, overseeing the development of high-quality consultation responses, position papers, briefings, and engagement materials that support and reinforce Bloomberg’s relationship-based approach. Represent Bloomberg in senior external settings, including high-level regulatory roundtables, expert groups, and industry fora, using these platforms to strengthen relationships and reinforce Bloomberg’s credibility and influence. Design and deliver targeted, relationship-driven engagement initiatives, including senior-level meetings, small-group roundtables, and strategic stakeholder programmes in Brussels and other key European financial centres. Contribute to broader External Relations leadership, helping to embed a culture of long-term relationship-building and institutional trust across Bloomberg’s EU engagement. What You’ll Bring: 10+ years’ experience in EU government relations, regulatory affairs, or financial-services policy, with a strong track record of building and sustaining senior-level relationships within EU institutions, supervisory authorities, and Member States. Deep expertise in EU financial-markets regulation, particularly market structure and transparency, combined with a practical understanding of how regulatory outcomes are shaped through sustained engagement. An established, credible network across EU institutions and key national authorities, and the ability to expand and strengthen that network on behalf of the firm. Strong political and institutional judgement, including the ability to read stakeholder dynamics, manage sensitive relationships, and engage effectively in complex regulatory environments. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the confidence to engage senior policymakers, regulators, and internal executives as a trusted counterpart. Comfort operating in senior, matrixed, international environments, balancing relationship management with strategic delivery. Fluency in English is essential; additional European languages are a strong advantage. Discover what makes Bloomberg unique - watch our podcast series for an inside look at our culture, values, and the people behind our success.

title: Bloomberg Intelligence Patent Specialist 6 month contract
description: Bloomberg Intelligence ("BI") is an investment research platform of 475 investment professionals covering company and credit research at the single-name and strategy level, while also addressing litigation, regulatory and environmental, social, and governance (ESG) issues that will shape companies, industries and markets. BI research is a combination of written analysis accompanied by interactive charting and analytics from a team of independent experts that provide deep insight into where crucial industries and investment market trends stand today and where they may be heading next. As a member of our Therapeutics team, you’ll be responsible for building detailed patent databases related to drugs and biologics. You will work with our patent and litigation analysts to contribute market exclusivity analysis for our disease hubs. REQUIREMENTS: -  Graduate degree in chemistry, biochemistry or related field or combination of commensurate education and experience -  USPTO Registration and patent agent/attorney experience -  Experience in comprehensive, worldwide patent searching -  Experience in chemical patent prosecution -  Understanding of scientific and clinical data -  Strong attention to detail -  Excellent communication and collaboration -  Proficiency in Excel -  Good writing skills -  Strong organization skills and capable of balancing multiple projects -  A dedication to developing and improving products -  An ability to meet deadlines, logically address problems and set priorities NICE TO HAVE: -  Knowledge of the biotech industry and regulatory environment in the US, Europe, Japan and/or China -  Understanding of financial markets and concepts -  Experience with Python, R, or SQL Apply if you think we're a good match. title: Advertising Operations
description: The energy of a newsroom. The pace of a trading floor. We work hard, and we work fast, while keeping up the creativity and entrepreneurialism we're known for. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. Bloomberg LP has built a significant media business spanning digital, television, radio, print and live event platforms across the globe. In the midst of a historic time in the media industry, Bloomberg Media is growing its global footprint and reach through new innovations from Bloomberg Originals to New Economy. The Advertising Operations role will contribute to the end-to-end execution of advertising campaigns across digital, television, audio, print, programmatic, and terminal platforms, focusing on client performance, optimization and insights. title: Senior Software Engineer SRE Trade Automation Execution
description: The Trade Automation & Execution (TRAX) group builds the platforms and services that power modern electronic trading at Bloomberg. We design and operate high-performance, distributed, real-time systems used by financial institutions worldwide to execute trades, automate workflows, and make data-driven decisions. As markets evolve toward automation, scale, and intelligence, ensuring these platforms remain scalable, resilient, and predictable is critical. This is where TRAX Reliability plays a key role. We are looking for an experienced engineer to help ensure that our real-time trading systems can scale safely, perform reliably under extreme market conditions, and recover gracefully from failures before issues impact clients. Our Team: The TRAX Reliability team partners closely with application and infrastructure engineers to embed scalability, resilience, and technical risk management into trading systems from the ground up. Rather than reacting to production incidents, we take a data-driven, proactive approach . We study real production workloads and controlled experiments to understand how systems behave under load, how failures propagate, and where bottlenecks emerge. By connecting performance, capacity, and risk, we help teams plan for growth, traffic spikes, and adverse scenarios with clear scaling strategies and recovery expectations. We also design and build tooling that continuously evaluates system risk and performance. This includes running targeted stress tests, collecting detailed metrics, and surfacing insights through real-time dashboards. These tools enable teams to quickly identify bottlenecks across services, queues, and infrastructure, and to understand their impact on client experience. What’s in it for you: Have direct impact on the stability and resilience of execution platforms relied upon by the world’s leading buy-side firms Work on real-world, high-stakes distributed systems that need to operate under high performance and reliability requirements Develop deep expertise in scaling, failure modes, and technical risk management for real-time trading systems Collaborate with engineers across New York, London, and Frankfurt, significantly expanding your technical network Partner with application, observability, and infrastructure teams to influence system design across the organization We’ll trust you to: Identify, prioritize, and track scalability and reliability risks across large-scale trading platforms Partner with application teams to diagnose and address performance and resilience challenges Analyze system behavior under real and simulated load, including latency, throughput, failover, and blast radius Design and run chaos engineering experiments and game-day exercises to validate system capacity and resilience Build and maintain automation and tooling for early detection and mitigation of production risks Communicate technical trade-offs, solutions, and roadmaps clearly to engineering stakeholders Plan for traffic growth and peak market events with clear scaling strategies and guardrails You’ll need to have: 5+ years of professional experience with a high-level programming language such as Python, Java, or C++, preferably on Unix/Linux Solid understanding of Unix/Linux fundamentals Hands-on experience contributing to or triaging scaling and reliability issues in production distributed systems Experience working with metrics, monitoring, or observability platforms, such as Grafana, Prometheus, or log analytics tools Strong analytical skills and the ability to reason about complex system behavior and failure modes We’d love to see: Familiarity with chaos engineering, fault injection, or load testing frameworks A track record of writing blameless postmortems and leading game-day or incident review exercises Curiosity and willingness to learn across all layers of the software and infrastructure stack Why TRAX Reliability You’ll work on systems that sit at the heart of global financial markets. Your work will directly influence how trades are executed, how platforms behave during market stress, and how reliably clients can operate at scale. If you’re excited by real-time systems, distributed architectures, and solving hard reliability problems with real-world impact, we want to talk to you. Salary Range = 160000 - 240000 USD Annually + Benefits + Bonus The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level. We offer one of the most comprehensive and generous benefits plans available and offer a range of total rewards that may include merit increases, incentive compensation (exempt roles only), paid holidays, paid time off, medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, life insurance, and various wellness programs, among others. title: BVAL Bloomberg s Evaluated Pricing Service Evaluator US Agency Structured Products
description: Bloomberg’s Evaluated Pricing Service, BVAL, provides transparent and accurate valuations for fixed income and derivatives instruments. Our clients — including mutual funds, hedge funds, money managers, internal pricing teams, and auditors — rely on BVAL to establish fair and independent fixed income asset valuations. We are looking for an Evaluator to join our Agency Securitized Products Rates team. As a BVAL Evaluator, you will serve as a sector expert responsible for delivering accurate, high-quality pricing data to our clients. In this role, you’ll apply your market expertise, contribute to the development of valuation models, enhance workflow efficiency, and collaborate closely with cross-functional teams. You will support valuations for Agency MBS markets, including Agency CMOs (Fixed, Floaters and Derivatives) to help advance the BVAL offering, provide accurate pricing, and excellent service to BVAL clients. The ideal candidate should have 5+ years of market experience in the sectors below, with a background in trading, portfolio management, research, structuring, or valuations. -	Agency CMOs (Fixed, Floaters and Derivatives) We'll expect you to: Leverage market expertise, BVAL’s data-driven framework, and relative value analysis to produce accurate pricing Work with internal engineering teams to design, maintain, and enhance valuation models Partner with internal teams including Product Management and Sales to expand BVAL’s Securitized Products offering Engage directly with clients and colleagues to discuss market dynamics, model assumptions, pricing methodologies, and product features You'll need to have: Proven expertise in fixed income pricing and analytics, including a deep understanding of any of the sectors listed above Demonstrated ability to work with complex systems and models, including databases and in-house analytics Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present sophisticated concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and data modeling Familiarity with Bloomberg Terminal tools and functionality Experience in Python, VBA, SQL and/or Data visualization tools like Superset Salary Range = 160000 - 210000 USD Annually + Benefits + Bonus The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level. We offer one of the most comprehensive and generous benefits plans available and offer a range of total rewards that may include merit increases, incentive compensation (exempt roles only), paid holidays, paid time off, medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, life insurance, and various wellness programs, among others. title: HR Content Strategy Manager HR Enterprise Enablement and Governance Team
description: The energy of a newsroom, the pace of a trading floor, the buzz of a recent tech breakthrough — we work hard, and we work fast, while keeping up the quality and accuracy we’re known for. It’s what keeps us inventing and reinventing. Our culture is open, collaborative, and focused on elevating one another. Here, you can do incredible work — the kind of work that has a real impact across the company. It’s up to you to make it happen. The Team The newly established HR Enterprise Enablement and Governance Team sits at the center of the HR Enterprise organization, connecting the dots across Global People Services, Employee Relations, Benefits, Position Management, and Immigration. This team exists to strengthen alignment, create clear ownership for cross-functional priorities, and elevate operational excellence across HR. We are the hub that drives shared strategies, consistent execution, and visibility across enterprise-wide initiatives. Our remit spans project management, product oversight, data and insights, and policy/process governance. This team brings together work that touches all areas of HR — ensuring we deliver greater consistency, transparency, and effectiveness. What’s the role? We’re looking for a highly skilled HR professional who will own the end-to-end lifecycle of HR knowledge and documentation, with a strong focus on content strategy, governance, and digital employee experience. This individual will own the creation, governance, maintenance, and evolution of HR policies, guides, and process documentation, ensuring content remains accurate, scalable, and usable across global HR audiences. They will ensure HR documentation is structured, searchable, and optimized for digital delivery, including intranet platforms, HR systems, and employee-facing AI tools, with accountability for accuracy, usability, and readiness for cyclical HR events. In addition, this role will define documentation standards, knowledge architecture, and content frameworks used across shared HR platforms to ensure consistency, scalability, and long-term sustainability. You’ll work across multiple HR groups — including GPS, Benefits, Immigration, Employee Relations, and more — to translate complex HR topics into simple, consistent, and accessible guidance. The ideal candidate brings both HR expertise and strong content development skills, ensuring documentation reflects our standards for accuracy, tone, and usability. We’ll trust you to: * Own the full lifecycle of HR documentation, including creation, governance, maintenance, and retirement of policies, process guides, toolkits, and FAQs * Translate complex HR, legal, and operational content into clear, actionable guidance designed for employee self-service and digital consumption * Partner with HR subject matter experts (HRBPs, GPS, Legal, CoEs) to validate and update content as processes evolve * Create and maintain a documentation governance strategy, including ownership models, version control, review cycles, and approval workflows * Ensure seasonal and cyclical HR events (e.g., performance reviews, compensation cycles, internships, and benefits enrollment) are reviewed and refreshed on a recurring basis * Establish templates and tone standards to drive consistency across HR documentation * Identify content gaps and propose improvements to enhance HR efficiency and the employee experience * Manage documentation integration and accuracy within the employee-facing AI tool to ensure a seamless and intuitive user experience * Advise on optimal documentation solutions and structures for shared HR platforms to enable scalability and ease of navigation * Collaborate with HR Tech and Communications teams to publish and structure content on internal platforms (e.g., intranet, Workday Journeys, knowledge bases) * Maintain an organized, well-structured library of documents with clear taxonomy and metadata for easy access You’ll need to have: * 8+ years of experience in HR operations, HR communications and policy documentation, or related HR functions * Proven experience owning documentation governance and content lifecycle management in complex, matrixed organizations * Strong understanding of HR processes and lifecycle events, including cyclical activities such as performance management, compensation, benefits enrollment, etc. * Demonstrated experience developing and maintaining content across multiple HR systems or platforms. * Exceptional writing, editing, and organizational skills with a focus on accuracy, clarity, and usability * Ability to collaborate effectively across HR disciplines (HRBPs, GPS, Legal, other CoEs) and influence documentation standards across diverse teams * Strong project management skills with the ability to manage competing priorities, drive accountability, and deliver to deadlines * We’d love to see: * Experience leading or contributing to cross-functional documentation initiatives in a large, global organization * Familiarity with AI tools, digital knowledge bases, or employee self-service platforms and how content interacts within them * Knowledge of content taxonomy, metadata, and search optimization for enterprise documentation * Background in instructional design, UX writing, or change management communications * Comfort creating visual content such as process maps or decision trees to complement written documentation We’d love to see: * Experience leading or contributing to cross-functional documentation initiatives in a large, global organization * Familiarity with AI tools, digital knowledge bases, or employee self-service platforms and how content interacts within them * Knowledge of content taxonomy, metadata, and search optimization for enterprise documentation * Background in instructional design, UX writing, or change management communications * Comfort creating visual content such as process maps or decision trees to complement written documentation Salary Range = 180000 - 215000 USD Annually + Benefits + Bonus The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level. We offer one of the most comprehensive and generous benefits plans available and offer a range of total rewards that may include merit increases, incentive compensation (exempt roles only), paid holidays, paid time off, medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, life insurance, and various wellness programs, among others. The Company does not provide benefits directly to contingent workers/contractors and interns. title: US Agriculture Reporter
description: Bloomberg News is seeking a reporter to help drive our agriculture coverage in the Americas and break news on the latest market developments. You’ll take on a crucial beat focused on soft commodities such as coffee, cocoa and sugar. Your reporting will span market movements, global trading trends, government policy, corporate strategy, farmer sentiment, and consumer and environmental issues. The ideal candidate will have a natural curiosity about how the agricultural sector operates — from farms to boardrooms — and a keen sense of how developments ripple across global markets and economies. Agriculture is making major headlines as Donald Trump's policies reshape global trade, while US farmers are getting government bailouts as they struggle with weak crop prices and stiff competition from growing powerhouse Brazil. You’ll be responsible for delivering agenda-setting journalism that captures this upheaval — from scoops and breaking news to deeply reported enterprise pieces. Working alongside colleagues in the Americas and across Bloomberg’s global network, you’ll stay on top of news affecting commodities futures, corporate moves and M&A, regulation and policy — and help bring clarity and insight to our global audience. To be considered, please submit your application by Friday, February 13. We’ll trust you to: Monitor and explain market moves on major commodities, writing with precision and insight for sophisticated readers. Generate original story and project ideas that vividly illustrate how commodities markets influence traders, farmers, corporations, and consumers. Interpret and analyze the effects of tariffs on markets and trade. Break news on issues including policymaking and environmental developments. Connect the dots to pitch ambitious feature stories that span Bloomberg's platforms and make our content accessible to a diverse and business-savvy audience. Collaborate closely with colleagues across teams, bureaus and continents to deliver a global perspective to our readers. You’ll need to have: Ideally some experience in a real-time news environment A proven track record reporting and writing about business Demonstrated success in building your own sources to break news An ability to write quickly and clearly under deadline pressure Demonstrated continuous career growth and initiative within an organization Strong communication and collaboration skills We’d love to see: Familiarity with journalism across platforms, including digital, video, podcasts and data visualization Preferably experience covering agriculture or other commodities Salary Range = 90000 - 120000 USD Annually + Benefits + Bonus The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level. title: Viz Graphics Operator Weekend Contract
description: Bloomberg Media is looking for an individual with a proactive attitude who is focused, flexible, and proficient in several aspects of broadcast operations, and who can work collaboratively in a live control room and studio environment in a viz/graphics operator capacity. We’re looking for someone who can take initiative and thoroughly follow a live broadcast conversation to accurately match elements on-screen. They will be required to work with operations, on-air talent, engineering, and editorial teams, as well as their global counterparts to ensure high-quality visual production on an early morning, weekend (part-time) basis. We'll trust you to: Participate in pre-show meetings with editorial and technical teams to align show vision. Move quickly and accurately under pressure in a fast-paced live broadcast environment to deliver a high-quality visual product. Operate a live broadcast graphics rundown, firing lower-third and full screen graphics to various engines while communicating with control room crew and editorial colleagues for a 3-hour production. Proactively change graphics to accurately follow topic changes and breaking news developments, working quickly to match relevant graphics with the on-air conversation as they become available. Communicate with Team Leads to report on issues and faults that will impact global counterparts. You'll need to have: Bachelor’s degree or 2 years of experience working in a live TV environment. 2 years of experience operating within Vizrt ecosystem or with relevant live graphics software (Xpression, Chyron). An ability to complete tasks with a high level of accuracy under tight deadlines in high pressure situations in live broadcast environment. Familiarity with ENPS or other relevant broadcast news rundown software A strong desire to work as part of a team in a highly collaborative environment. Ability to manage multiple streams of information simultaneously while operating live graphics system. Early morning weekend availability is required. If this sounds like you, apply today! We're eager to speak with you. Salary Range = 45 - 50 USD Hourly The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level. title: Senior Software Engineer Custom Data
description: Our team The Custom Data team helps clients to bring their firm’s private datasets into the Bloomberg ecosystem. It lets them link proprietary data stores directly to the Terminal and across our Enterprise suite, so teams can collaborate on the same live data, tailor workflows end-to-end, and embed custom analytics at every stage of the investment cycle (from idea generation through execution and post-trade reporting). For buy-side firms like mutual funds, hedge funds and pensions, Custom data transforms the Terminal from a solo research tool into a shared intelligence platform. The Custom Data platform delivers a managed infrastructure encompassing the end-to-end lifecycle of proprietary institutional data. Key Capabilities Metadata and Access Management: Offers tools to define metadata for proprietary data and manage access to govern data access. Ingest Pipelines: Provides both interactive and batch ingest pipelines to facilitate the transfer of data from the client environment into the Bloomberg ecosystem. Rich Key Structure: Enables clients to store data against a combination of one or more financial attributes. Auditing Capabilities: Ensures the transparency and 'paper trail' necessary for regulatory compliance and internal data integrity. APIs for Integration: provides standardized Read APIs that seamlessly embed data within Bloomberg's ecosystem, including the Terminal, execution platforms, and risk workflows. Data Extraction: Supplies Data and Audit feeds to facilitate the extraction of client-provided data outside the Bloomberg ecosystem. System Scale and Performance: The system processes in excess of 250 million daily requests , comprising 150 million metadata requests and 100 million read queries. It serves approximately 65 billion data points across interactive, reporting, batch, and screening applications. The platform manages data for 11,000 firms , encompassing 365,000 unique fields . It maintains stringent latency requirements to support real-time Bloomberg Terminal workflows. We’ll trust you to: Design and implement features in the product while adhering to strict latency requirements. Write maintainable and production-quality code. Contribute to system design and refactor Python and C++ services to follow clean, single-responsibility principles. Evaluate next-generation storage solutions. Modernize Custom data integration with standard Bloomberg APIs. Own observability from metrics to dashboards, defining clear SLIs and SLOs. Design tools to improve team oncall/operational experience. Partner with other enterprise teams in Bloomberg  to evolve the future of Custom data at Bloomberg. Mentor junior engineers in the team on best engineering practices. You'll need to have: 4+ years of experience in backend engineering, ideally with Python Strong system design and debugging skills in production environments Familiarity with distributed messaging or stream-processing frameworks (Kafka preferred) Familiarity with relational and noSQL datastores at Bloomberg (Cassandra preferred) A strong product mindset paired with genuine empathy for client needs A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience We’d love to see: Familiarity with Python  standards and tooling Background in distributed systems like Kafka, Redis, Cassandra, or HBase Experience with CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, or system observability Exposure to containerized environments using Docker or Kubernetes Salary Range = 160000 - 240000 USD Annually + Benefits + Bonus The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level. We offer one of the most comprehensive and generous benefits plans available and offer a range of total rewards that may include merit increases, incentive compensation (exempt roles only), paid holidays, paid time off, medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, life insurance, and various wellness programs, among others. The Company does not provide benefits directly to contingent workers/contractors and interns. Discover what makes Bloomberg unique - watch our podcast series for an inside look at our culture, values, and the people behind our success.

title: Freelance Desk Producer Contract
description: Bloomberg News is one of the biggest financial and business news organizations in the world. We lead the way in breaking news and providing analysis on financial markets, from intraday coverage through in-depth features. We are known for our quality, accuracy and ability to deliver news investors can use. It's what keeps us inventing and re-inventing, all the time. Bloomberg Television is seeking a freelance Desk Producer to join the US broadcast news desk from our headquarters in New York. This is a fast-paced, news-driven role suited for a journalist who thrives on tight deadlines, collaboration, and has sharp editorial judgment. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in coordinating live hits, turning newsworthy sound from interviews and events, and ensuring timely and compelling content delivery across Bloomberg’s TV, Radio and multimedia platforms. You’ll work hand-in-hand with field crews, producers, and reporters to respond to breaking news, business developments, and major global events. You’ll bring a deep interest in business, economics and geopolitics, with the ability to spot what matters—and act quickly. You’ll also be someone who enjoys building strong working relationships across teams, and who thrives balancing multiple priorities under pressure. We'll trust you to: Coordinate daily newsgathering efforts, liaising with bureaus, field crews, and reporters to line up live hits and coordinating rolling coverage Cut newsworthy soundbites and segments from live interviews, press conferences, panels and events, quickly and with editorial accuracy Make editorial decisions in real time, helping shape our on-air narrative and content Collaborate closely with Bloomberg’s producers, anchors, correspondents, and the wider editorial team to prioritize the right coverage Maintain a strong awareness of market-moving news and political and economic developments across the Americas You’ll need to have: 3–5+ years of experience in broadcast journalism, news desk production, or digital video production Excellent editorial judgment with a track record of responding effectively to breaking news A collaborative approach and excellent interpersonal and communication skills Flexibility to work early shifts as needed A solid grasp of US business, politics, and financial markets Experience using video editing systems to cut and turn around fast-moving content is a bonus Salary Range = 65 - 75 USD Hourly The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting.
