title: User Support On site Technical Support Mumbai
description: Bloomberg is a global leader in business and financial information, news and insight, and we use innovative technology to deliver trusted data and bring transparency to the financial markets. Our customers around the globe rely on us for the information and tools they need to make critical investment decisions and remain connected across all sides of the financial community. And, to ensure the best experience for our 26,000+ employees across more than 150 locations around the world, we provide the spaces and systems that allow our teams to work together with agility, productivity and collaboration, no matter where they are. Our Bloomberg On-Site Support (BOS) teams work with urgency to provide 24/7 on-site technical solutions to Bloomberg’s internal and external customers in more than 75 countries. Our customers rely on our technology and the support that we provide to be able to do their jobs in a dynamic, demanding, technology-focused environment. The team are all highly skilled specialists who are able to assist with all Bloomberg hardware (PCs, biometric devices, routers), software and networking infrastructure. We are a one-stop shop of on-site support and do not leave until the job is done. What’s the role? You operate as a Technical Support Associate when you are on-site and make valuable contributions to our customers because of your expertise within Bloomberg working closely with other Enterprise Technology teams. You pride yourself in offering top-notch customer solution-focused service by being able to understand and pre-empt needs as well as deliver personal, on-the-ground value, and assistance spotting gaps and implementing changes. You are the calm voice and cool head in a fast-paced environment, but you understand urgency, work hard, have commercial acumen and are customer service driven. Our customers internally and externally count on you daily. Our team is tight, but our culture is wide open, just like our spaces. We challenge and support each other. This is an on-site role based in Bloomberg's Mumbai office We'll trust you to: Flexibly support internal and external customer technical needs to resolution Troubleshoot technical issues (desktop, network connectivity, etc.) both in the customer’s environment (onsite) as well as remotely Deliver an extraordinary level of customer service under pressure, whilst maintaining focus on solving the issue Accurately detail fixing steps and resolutions using our proprietary ticketing system You'll need to have: Demonstrated experience in helpdesk, desktop support or technical support within an enterprise environment Extensive experience working with PC software/hardware, networking devices, Windows OS Exposure to networking technology (networking hardware, TCP/IP, LAN, and WAN) Data centre experience Excellent interpersonal and customer-facing skills Strong communication skills in English and Hindi Willingness to travel to customer sites to provide onsite support as needed Flexible coverage schedule to accommodate occasional evening, weekend work (time off in lieu) We'd love to see: Programming knowledge If this sounds like you: Apply if you think we're a good match. title: Technical Product Manager GenAI Data Discovery Governance Platform CTO Office
description: Bloomberg’s CTO Office is the future-looking technical and product arm of Bloomberg L.P. We envision, design, and prototype the next generation of infrastructure, hardware, and applications that power the Bloomberg Terminal and beyond. Our work spans AI and ML platforms, cloud infrastructure, open-source stewardship, and generative AI innovation. For over a decade, Bloomberg has been at the forefront of applying AI, ML, and NLP to financial intelligence, powering products in sentiment analysis, classification, document understanding, recommendation, and generative AI. Behind these innovations lies a vast ecosystem of data and compute platforms. We are now building new cloud-native capabilities to accelerate AI development across the company and enable the next generation of intelligent products. What’s In It For You We are looking for a Technical Product Manager to define and execute the strategy for Bloomberg’s AI Data Discovery & Governance Platform , a cloud-native foundation for AI data management and lifecycle visibility. You will design and deliver modern data capabilities purpose-built for AI, focused on making data discoverable, accessible, and trackable from curation and training through evaluation and inference. Your mission is to connect Bloomberg’s rich data ecosystem to our AI compute environment in the cloud. This includes linking dataset registries, feature platforms, and evaluation datasets to training pipelines, notebooks, and inference systems. The platform you help build will power data discovery, governance, and transparency across Bloomberg’s AI community, enabling faster innovation and greater trust in AI data. Why This Matters This platform will serve as the backbone of Bloomberg’s AI data strategy, ensuring that teams can efficiently develop and operate AI systems with clarity, traceability, and compliance. You will work closely with engineering, infrastructure, and data platform teams across the company to build capabilities that extend Bloomberg’s existing strengths while introducing new systems optimized for AI in the cloud. Your impact will span the entire AI lifecycle, helping data scientists and engineers discover, understand, and manage AI data with the same rigor and reliability that define Bloomberg’s broader data ecosystem. We’ll trust you to Define and own the vision for Bloomberg’s AI Data Discovery & Governance Platform, built for AI data workflows in the cloud. Design for the AI lifecycle by building APIs and interfaces that make datasets easy to find, version, and use across training, evaluation, and inference. Develop governance capabilities that ensure responsible use of AI data, with lineage, compliance, and auditing built in from the start. Partner with engineering to deliver scalable systems for metadata management, access control, and lifecycle tracking. Collaborate across Bloomberg’s AI ecosystem to integrate data and compute capabilities that support experimentation and production deployment. Shape the developer experience by defining metadata models, access patterns, and discovery tools that make AI data workflows intuitive. Drive the roadmap for how Bloomberg builds, governs, and scales AI data in the cloud, aligning technology direction with business priorities. You’ll Need to Have 5+ years of experience in technical product management, ideally within AI/ML platforms, data infrastructure, or developer platforms. Hands-on experience building or scaling AI data systems, feature stores, data catalogs, or MLOps infrastructure. Familiarity with cloud-native architectures, distributed systems, Kubernetes, and modern data platform technologies. A strong understanding of AI development workflows, from experimentation to model training, evaluation, and deployment. Proven ability to work cross-functionally with engineering, research, and platform teams to deliver technical products at scale. Excellent communication and storytelling skills, with the ability to articulate a technical vision and influence across diverse teams. We’d Love to See A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or equivalent experience. Experience with LLMs, generative AI, or evaluation dataset frameworks. Experience designing cloud-based data architectures or managing hybrid workloads. Familiarity with data governance, catalogs, or metadata management systems. Contributions to or experience with open-source data and AI infrastructure projects. Why Join Us You will play a pivotal role in shaping Bloomberg’s AI data future by building the platform that enables discoverability, governance, and lifecycle insight across all AI initiatives. This is an opportunity to help define how Bloomberg’s vast data resources are harnessed for AI responsibly, efficiently, and at global scale. You will work alongside world-class engineers, researchers, and product leaders, driving an ambitious agenda to make AI at Bloomberg faster, safer, and more impactful. title: Senior Data Management Professional Data Product Owner Private Deals Valuations
description: Bloomberg runs on data. Our products are fueled by powerful information. We combine data and context to paint a complete picture for our clients—around the clock and around the world. In Data, we are responsible for delivering this data, news, and analytics through innovative technology—quickly and accurately. We apply product thinking, domain expertise, and technical insight to continuously improve our data offerings, ensuring they remain reliable, scalable, and fit-for-purpose in a fast-changing landscape. Our Team The Private Deals Data team is responsible for Bloomberg’s private transactions data model—an essential foundation for understanding global private markets. This data defines and enriches private companies, linking them to. Private company data plays a critical role in research, investment analysis, compliance, and due diligence. Integrating diverse datasets with our core private company data helps clients uncover insights, validate exposures, monitor evolving risks, and identify new opportunities in opaque and fast-growing markets. The Role We are seeking a Data Product Owner, Private Deals and Valuation to lead the design and execution of Bloomberg’s strategy for integrating M&A, Private Market, and related datasets into Bloomberg’s broader semantic model and analytics stack. You’ll define how private company and deal data connect to Bloomberg’s discovery tools, APIs, and BQL—making them intuitive, queryable, and analytically powerful for clients and internal users alike. You will own the roadmap for embedding private market content into Bloomberg’s data ecosystem, ensuring seamless discoverability, interoperability, and analytical consistency. Working closely with engineering, product, and analytics teams, you’ll translate complex user needs into actionable integration requirements—bridging the gap between data architecture and client workflow impact. You Will: Own the roadmap for integrating M&A, private company, and valuation datasets into Bloomberg’s semantic model and BQL. Define how users discover and interact with private market data through Bloomberg functions, search, and API access. Translate business use cases into schema, metadata, and data exposure requirements Partner with Engineering to deliver scalable integrations that support both internal and client-facing workflows. Identify and prioritize cross-domain data linkages (e.g., ESG, financials, ownership, transactions) that enhance insight generation. Drive internal alignment on integration priorities across multiple product verticals. Define acceptance criteria for integrations and ensure they meet performance, completeness, and usability standards. Advocate for user-centric data design—ensuring private market datasets are as accessible and discoverable as their public counterparts. You’ll Need to Have: *We use years of experience as a guide but will consider all candidates who can demonstrate the required skills. 4+ years of experience in product management, data platform strategy, or data integration. Strong understanding of private market data (companies, transactions, valuations) and its analytical use cases. Proven ability to translate client workflows into data requirements and functional specifications. Experience working with data engineers and modelers to design integration schemas. Familiarity with data discovery, cataloging, or semantic modeling concepts. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to bridge technical and non-technical teams. Demonstrated success managing cross-functional roadmaps and competing priorities. We’d Love to See: Experience working with Bloomberg Query Language (BQL) or comparable query frameworks. Familiarity with enterprise data integration, APIs, or graph-based models. Understanding of how M&A, private equity, and venture datasets interconnect within financial analysis. Track record of delivering data products that improve discoverability or analytical capability. Curiosity about evolving data integration patterns and private market data innovations. Does this sound like you? Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are! title: 2026 Data Management Professional Tokyo
description: The Role: Our Data Management Professionals use technical skills to acquire, validate, store, protect, and model comprehensive financial data which is accessible to our clients across various Bloomberg platforms. The teams play a key role in empowering our clients to make well-informed business decisions, whilst providing the necessary client support. As a Data Management Professional you will apply your technical skills, and Bloomberg’s data management methodologies, to succeed in your role. Coupled with effective communication and a customer-forward outlook, these skills will allow you to effectively manage pipelines of financial data fostering into the Bloomberg Terminal, while developing relationships with internal and external partners to deliver quality products. You will be responsible for applying your skills in data management to a specific data product. Data products at Bloomberg are of high quality, well modeled, and well tailored to a variety of customers and use cases. Data teams play a meaningful role in helping our customers make sound data-driven decisions. Ahead of joining your full-time team, you will attend our on-boarding program, learning the ins and outs of our data management best practices and how to be successful in our dynamic and innovative environment. You’ll be exposed to new technologies and state of the art tools; while simultaneously building a strong network of friends and colleagues. We’d love to see: Previous work, internship and/or academic experience in data analysis, financial market research and/or information technology A passion and curiosity about financial and economic data with the aspiration to work in the financial/fintech services industry Experience implementing high volume, low-latency ETL pipelines Language Requirement: Japanese proficiency at JLPT N1 level Discover what makes Bloomberg unique - watch our podcast series for an inside look at our culture, values, and the people behind our success.

title: Product Manager Interest Rate Swaps
description: Bloomberg Electronic Trading Systems (ETS) offers premier multi-asset trading venues and services, including workflows for the trading of Interest Rate Swaps.  As an IRS E-Trading Product Manager, you will help drive the overall strategy and growth of the electronic rates trading business. You will develop solutions for the local market and the global investor community by collaborating with key external market participants - including buyside institutions, liquidity providers and market infrastructure participants - and managing internal stakeholders to deliver market leading trading solutions. What is the role? As an IRS E-Trading Product Manager, you will be responsible for increasing our footprint in the IRS E-Trading Dealer-to-Client market, with a focus on the US market. In doing so you will increase market-share and focus on workflows for key clients in the Hedge Fund and Asset Management community. Working hand-in-hand with Bloomberg Engineers you will deliver market leading workflows and execution tools. Working with regional sales teams you will build liquidity for the E-Trading offering and encourage buyside participation. We will trust you to: Client-Centric Solution Design : Work with clients to identify needs and build solutions and trading workflows that provide a competitive edge. Engage directly with clients to understand their challenges and collaborate on developing scalable solutions. Product Management : Ensure we have incremental deliveries and a phased product roadmap with clearly outlined business outcomes. Your leadership in product strategy, combined with your experience in project management will be crucial in driving continuous improvement and customer satisfaction. Senior Level Engagement : Use your network to develop strong senior level relationships across the industry at leading buyside and sellside firms. You may be expected to participate in Industry Associations. Self-start : It is extremely important that you will set the direction for your business and own the outcomes. You will need to have: 10+ years experience in Fixed Income Rates markets Strong technical understanding of Interest Rate Swaps trading Demonstrated ability to develop thorough, integrated, commercially sound product plans Technical proficiency in creating detailed Business Requirement Specifications to be used by engineers as a blueprint for the product you are developing Demonstrated the ability to deliver technical solutions to complex problems in a fast-paced, risk-focused environment We'd love to see: Knowledge of Python Product Management experience in a D2C or D2D E-Trading business Strong understanding of technology architecture Salary Range = 140000 - 295000 USD Annually + Benefits + Bonus The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. title: Enterprise Sales Electronic Trading Solutions Fixed Income Account Manager Singapore
description: Bloomberg is a global leader in business and financial information, news and insight, and we use innovative technology to deliver trusted data and bring transparency to the financial markets. Our customers around the globe rely on us for the information and tools they need to make critical investment decisions and remain connected across all sides of the financial community. And, to ensure the best experience for our 26,000+ employees across more than 150 locations around the world, we provide the spaces and systems that allow our teams to work together with agility, productivity and collaboration, no matter where they are. The Bloomberg Financial Solutions department is at the forefront of ensuring success for our customers and employees alike. Our team comprises several key pillars: sales, service, operations, culture and brand. As a department, we are united by a common goal: We create meaningful relationships with clients by understanding their needs and delivering exceptional end-to-end support from sales and implementation, through their ongoing relationship with Bloomberg. Electronic Trading Solutions unites all of Bloomberg's cross-asset electronic trading platforms into one business, delivering trading solutions and analytics to both our Buy-side and Sell-side clients. Our solutions are an integral part of the Bloomberg network, allowing our clients to seamlessly stage, monitor, trade, clear, allocate and perform TCA all on one platform. In addition to capturing workflow, securing terminals, and growing our franchise market share, we offer many revenue-generating solutions that integrate with Bloomberg and non-Bloomberg OMS solutions, across the financial market. What's the role? Bloomberg's Electronic Trading Solutions team sells various solutions for Fixed Income e-trading and workflow automation, as well as work with other enterprise sales teams to cross sell Bloomberg's entire suite of products. As an ETS Account Manager focusing on Fixed Income buy-side clients, you will be responsible for managing and growing our Electronic Trading franchise across our platforms. This is primarily accomplished by building deep, value focused relationships with clients, and engaging with them on ways they can grow and advance their business by partnering with Bloomberg for their trading, automation, and analysis needs. Account Managers are expected to manage a book of clients, and to develop a deep understanding of their business, workflows and Electronic Trading needs. The goal are increasing revenue from our client base and onboarding new clients to our trading platforms. We will trust you to: Manage relationships and grow revenue within our client base by proactively engaging with and meeting clients through floor walks, relationship management, referrals and cross-selling to achieve sales targets Build an in-depth understanding around our client workflow to solve and offer alternative solutions to problems that arises throughout the life of a trade Acquire detailed knowledge of our products to better position our offering and directly impact sales Anticipate our client's future need/issues and come up with preemptive measures Develop a market through community building initiatives with key industry players from market participants, policy makers, and industry associations Hold meetings with clients and prospects to present unique Bloomberg solutions Use your strong communication and presentation skills to build strong relationships with clients, including senior level stakeholders Use your project management skills to coordinate product initiatives regionally, including but not limited to taking on product advocacy as well as drive product improvement by providing feedback to Bloomberg's business managers and product development teams on user demand and evolving market practices Employ best use of our flat corporate structure to network across various departments, calling on specific expertise and promote collaboration to deliver solutions to our clients You will need to have: 4+ years of sales experience in a financial markets or a financial markets technology company Experience selling or supporting financial trading technology solutions to financial institutions Work experience of Fixed Income eTrading workflows A track record supporting enterprise technology solutions, particularly to Buy-side financial institutions, Asset Managers and/or Insurance companies Established track record of both relationship management and client support, covering clients in markets including, but not limited to Singapore and South-East Asia Demonstrated ability to develop and grow a market by nurturing senior relationships, community and networks Knowledge of electronic trading, execution management systems and trading connectivity tools Strong understanding of the impact of regulation, market structure and compliance on electronic trading An ability to be resourceful, possess problem solving skills and have a strong "can do" attitude Demonstrated continuous career growth within an organization Excellent written and verbal communication skill in English Bachelor's degree or degree-equivalent qualifications Ability to travel If this sounds like you: Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https:www/bloomberg.com/professional Why Bloomberg? We're individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and experiences who take on big challenges and create even bigger impact through our work. We're interested in what makes you you, and how we can create opportunities for you to channel your unique, personal energy and grow to your fullest potential. Bloomberg is committed to improving the communities, cities and countries in which we work, and we support various initiatives including hiring and developing local talent. So, we may prioritize candidates with legal authorization to work full-time in Singapore for this role, who do not require Bloomberg to sponsor their work authorization. Learn more about our office and benefits: Singapore | www.bloomberg.com/singapore Discover what makes Bloomberg unique - watch our podcast series for an inside look at our culture, values, and the people behind our success.

title: Senior Software Engineer Research Management Systems Analytics Reporting
description: Research Management Systems (RMS) provides structure, control, efficiency and transparency to the investment research process of institutional investors. Every client has their own approach to identifying investible opportunities, it forms a key part of their strategy for beating the market. RMS seeks to provide custom solutions that align to the unique needs of every client, in a scalable way. We are a recently formed engineering group and a rapidly growing part of the business. RMS has multiple teams, in multiple locations, each with a clear mission. The mission of the Analytics & Reporting team is to give research leaders visibility into the internal operations of their team to empower evidence-driven decisions about the process, the tools and the team. This transparency is important in becoming more effective, in sustaining their effectiveness and in demonstrating their effectiveness to prospective partners. About the Role We’re seeking a Senior Full-Stack Software Engineer with experience in scalable, distributed system design and ideally, some familiarity with our core languages (Python, C++ & JavaScript). Experience of business intelligence or operational analytics would be helpful as our mission requires us to build a new analytics platform providing this. You will influence key technical decisions for us and thereby build a system that will influence key decisions and processes for our clients. We'll trust you to: Design and build core components of our analytics platform as part of a team. Lead projects and technical decision making. Ensure the team adopts best engineering practices across the entire SDLC. Collaborate with a broad set of stakeholders including your immediate team, the broader RMS group, other parts of the engineering community, sales, implementations, support, product managers and user experience experts. Support and mentor less experienced colleagues as appropriate. Embrace an inclusive approach to communication and collaboration. You'll need to have: Proven experience in software engineering, with a strong background in designing and building distributed systems or data platforms. Proficiency in an object-oriented language with a demonstrable ability to write production-quality code. Experience with OLTP and OLAP technologies and a demonstrable familiarity with query languages. Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate across interdisciplinary teams in a variety of locations. We'd love to see: Proficiency in Python, C++ and JavaScript Experience with, or an interest in, data visualisation and communicating insights as clearly and impactfully as possible. Familiarity with industry standard and open source analytics tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, Trino. Experience with semantic data modeling. Familiarity with container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes). title: Senior Software Engineer SFS Climate Analytics
description: Bloomberg is a global leader in business and financial information, delivering trusted data, news, and insights that bring transparency, efficiency, and fairness to capital markets. SFS — Sustainable Finance Solutions — refers to factors in evaluating the sustainability and associated potential financial performance of a company. SFS data is increasingly crucial for our clients – providing deeper intelligence about material financial impact than conventional financial analysis alone. Climate change, regulatory pressures, the importance of human capital, and diversity are just a few critical factors global investors consider to identify emerging risks and opportunities best. Mike Bloomberg speaks about SFS in the Bloomberg Impact report here. You can learn more about our climate analytics offering here . SFS Climate Analytics The Climate team was formed at the start of 2023. Climate change is a global problem for which Bloomberg wants to develop leading solutions. Our goal is to publish data & show analytics that inform how firms make environment-related investments. With each of our projects, we ask “what are the climate insights for our customers?”. In the past year, we built emissions pathways for 150K companies accurate to their industry and region. We added new carbon target indicators that allow analysts to download bulk data on 25K company carbon targets. To put it all together, we are working with Index on climate alignment scores to show how a company is performing today and in the future compared to their pathway and trend emissions forecast. All of our datasets need to be transparent, accurate to the methodology, and provide as wide coverage as possible. For Climate Alignment Scores, customers want to know if their portfolio is on track to decarbonize. It helps them evaluate which companies are aligned with a benchmark pathway in terms of their GHG emissions intensity. We need to fetch targets (company pledges to reduce emissions X% by Y year) from different internal and external sources and calculate datasets to answer different pledge types, benchmark comparisons, and year to year emissions. We will also have a terminal experience to allow analysts to explore the carbon targets. What's in it for you? Work with a variety of Bloomberg and open-source technologies including Python, Typescript, Argo, Docker, Redis, Comdb2, Postgres, Pytest, MyPy, Docker, Humio, and other proprietary technologies that will help get the job done Partner closely with our product stakeholders to understand and influence a vision for our products. Help establish an inclusive and well-rounded team culture which can scale up with a sense of community and mentorship. Design, architect and develop software components Leverage an agile approach to software development. Foster innovation by identifying opportunities to experiment and learn as we develop a scalable and reliable software stack for our product. Learn about interesting datasets including nature intactness ( link ) and carbon targets ( link ) You’ll need to have: Experience writing well tested enterprise software in Python Proven experience designing and building scalable, maintainable enterprise systems Familiarity with multi-layered architectures (e.g. service-oriented or microservices) Strong adherence to SOLID principles and design patterns Experience of applying CI/CD principles for better quality software The ability to contribute positively in an inclusive culture to a team with varied stakeholders Motivation to contribute to an engineering community beyond your team Experience working with Relational and NoSQL databases We'd love to see: Interest in the Sustainability and Climate domains A passion for making a positive difference in the world through technology Experience with full stack development and especially in the technical stack above Enthusiasm to lead, share new ideas, drive processes and technology frameworks with the team Eagerness for working with third-party/open-source technologies Experience with containerization and CI/CD solutions (e.g. Docker, Devise) Experience working with Pandas, Quantitative Analysis Experience working within the Scrum model Enthusiasm to lead, share new ideas, drive processes and technology frameworks with the team Discover what makes Bloomberg unique - watch our podcast series for an inside look at our culture, values, and the people behind our success.

title: Senior Technical Account Manager Semi Liquid Funds
description: Bloomberg runs on data. Our products are fueled by powerful information. We combine data and context to paint the whole picture for our clients, around the clock – from around the world. In Data, we are responsible for delivering this data, news, and analytics through innovative technology, quickly and accurately. We apply problem-solving skills to identify workflow efficiencies, and we implement technology solutions to enhance our systems, products, and processes. Our Team The Alternative Investment Funds team supports Bloomberg’s suite of private markets data from fund launch to liquidation, seed round to IPO, and all the data in between. Whether a fund investor, manager, or advisor, our team provides the data, solutions, and industry network to help clients take their analysis to the next level. Within this team, the Semi-Liquid Funds specialists focus on a rapidly growing segment of private markets that bridges traditional and alternative investment structures. This includes private Business Development Companies (BDCs), tender offer and interval funds, non-traded REITs, and emerging private wealth-accessible vehicles under 506(c) and 3(c)(7) exemptions. Our work ensures accurate, transparent, and timely delivery of data from these complex and innovative investment structures. You’ll combine relationship management with technical expertise to onboard new datasets, ensure high data quality, and develop scalable data workflows. You’ll partner with fund sponsors, administrators, and data providers to help Bloomberg capture the full universe of U.S. semi-liquid investment vehicles, including BDCs, tender offer funds, and non-traded REITs and you’ll help shape how this information is structured and delivered across the Bloomberg ecosystem. title: Senior Software Engineer IB Content Curation
description: Our mission is to redefine how professionals engage with their most important communications—cutting through noise with intelligent context, effortless access, and powerful discovery. We envision a future where every message is surfaced with clarity and purpose, enabling faster decisions and deeper understanding. Our current Product focus is the Instant Bloomberg (IB) Feed, a real-time aggregation view across messages in chatrooms, allowing our clients to engage with various conversations simultaneously, with customizable filtering and integrations with other IB workflows. This is a feature actively used by the majority of users across the Bloomberg Terminal. We’re actively working on re-architecting the IB Feed to support future Product innovations. The core architecture is powered by open-source technologies such as Apache Kafka, Solr and Cassandra , in conjunction with a lightweight UI application layer. This is a full-stack effort with many opportunities to drive impactful technical decisions. We also seek to improve Feed usability to deliver a streamlined, intuitive experience that enables clients to effortlessly tailor the Feed to their specific workflows. By extending IB’s content discovery offerings with new features, we aim to provide clients a seamless, cross-platform experience by integrating our solution with Mobile and Web clients, as well as other Terminal applications. By joining the team, you will have opportunities to work on  the instant messaging application used by every financial professional and make an impact on a cornerstone product in the Bloomberg Terminal Ecosystem. What’s in it for you: This is a rare opportunity to work on an impactful project where we reimagine one of the flagship Product offerings of Instant Bloomberg (IB). You will get to work with and deepen your expertise in open-source technologies such as Apache Solr and Kafka. Be at the forefront of making important technical decisions in re-archiecting a critical Product. Opportunities to drive Product innovations and develop a client-centric mindset. You will get to be on the ground floor of building an inclusive team and culture. You’ll need to have: 4+ years working experience with Java, C++ and TypeScript A Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, similar field of study or equivalent work experience. High degree of collaboration within the team and with our stakeholders Experience in distributed systems and architecture design What we’d love to see: Experience with search technologies, notably Apache Solr or ElasticSearch Experience with building real-time messaging streaming, notably Apache Kafka A strong sense of ownership and a passion to build user-centered products A desire to continuously grow as an individual and together with the team (architecture, testing, learning, developer experience) Salary Range = 160000 - 240000 USD Annually + Benefits + Bonus The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. title: Market Specialist Fixed Income Credit Singapore
description: Bloomberg is a global leader in business and financial information, news and insight, and we use innovative technology to deliver trusted data and bring transparency to the financial markets. Our customers around the globe rely on us for the information and tools they need to make critical investment decisions and remain connected across all sides of the financial community. And, to ensure the best experience for our 26,000+ employees across more than 150 locations around the world, we provide the spaces and systems that allow our teams to work together with agility, productivity and collaboration, no matter where they are. What's the role? Market Specialists support our Sales teams serving as subject matter experts within Bloomberg. On any given day in this role, you will be consulting with senior decision makers at client accounts, helping to close new sales opportunities, and providing critical feedback to help shape the development of our tools and services with the product management teams. By championing the Bloomberg Professional Service at market events and through printed material, you become the face of our company! The Market Specialists are comprised of a broad spectrum of individuals with varying backgrounds and skills with experience from the buy-side, sell-side, as well as market and industry participants. The team's core responsibility is not only to heighten our user base’s experience and impact sales revenue, but also play a vital role in improving the knowledge of our sales force, and are a dedicated source of client feedback for our product development teams. The team also highlight their market expertise through writing for a variety of publications or speaking at internal and external events. We'll trust you to: Utilise your strong market experience, detailed knowledge of industry trends, and demonstrated technical skills to drive revenue opportunities across our suite of solutions Act in an advisory capacity to our clients around the challenges that they face, and how they can use our products and technology to solve them Develop an in depth understanding of the competitor landscape and how this affects both internal and external customers Influence the direction of Bloomberg products through thought leadership, contribution on innovative ideas, and establishing relationships between Bloomberg's decisions makers and our clients Develop and establish your own road-map of initiatives based off your in depth understanding of markets, tools, and workflows that align with product, sales, and company goals, and then maintain check-in points, and self-report successes and challenges on these strategies Participate actively in new projects that drive departmental and firm-wide initiatives and goals Seek out additional ways to make an impact, such as mentoring, involvement in training, running campaigns, and active involvement in product enhancement You'll need to have: Minimum 7 years of client facing experience in Financial Services or a Financial Technology company Minimum 5 years' experience of Fixed Income in a buy-side (portfolio manager, strategist, senior analyst) or sell-side (sales, trading, structuring, senior research) capacity Experience leading senior level client conversations gained within the past 5 years Ability to work with Associations and Regulators to drive market and product development The ability to convey complex ideas and solutions in a simple and concise way to audiences both large and small Strong communication skills to be able to credibly lead senior level client conversations, gain insight into clients' enterprise workflow and promote Bloomberg solutions The business insight required to use your knowledge and experience to make good judgement and quick decisions to tangibly impact the commercial success of our business A reciprocal and commercial approach, along with the ability to operate within both departmental and company-wide initiatives, in a non-hierarchical structure without corporate titles An interest and ability to mentor, motivate, and guide junior salespeople, in order to scale our efforts across a broad client base Willingness to travel regularly across ASEAN Strong presentation, training, and communication skills in English Demonstrated continuous career growth within an organisation Bachelor’s degree or degree equivalent qualifications We'd love to see: A strong understanding of workflows across IG & HY Credit, FI Derivatives, and Money Markets Additional ASEAN language capability to effectively communicate with clients across the ASEAN region If this sounds like you: Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, , but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional/ Why Bloomberg? We’re individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and experiences who take on big challenges and create even bigger impact through our work. We’re interested in what makes you you, and how we can create opportunities for you to channel your unique, personal energy and grow to your fullest potential. Learn more about our office and benefits: Singapore | www.bloomberg.com/singapore Bloomberg is committed to improving the communities, cities and countries in which we work, and we support various initiatives including hiring and developing local talent. So, we may prioritise candidates with legal authorisation to work full-time in Singapore for this role, who do not require Bloomberg to sponsor their work authorization. Discover what makes Bloomberg unique - watch our podcast series for an inside look at our culture, values, and the people behind our success.

title: Tax Attorney Tax Planning
description: The energy of a newsroom, the pace of a trading floor, the buzz of a recent tech breakthrough; we work hard, and we work fast - while keeping up the quality and accuracy we're known for. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. Our culture is wide open, just like our spaces. We bring out the best in each other through collaboration. Through our countless volunteer projects, we also help network with the communities around us, too. You can do amazing work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else. It's up to you to make it happen. What’s the Role? Bloomberg Tax is seeking a highly skilled Tax Attorney or Tax Planning Professional to join our Strategy and Analysis team. This role will play a key part in leveraging in-depth research and analysis to address and resolve complex tax issues across Federal, International, and State & Local domains. We’ll trust you to: Identify and resolve Federal, International, and State and Local tax matters and related issues Provide research and assistance in cross border transactions, including analysis and planning Work with internal clients on tax planning and structuring matters and obtain relevant advice from domestic and foreign tax and legal advisers Prepare detailed planning and analysis memoranda Work with internal clients and outside advisors to implement planning structures Maintain up to date knowledge of Federal and State income tax developments Analyze financial statements, including foreign source income and tax credits Interface with the Accounting Group, other data providers, and internal stakeholders to gather information and provide informed guidance Participate in Federal income tax audits You’ll need to have: JD or MST 2-4 years of broad-based tax experience that includes research and planning matters and cross-border/international tax issues Self-starter that can work on tax planning and analysis projects Proven experience managing multiple projects simultaneously and effectively prioritizing tasks based on urgency In-depth familiarity with tax research techniques and resources Strong judgment in selecting the appropriate depth of analysis to support planning and documentation efforts Proficiency in evaluating the tax implications of complex documents, including vendor/customer agreements and investment partnership agreements Strong tax analytical skills necessary to apply tax technical concepts to complex transactions/structures and to provide understandable summaries to management and other tax department members Strong writing/verbal skills to prepare detailed planning memoranda and numerical analyses as well as to provide simple explanations to clients (e.g., non-tax specialists) and other department members Working knowledge of accounting for income taxes We’d Love to See: Tenure at a Big 4, Law firm, or Fortune 500 company LLM degree Experience handling tax issues for investment partnerships Does this sound like you? Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know that the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at: https://www.bloomberg.com/company/what-we-do/ Salary Range = 145000 - 205000 USD Annually + Benefits + Bonus The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. title: Vendor Risk Management Data Analytics Reporting Lead Chief Risk Office
description: The energy of a newsroom, the pace of a trading floor, the buzz of a recent tech breakthrough; we work hard, and we work fast - while keeping up the quality and accuracy we're known for. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. Our culture is wide open, just like our spaces. We bring out the best in each other through collaboration. Through our countless volunteer projects, we also help network with the communities around us, too. You can do amazing work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else. It's up to you to make it happen. Bloomberg’s Chief Risk Office (CRO) Department plays a critical role in supporting our businesses and operations around the world. We move quickly and thoughtfully to help address the risks that are inherent with being the world’s leading financial news and information company. Our team is made up of talented and hardworking professionals who think creatively and work collaborativel y in an open environment to deliver results, drive innovation, and solve difficult problems. Diversity and inclusion are essential to our success, and we strive to maintain an environment where our employees are empowered to make an impact. We also recognize the value of diversity and inclusion in cultivating a supportive workplace and the importance of giving back to our communities. The CRO team provides coverage of both Bloomberg's regulated entities and products, and Bloomberg's non-regulated products and services. Our focus is to address risks and related issues by providing risk management as a service, focusing on providing and delivering value to help businesses and departments thoughtfully incorporate risk into decision making. Vendor Risk Management (VRM) or third-party risk is part of the Chief Risk Office (CRO) and responsible for assisting Bloomberg departments and select subsidiaries of Bloomberg LP in the selection, assessment, mitigation, and continuous monitoring of risks introduced by vendors and other third-party service providers. What’s the Role? We are seeking a Vendor Risk Analytics & Reporting Lead to design and implement data-driven solutions that enable and enhance Bloomberg’s Vendor Risk Management program. This individual contributor role will focus on sourcing, integrating, and operationalizi ng internal and third-party data feeds to support automated risk i dentification, profiling, assessment, and continuous monitoring of vendor engagements - including owning and managing the Company’s Critical Vendor analysis and reporting. You will work closely with risk assessors, technology teams, and cross-function al stakeholders to ensure data is leveraged effectively to drive insights, improve decision-makin g, and strengthen Bloomberg’s third-party risk posture. We’ll Trust You To: Data Strategy & Integration * Help define and own our Critical Vendor data-based methodology, as well as other key TPRM reporting frameworks. Establish and implement KRIs and KPIs across our vendor risk program. * Identify and source internal and external data feeds relevant to vendor risk domains (e.g., InfoSec, privacy, resilience, regulatory). * Design and implement data pipelines and integration workflows to support automated risk profiling, scoring and continuous monitoring. * Collaborate with technology partners to ensure data architecture supports scalability, accuracy, and timeliness of risk insights. * Maintain data dictionaries, lineage documentation, and governance protocols to ensure transparency and consistency. Analytics & Reporting * Develop dashboards and reporting tools that provide actionable insights into vendor risk exposure, trends, and performance. * Support thematic and engagement-lev el risk assessments with data-driven analysis and v isualizations. * Partner with VRM leadership to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics for program effectiveness. * Deliver executive-read y reporting that supports strategic decision-makin g and regulatory compliance. Collaboration & Enablement * Work with Vendor Risk Managers to understand and take ownership of our TPRM data needs and help translate business requirements into technical solutions. * Partner with Enterprise Risk, Compliance, and Legal teams to ensure reporting aligns with broader risk frameworks and obligations. * Monitor industry trends and emerging technologies to continuously improve data capabilities and analytics maturity. * Contribute to the development of training materials and documentation to support adoption of analytics tools across the VRM team. You’ll Need to Have: * Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Information Systems, Risk Management, or equivalent industry experience. * Extensive experience in vendor risk management and/or data analytics roles, with a focus on third party data integration and reporting. * Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., QlikSense, Power BI) and analytics platforms. * Experience with data engineering tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Python, ETL frameworks). * Familiarity with third-party risk domains and vendor risk assessment methodologies. * Understanding of regulatory requirements and frameworks (e.g., GDPR, DORA, NIST, ISO). * Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights. * Experience working in cross-function al environments and managing multiple stakeholder priorities. * Please note we use years of experience as a guide but we certainly will consider applications from all candidates who are able to demonstrate the skills necessary for the role. We’d Love to See: * Experience building automated risk scoring models or continuous monitoring solutions. * Familiarity with vendor risk platforms and tools (e.g., Archer, ServiceNow, SIG, VSAQ). * Knowledge of cloud-based data architectures and security practices. * Experience supporting regulatory audits or compliance reporting related to third-party risk. Salary Range = 130000 - 180000 USD Annually + Benefits + Bonus The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level. We offer one of the most comprehensive and generous benefits plans available and offer a range of total rewards that may include merit increases, incentive compensation (exempt roles only), paid holidays, paid time off, medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, life insurance, and various wellness programs, among others. The Company does not provide benefits directly to contingent workers/contractors and interns. title: Senior QA Analyst ET Quality Engineering
description: Description & Requirements Who we are We are the engineering team behind the world’s largest over-the-counter (OTC) electronic trading (ET) platform, encompassing Fixed Income securities, Commodities, Currencies, Derivatives, and Equities. Our platform provides end-to-end solutions across the trading life cycle, enabling traders to connect more successfully to the global markets — all in one place. The Electronic Trading Quality Engineering (ETQE) Team is looking for a Senior QA Analyst to design and execute tests, contribute to automation, and deliver high-quality software at all stages of the SDLC and post-deployment. You will work closely with Product and Application Engineers to feature test and take ownership of both end-to-end feature testing and automated testing of client trading workflows. What you’ll do Test Strategy & Planning: Design accurate, thorough test strategies and plans, leveraging deep domain, regulatory, and technical expertise to ensure superior product quality. Feature & Requirements Validation: Collaborate with Product Managers and Engineers to understand functional requirements, actively contributing to and constructively challenging them when appropriate. Manual & Automated Testing : Execute testing across manual and automated methodologies, ensuring robust coverage across workflows. End-to-End Ownership : Take responsibility for the full testing lifecycle of trading products, including feature, integration, regression, and end-to-end testing. Operational Resiliency: Validate system resiliency by testing performance, load, concurrency, edge cases, and race conditions. Automation & Metrics : Collaborate with engineering teams to deliver automated testing, integrate feature usage metrics, and align automated test coverage with risk areas. Risk & Communication: Proactively identify risks, communicate them clearly, and work with stakeholders on mitigation strategies. Usability & Quality : Assess product quality from an end-user perspective, recommending enhancements that improve usability and client experience. Mentorship & Leadership: Mentor team members on domain expertise, testing processes, usability, and End-to-End testing best practices. Stakeholder Collaboration: Build strong relationships across Product, Engineering, and external clients/systems to drive alignment on quality goals. Continuous Improvement : Contribute to the broader vision of continuous testing and continuous deployment. You’ll need to have 4+ years of relevant work experience in the financial services industry, ideally in financial markets and/or electronic trading. Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field. Excellent organization and communication skills. Strong problem-solving skills and a demonstrated ability to collaborate across multiple stakeholder teams. Passion for testing and delivering quality software at speed. We’d love to see Experience testing electronic trading workflows. Knowledge of Behavior-Driven Development (BDD). Experience with automated backend and UI testing frameworks. Project Management experience Working directly with external clients Salary Range = 135000 - 160000 USD Annually + Benefits + Bonus The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level. We offer one of the most comprehensive and generous benefits plans available and offer a range of total rewards that may include merit increases, incentive compensation (exempt roles only), paid holidays, paid time off, medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, life insurance, and various wellness programs, among others. The Company does not provide benefits directly to contingent workers/contractors and interns. title: Active Directory Windows Engineer
description: Our Team : The Global Corporate Technology Group is responsible for designing, deploying, and supporting Bloomberg’s enterprise IT systems. This includes our global corporate network plus all hardware, software and enterprise applications used by nearly 21,000 employees in more than 170 state-of-the-art offices around the world. We focus on enterprise solutions, productivity tools, and IT systems integration which helps move all of Bloomberg's businesses forward. As part of the Server & Storage team, a key  responsibility is ensuring all Active Directory services are available and functional.  We are also managing the lifecycle of the Infrastructure enterprise systems and the security components. Role Summary : We are seeking a skilled and experienced Windows Active Directory (AD) Engineer to design, implement, secure, and maintain our enterprise Active Directory environment. This role requires deep expertise in AD architecture, Group Policy management, domain services, and integration with identity-related services such as ADFS, Azure AD, and conditional access. The ideal candidate will also support the organization's efforts to modernize and secure its identity infrastructure. Key Responsibilities : Architect, implement, and maintain enterprise-scale Active Directory environments, including forests, domains, trusts, and replication strategies. Serve as a Domain Administrator with privileged access to Domain Controllers, responsible for managing directory infrastructure (FSMO roles, Kerberos KDCs, replication topology), overseeing schema modifications and trust relationships, creating and managing top-level OU hierarchies with appropriate security permissions and GPO linkages, monitoring and securing the domain root and Domain Controllers OU. Lead disaster recovery planning and execution for schema, trust, and domain-level incidents. Administer Group Policy at the domain root and Domain Controllers OU, ensuring compliance and security. Perform secure remote administration of Domain Controllers and member servers. Coordinate alarm distribution and security event monitoring with OU Admins. Plan and manage all AD and Domain Controller migrations and upgrades. Ensure compliance with regulatory and auditing requirements in a highly secure environment. You'll need to have : 4+ years of proven experience in software delivery automation and architecting complex Active Directory environments. Deep expertise in the Windows Server platform and supporting identity services, including Active Directory, GPO, DNS, DHCP, and Certificate Authorities (CAs). Strong knowledge of identity lifecycle management and authentication protocols (Kerberos, NTLM). Expertise designing and implementing AD forests, domains, trusts, and replication strategies. Extensive hands-on experience utilizing and administering CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitHub, Octopus). Strong programming and scripting proficiency in PowerShell or Intermediate programming proficiency in python or equivalent language (Advanced PowerShell acceptable alternative). Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools (Terraform, Ansible, Chef, or Salt) and applying DevOps principles. Comprehensive knowledge of Windows Server operating systems. Familiarity with monitoring and logging tools (e.g., Grafana, Humio). Solid understanding of security best practices, change management, and backup/recovery strategies in AD. Experience working in regulated environments with an emphasis on compliance and auditing. Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment. Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a similar field of study, or equivalent work experience. We'd Love to See : Hybrid Identity: Hands-on experience with Azure AD, Azure AD Connect, and Conditional Access policies. Authentication & Integration: Familiarity with MFA, SSO, and federation technologies (e.g., ADFS, SAML, OAuth). Experience integrating AD with other platforms (e.g., Linux, SaaS applications). Security Operations: Experience with enterprise-wide EDR or Antivirus deployment and maintenance. Certifications: Microsoft certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Identity and Access Administrator Associate or Azure Solutions Architect. Mindset: A strong documentation focus, excellent verbal communication skills, and a mindset for proactive problem-solving and continuous improvement. Experience with third-party identity and privilege access management tools (e.g., CyberArk, BeyondTrust). Familiarity with Zero Trust architecture and conditional access models. Exposure to incident response, AD forensics, and ITIL-based change management processes. Salary Range = 130000 - 225000 USD Annually + Benefits + Bonus The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level. We offer one of the most comprehensive and generous benefits plans available and offer a range of total rewards that may include merit increases, incentive compensation (exempt roles only), paid holidays, paid time off, medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, life insurance, and various wellness programs, among others. The Company does not provide benefits directly to contingent workers/contractors and interns. title: Enterprise Data Content Specialist Enterprise Services Financial Solutions
description: What is Bloomberg Enterprise Data? Bloomberg's Enterprise Data Department develops data offerings that are considered best in class by the capital markets community.  Across real time market data, reference data, historical pricing data, and unique analytics, we deliver: - The most comprehensive and highest quality content in the industry. - Distribution that is flexible, reliable, fast, and easy to onboard. - Easy to use data that is ready for analysis. These mission critical datasets serve as the primary source of information across the front, middle, and back office at the most respected firms across the globe. Firms that commit to utilizing only highest-quality data can eliminate the data inconsistencies inherent to working with multiple vendors and lower their costs overall. A partnership with Bloomberg Enterprise Data allows just this, giving them strategic advantage. What's the role? Our Content Specialists serve as the primary point of contact for the data-related needs of Bloomberg Enterprise Data (ED) customers. As a liaison between the customer, ED teams and other Bloomberg colleagues, you will maintain ownership of all client data content during the pre-sales and onboarding process. You should be an expert in assessing customer and application content needs, including feature sets, instrument universes and fields based on current and intended uses and marry those against Bloomberg's extensive data offerings. Including both real time market data and reference data services. You'll be collaborating across the organization to obtain clarification on data field behaviors and availability.  At times, you'll also instigate dialogue with internal and external business units in order to fill content gaps identified as a result of your analysis. You'll possess outstanding communication, analytical and organisational skills, facing off to clients as well as multiple internal groups with the overall intent of driving success for the Company and delivering world class service to our clients. We'll trust you to: - Deeply partner with client data and technical stakeholders to fully understand their data content needs and use cases - Ensure the client’s data requirements are available and work with the client on creative solutions, if gaps exist - Understand the clients’ data distribution requirements and areas for growth, working closely with sales and technical account managers - Develop a deep understanding of Bloomberg data delivery mechanisms in order to demonstrate the most suitable option that meets the clients needs - Provide new client training on the Bloomberg data model and client facing tools - Manage application content migrations for all of Bloomberg's Enterprise Products - Coordinate and interact with data origination teams and Product Managers to obtain clarification on field definition/behaviour and instrument availability - Ensure the shortest possible time to application go-live while maintaining high standards of work practices You'll need to have: - 5+ years experience working with financial market data within financial services or data-intensive organisations - Familiarity with different security/instrument identifiers and their applicability across different asset classes - Good understanding of financial instruments across different asset classes: equities, fixed income, commodities, mortgages, and derivatives, in addition to that, preferably specialisation in one asset class - Familiarity with functions at both buyside and sellside organizations, understanding the different market players and their data/application needs - High level proficiency in Microsoft Office Products (specifically Excel) - Strong customer service, communication, and presentation skills, most importantly, a client facing role - Analytical, with great organization and strong problem-solving skills We’d love to see: - Familiarity with the main OMS, PMS, TMS, and Risk systems - Working proficiency with a programming language, ideally SQL - Up to date industry knowledge on data trends - Previous knowledge and understanding of Enterprise data products is advantageous Discover what makes Bloomberg unique - watch our podcast series for an inside look at our culture, values, and the people behind our success.

title: Operational Resilience Communications Lead
description: Bloomberg is seeking an Operational Resilience Communications Lead to own and drive the firm’s resilience-related communications strategy. This role will lead a small global team to work cross functionally with Business Leads, Engineering, Information Security, Security Operations, Incident Management, Legal, Risk, Compliance, Corporate Communications, and Client-Facing teams and ensure that messaging, whether during service disruptions or in steady-state, is timely, accurate, and aligned across internal teams, clients, and regulators. The ideal candidate brings both strategic crisis communications expertise and the ability to execute swiftly in fast-moving situations. We’ll trust you to: - Lead all aspects of OpRes communication activities, including incident response messaging, proactive awareness campaigns, and post-incident updates. - Maintain and operationalize the OpRes Communications Playbook, including the creation and maintenance of templates, trackers, and pre-approved messaging and communication playbooks for various incident types (e.g., engineering incidents, data breaches, malware, or physical security breaches). - Own coordination across all incident types, in partnership with incident management teams, driving incident response calls, gathering facts, assessing impact, and determining the appropriate response strategy, including stakeholder engagement and communications. - Support stakeholder communications: - Internal: Share clear updates on incident status, potential risks, and recommended actions. - External: Provide timely and transparent information on impact, mitigation steps, resolution progress, and post-incident reports. - Act as liaison across teams handling client, regulatory, and resilience-related communications to maintain consistent messaging under tight deadlines. - Drive Post-Incident Improvement: Lead after-action reviews to evaluate communication effectiveness and identify opportunities to refine playbooks and processes. - Document & Measure: Maintain records of incident communication activities, including timelines, messages, approvals, and stakeholder feedback. - Define and monitor KPIs to evaluate the effectiveness of response and preparedness programs. You’ll need to have: - 10+ years in technical or operational response teams, as well as 5 years in leadership and people management. - Outstanding communication and judgement under pressure, with the ability to make sound decisions on limited information. - Strong organizational and project management skills, with the ability to track multiple workstreams simultaneously. - Experience working in a matrixed, global organization; strong collaboration skills, able to engage and influence all levels of management including C-suite and the Board, cross-functional teams, vendors, and regulators. - Comfortable balancing strategic direction with hands-on execution. - Skilled communicator capable of distilling technical information into clear, audience-appropriate messages. - Crisis-tested leadership, experience in managing high stakes communications with calm and sound judgment. We’d love to see: - Familiarity of DORA, UK CTP regulations or similar regulatory frameworks. - Experience in Regulatory or working on regulatory / compliance projects or programs. - Strong collaborator who understands the complexity of engaging with multiple audiences and navigating their diverse interests and goals. - Experience with risk and control management frameworks from a first and/or second line perspective. Discover what makes Bloomberg unique - watch our podcast series for an inside look at our culture, values, and the people behind our success.

title: Technical Support Specialist BTS Bloomberg Financial Solutions
description: Resumes must be submitted in English to be considered Bloomberg is a global leader in business and financial information, news and insight, and we use innovative technology to deliver trusted data and bring transparency to the financial markets. Our customers around the globe rely on us for the information and tools they need to make critical investment decisions and remain connected across all sides of the financial community. And, to ensure the best experience for our 20,000+ employees across 176 offices globally, we provide the spaces and systems that allow our teams to work together with agility, productivity and collaboration, no matter where they are. The Bloomberg Financial Solutions department of 5,000+ employees is at the forefront of ensuring success for our customers and employees alike. Our team comprises several key pillars: sales, service, operations, culture and brand. As a department, we are united by a common goal: We create meaningful relationships with clients by understanding their needs and delivering exceptional end-to-end support from sales and implementation, through their ongoing relationship with Bloomberg. Our Team: The Bloomberg Technical Support team consists of self-driven, technical individuals that provide support for a wide range of Bloomberg products across multiple technologies. The team operates on a global level, ensuring seamless and uninterrupted support for clients 24/7 in English, while also ensuring local language support during respective business hours. What's The Role? As a Bloomberg Technical Support specialist, you will deliver technical solutions to new and existing Bloomberg clients. You will learn about the ins-and-outs of the backend Bloomberg technical infrastructure that leads the global Fintech industry. You will leverage your in-depth technical skills and soft skills to deliver clients access to wide-ranging Bloomberg products across multiple technologies. You will support clients over the phone, chat, email, and in-person to ensure the highest quality of service to our clients. If you wish to be involved in an exciting, fast-paced opportunity that allows you to fully utilize your communication, technical, and problem-solving skills while gaining insight into the global financial markets - then this may be the opportunity for you. We'll Trust You To: * Effectively prioritize a high volume of calls, instant message and tickets, while also addressing team related tasks and initiatives. * Thrive in a fast paced team, whilst demonstrating adaptability in a constantly evolving environment. * Foster strong client relationships, understanding client needs, provide technical support, and maximize customer satisfaction. * Collaborate with internal teams at different levels and across regions to resolve complex issues while maintaining effective communication and ensuring consistent adherence to company standard. * Support the Bloomberg Terminal, office tools (API) and services in our client’s environment encompassing advanced software troubleshooting. * Support Bloomberg’s private IP network including connectivity of customer Bloomberg routers, Enterprise servers, FIX connections and SFTP. * Deliver support for Bloomberg products operating in Virtual environments (VMWare, Citrix, Hyper-V, AWS) ensuring seamless functionality. * Understand core business objectives and help achieve them through daily proactive outreach to clients for licenses, hardware, software, and network set-ups/upgrades. You'll Need to Have: Technical Skills * Fluency in English and Portuguese * (3+) years of relevant professional experience in a Technical Support role. * Hands-on experience with Microsoft Windows and macOS environments, including configuration and troubleshooting performance issues using Windows troubleshooting tools (Task Manager, Event Viewer, Windows Tools). * Familiarity with common software applications such as MS Office, antivirus programs, and other enterprise applications and proficiency in using diagnostics and repair tools. * Understanding of hardware components (CPU, RAM, hard drives, GPUs) and configuration of various systems including laptops, desktops, and peripherals. * Understanding of network protocols and tools, such as but not limited to: SFTP, ICMP, TCP, UDP, BGP, RIP, DNS, DHCP, IPv4, IPv6, ping, traceroute, and netstat. * Practical experience with networking principles including LAN, WAN, TCP/IP, DNS, BGP, subnetting, and firewalls. * Understanding connectivity types, such as but not limited to: Ethernet, Fiber, VPN, Wired WAN, Wireless WAN. Soft Skills * Ability to communicate technical concepts clearly and concisely, adapting communication styles to suit customer needs. * Demonstrates ownership and taking initiative, and accountability; and providing update to end users or internal and external parties. * A focus on customer satisfaction and the ability to handle customer issues with empathy. * Desire to learn new technologies, tools, and industry practices. * Ability to analyze the business impact of customer issues and prevents them from spreading further. We'd Love to See: * CompTIA A+, Network+, CCNA, Microsoft or industry standard related certifications. * Knowledge of router commands (Cisco, Juniper, Arista). * Setting up & troubleshooting virtual environments (VMware, Citrix). * Exposure to vendor cloud technology (AWS, Azure). * Knowledge of add-ins, macro, and VBA. * Experience with FIX protocol and SFTP. * Fluency in Spanish What its Like To Work Here? We work hard. We are ambitious and set ourselves tough business goals. We are a meritocracy where everyone has a voice - not a job title. Working with people you trust, respect, and can collaborate with is more important than titles or position. Things move fast, and we want people who will enjoy working in this environment and feed off the energy. But it isn’t all about work. Giving back is one of our core values, and there are many ways to get involved in philanthropic initiatives from helping local school kids with their reading to helping clean up local parks and waterways.
